loans.name: Kasuku Group

texts.en:
Juma M., 41, is married with four boys. He works outside Dar es Salaam selling secondhand clothing at his stand. The business has been running for one year, and he usuA. takes in about $140 a month. He works from 8:00 am to 9:00 pm daily.

Juma has already paid off one loan succesfully from Tujijenge, and with this loan from Kiva he hopes to purchase a wider variety of clothes for his stand. Juma is in a group with 22 other members. Each member owns and operates their own businesses, and they will share the loan among themselves according to their needs. The group also acts as a guarantee, because each member is responsible for another. This way, the repayment of the loan is always ensured.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for his stand

loans.name: Reine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Reine D. is married to Dodji Dansou, who is a diesel mechanic and polygamous. She was born around the year 1972 in Cotonou in the department of Littoral, and has lived in the Ménontin district for 5 years. Trained as a seamstress, she also runs a secondary business in food service and selling of cosmetic products. Selling cosmetic products has taken priority over her other activities and her clientele has grown. Faced with an ever-growing demand for cosmetic products, and not having sufficient financial means, she had to request loans for support. Mrs. Reine D. is requesting her third loan from Alidé in hope of satisfying her numerous customers.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

Mariée à DANSOU Dodji polygame et mécanicien diéséliste, dame D. Reine est née vers les années 1972 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral et réside au quartier Ménontin depuis 5 ans. Couturière de formation, elle mène comme activités secondaires la restauration et la vente de produits cosmétiques. La vente de produits cosmétiques a pris le pas sur les autres activités et ses clients sont devenus plus nombreux. Face à la demande sans cesse de croissante de produits cosmétiques et ne disposant pas de moyens financiers assez important elle a dû recourir au prêt. Dame D. Reine sollicite son troisième prêt à Alidé en vue de satisfaire ses nombreux clients.

loans.use: Purchase of three dozen hairpieces, three dozen beauty products and six pieces of pagne (dyed clothing fabrics)

loans.name: Osareyekemwen

texts.en: Osareyekemwen O. is 28 years old, married with four children and lives Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She makes a living selling foodstuffs such as melons, vegetables, oil and rice. Before opening her shop in 2001, she studied this business for five months. Osareyekemwen needs a loan of $600 to buy more food items to sell. This will help to boost her income, and she wishes to thank her lenders for making that possible.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell.

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Mr. Tuy R., 32, is single and lives with his parents, who live in a small village across from the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. He has eight brothers and sisters, and his parents grow rice in the village.

Mr. Tuy has been a mason for two years. Besides construction work, he also farms. Currently he and his parents lack the money for his farming business. Therefore, Tuy is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase water pipe line, fertilizer, rice seed and pesticide for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase water pipe line, fertilizer, rice seed and pesticide for growing rice.

loans.name: Sitoga

texts.en: Sitoga L., 36, is married with 2 children.  She has many yea(s of experience in the taro and banana plantation business. She sells to the general public and the villagers 2 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Sitoga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to purchase wire for a fence, a sack of fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.use: Purchase wire for a fence, a sack of fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Roath

texts.en:
Mrs. Roath T. was born in 1981. She now lives in Ream Andeik Village in Takeo Province.

She owns a small piece of land on which she plants rice so she can earn a living. Her husband Mr. Loem Kong is a duck breeder.

Although Mrs. Roath T. and her husband have different businesses, they still cannot support their family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Roath T. has decided to ask for a loan so she can buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to eventually increase her income by selling her cow.

Mrs. Roath T. has three children. Her youngest child is only a year old and too young to work or study. Two of the children attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Salimatou Habibou

texts.fr: Salimatou Habibou D., 49 ans, mariée, 10 enfants  en charge est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter des denrées alimentaires pour renforcer  son activité de restauration. Ses revenus lui permettent de contribuer aux dépenses familiales  Elle sollicite un  prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Salimatou Habibou D., age 49, is married and has ten children to look after. She has been a member of the village loan group Sinthiang Coundara for five and a half years. She wants to buy grocery items to bolster her catering business. Her income enables her to help cover family expenses. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acheter des denrées alimentaires pour approvisionner son restaurant.

loans.name: Sor Erlinda Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Sor Erlinda tiene 42 años de edad, habita en el barrio Omar Torrijos en la capital de Managua, estado civil casada su esposo es ingeniero civil, tiene dos hijos de 12 y 15 años de edad ambos están estudiando, sus planes para su familia  es ofrecerle un mejor futuro, un patrimonio a sus hijos. Doña Sor Erlinda posee su pequeño negocio de ropa usada desde hace seis años, que brinda diferente variedad de ropa y otros productos a sus clientes los clientes comprar mucho la ropa de segunda mano por que es de buena calidad y accesible al bolsillo de las familias, inicio con fondos propio. Sus metas para su negocio es incrementar el volumen de venta con nuevos productos y mayores cantidades que  generarán mayores ganancias. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar productos como: zapatos, juguetes, materiales escolares, productos que aumentaran las ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sor Erlinda is 42 years old and lives in the Omar Torrijos neighborhood of Managua. She is married and her husband is a civil engineer. She has two children ages 12 and 15, both of whom are in school. Her plans for her family are to provide a better future and a legacy for her children. Sor Elinda has owned a small used clothing business for 6 years, providing a variety of clothing and other products to her customers. Her customers buy a lot of second hand clothing because it is good quality and economical for families. She began this business with her own savings. Her goals are to increase her volume of sales with new products and greater quantities that will result in larger profits. Thanks to Afodenic’s loans she will be able to buy products such as: shoes, toys, school materials, and other products that increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes, toys and other products

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married to her loving and responsible husband Editho; together they have two children: 14-year-old John Glenn, in high school, and 11-year-old Dennis Mark, in elementary school. Teresita's husband's farm is their family's main source of income, providing for their immediate needs and supporting the education for the children.

Teresita helps supplement this income through her village store, which she started four years ago. Along with selling basic commodities in their neighborhood, she also ventured into the direct selling business of different products such as NATASHA, AVON, BOARD WALK and MSE. She is now applying for a loan of PHP 8000 (175 USD) to improve her business.

Teresita believes that she can achieve her dreams little by little by working hard. Together, she and her husband face the future with confidence.

loans.use: Additional capital to improve her business

loans.name: Narcisa Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra., Narcisa es una mujer que ha logrado esforzarse desde muy joven ha trabajado para apoyar a su familia, vende granos básicos, productos lácteos, y variedad que ofrece a sus clientes. Inicio con fondos propios vendiendo golosinas, ahora ha crecido y tiene una pequeña pulpería surtida, doña Narcisa tiene 57 años de edad,  con dos hijas mayores de edad que están casada, reside en reparto los V., ahora hace préstamo en Afodenic esta es su segunda solicitud que ha sido de  beneficio para incrementar su inventario, con este crédito va a comprar granos básicos, productos enlatados, y otros que son de utilidad diario del cliente. Sus planes a futuro es hacer más grande el local de la venta.
texts.en:
Narcisa is a woman who has been successful trying her best since she was young to work to support her family. She sells basic grains, dairy products, and a variety of other goods that she offers her customers. She began with her own funds from selling candy, and now her business has grown and she has a small, well-stocked store. Dona Narcisa is 57 years old and has two grown daughters who are both married. The V. family lives in Reparto and this loan is now her second request from Kiva partner Afodenic that she benefited from to increase her inventory. With this loan, she is going to purchase basic grains, canned products, and other goods that her customers use on a daily basis. Her future plans are to expand the size of her store.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains and canned products

loans.name: Máximo

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León el señor Máximo A. se dedica a su negocio de venta de artesanías como lo son alcancías elaboradas con barro las cuales son comercializadas en su puesto de venta que con mucho esfuerzo posee.

El motivo por el cual ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito para la compra de las mercancías puesto que se le están agotando y requiere adquirirlas de inmediato para así continuar con su negocio en su localidad.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Telicia of the city of León, Máximo A. dedicates himself to his business in the sale of handicrafts, particularly clay piggy banks which he sells at his sales stand which he owns after much effort. The reason for which Máximo is looking for the support from Ceprodel is to obtain a loan to purchase merchandise given that his stock is running out and he needs to acquire more immediately to be able to continue running his business in his locale.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase handicrafts.

loans.name: Maria Jesús

texts.en:
Maria Jesus is married and has 5 children. All of her kids are in school, the 2 eldest are in high school and the rest are in elementary school. Her husband works in construction in Guatemala City. Maria Jesus weaves traditional fabrics and also raises chickens. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase more animals and also to buy food and grain for the chickens. In addition she needs to buy more thread for her weaving. Her dream is to be able to invest more in her businesses and that her children continue to study.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Bouch, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Jesus es casada y tiene 5 hijos. Los dos mayores estudian secundaria y los menores también están en la escuela. Su esposo trabaja en construcción en la ciudad. Ella se dedica hacer tejidos típicos y también tiene crianza de pollos. Su crédito lo necesita para comprar mas animales y también la comida de sus animales como concentrado y mucho mas. Además quiere comprar hilos para sus tejidos. Sus sueños son invertir mas en sus negocios y que sus hijos sigan estudiando.

loans.use: Thread for weaving and food for animals

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Мухайё женщина , которая кредитуется уже третий год. Она занимается продажей детской одежды.Товар завозит с Истаравшана.Её оборотный капитал с каждым займом увеличивается , а также и уровень жизни семьи улучшается.Она в сезон привозит нужный товар.Поэтому следующий займ она хочет потратить для завоза весенне-летнего ассортимента детской одежды.
texts.en:
Muhayo has been a borrower for three years. She sells children's clothing. The goods are transported from Istaravshan. Her turnover capital increases with each loan, and her family's quality of life improves. She buys the goods needed for each season, so she wants to use this next loan on the spring and summer inventory of children's clothing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Children's clothing sales

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El presente comité OÑONDIVEPA de la ciudad de Limpio barrio Piquete Cue actualmente se encuentran en el 4to ciclo del programa de Fundacion Paraguaya. Cabe destacar que el comité en cada seguimiento demuestra muchas ganas de emprender nuevas metodología de actividades. (cumpleaños, rifas, exposiciones entre otras).

La señora Esmilda comenta que a pesar de la crisis financiera el grupo se muestra muy fortalecido, teniendo como valores; la respònsabilidad, puntualidad y confianza. Unas de las actividades mas fuerte desarrolladas es la venta de articulos de primera necesidad, y la fabricacion y venta de comestibles (tarta, tortas, alfajores, sopa.. etc).

El comité OÑONDIVEPA agradece infinitamente a la Fundacion Paraguaya y Kiva por la ayuda, y seguimiento brindada. 

El comite tiene dos integrantes que estan ahorrando este ciclo y no retiraron credito.  Las integrantes del comite son: 

1 Lucia R., peluquera                                                                   
2 Rafaela B., modista                                                              
3 Rosa C., venta de bebidas y prod. Avon                         
4 Leila Gimenez, merceria                                         
5 Liz Cañete, trabj. De serigrafia                                                     
6 Maria P., despensa                                                            
7 Benigna P., ventas de lenceria                                             
8 Esmilda R., venta de comestibles                                    
9 Cecilia P., venta de pollos                                                   
10Francisca N. D. , venta de bebidas y helados                  
11 Delia R., venta de bebidas                                                  
12 Maria E. T., despensa                                                          
13 Clelia R., venta de comestibles              
14 Mercedes L., cantinera                                                   
15 Liliana C., venta de tarjeta mini carga                                  
16 Victorina V. Vda. de R., kiosko                                               
17 Lilian B., venta de helado y hielo
texts.en:
The Oñondivepa group is from Limpio city in the Piquete Cue neighborhood, and is currently in the fourth loan cycle of the Fundacion Paraguaya. It is worth noting that at every follow up the group shows a great desire to try new methods in their activities (birthdays, raffles, expositions and others). Esmilda says that despite the financial crisis, the group shows itself to be strong with values like responsibility, punctuality, and confidence. Some of the strongest activities they have developed are the sale of basic needs items and making food to sell (cake, sandwiches, sweets, soup, etc.) The Oñondivepa group is infinitely grateful to the Fundacion Paraguaya and Kiva for the help and follow up offered. The group members are: 1 Lucia R., Hairdresser 2 Rafaela B., Dressmaker 3 Rosa C., Sells drinks and Avon products 4 Leila Gimenez, Notions Store 5 Liz Cañete, Silk Screening 6 Maria P., Store 7 Benigna P., Lingerie Sales 8 Esmilda R., Food Sales 9 Cecilia P., Sells Chicken 10Francisca N. D. , Sells Drinks and Ice Cream 11 Delia R., Sells Drinks 12 Maria E. T., Store 13 Clelia R., Food Sales 14 Mercedes L., Runs a Cafeteria 15 Liliana C., Sells Mini Charge Cards 16 Victorina V. Vda. de R., Kiosko 17 Lilian B., Sells Ice Cream and Ice

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise, mini charge cards, and other things

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Beatriz, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas” ubicado  del  distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; Tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera de 6 hijos,  tiene estudios de segundaria  completa. Vive en el Barrio San Miguel.

Ella trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 04 años.  Se dedica la compra venta de abarrotes.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/.  300.00 nuevos soles.

Con este préstamo de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, comprará más productos para surtir su bodega, comprará arroz, leche, aceite, azúcar, etc.
Su sueño es poner una tienda más grande y surtida, así podrá obtener mayores ganancias.
 
A ella le gusta el incentivo al ahorro y los encuentros organizados por la institución Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Beatriz belongs to the Micaela Bastidas Community Bank located in the Llave district in Collao province in the Puno department. She is 47 years old and is a single mother to six children. She has completed high school. She lives in the San Miguel neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for four years. She is dedicated to selling groceries. Her first loan was for 300 soles. With this loan of 600 soles, she will purchase more products to stock her store. She will buy rice, milk, oil, sugar, etc. Her dream is create a store that is bigger and well stocked in order to obtain greater earnings. She likes the incentive to save and the meetings organized by the Manuela Ramos institution.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, milk, oil and sugar.

loans.name: Guloglan

texts.en:
A livestock breeder for 18 years, Guloglan M. is 43. He is married and responsible for four people including his wife and three children.

Very dynamic, serious, and entrepreneurial, he is proposing to expand his flock by purchasing more cattle. This will enable him to meet the needs of a rather large clientele from his village and its neighborhood.

With this goal in mind, Guloglan is requesting a loan that will serve him as business capital. The profit he will make from this business will allow him to improve the living conditions for his household and also make some investments.

loans.use: To purchase three baby calves

loans.name: Razak

texts.en:
Razak T. is single with no dependent and has received schooling through junior high. He is a young barber who uses an old barbering machine in barbering his clients at S.K. Park in Hohoe, which he has done since 2006.

Razak will use the loan to buy modern barbering machines and a sterilizer for his sharp equipment. With the new profits from his expanded business, he plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy modern barbering machines and a sterilizer for his sharp equipment

loans.name: Kaku

texts.en:
Kaku N. is in the business of selling fish at the market and has requested a loan to stock more fish to sell.  Kaku is 31 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 6 children who attend school.  With the extra profits generated through her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a net and a boat for fishing. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy and stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. sells bags of salt at Ateku near Elmina. Mary has received no formal education. She is married and has no children. Her husband is a farmer.

Mary has been selling bags of salt since 1988. She is responsible for paying for food. Her loan will be used to buy more salt for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: buy more salt for resale

loans.name: Omolara

texts.en: Omolara makes a living selling spare parts, and works with her husband, who taught her this trade. They have been in business for five years and are able to provide for their family. Omolara is 29 years old and has one child. She hopes for a loan of N140,000 to buy more spare parts in bulk, so that she can meet customer demand.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en: Eseta T. (0) is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Lano. She is married and has four school-aged children. Eseta owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 200 WST a month. In 2008, Eseta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Eseta is now requesting a new loan of 1,000 WST which will again be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Señor De Bombori Group

texts.es: Es un grupo muy antiguo, muy responsables en sus pagos, viven en un mismo Barrio, donde se conocen bien. Su grupo se llama "SEÑOR  DE BOMBORI", el Banco de Emprendimiento esta en su 9º Ciclo, la  mesa directiva esta conformada por socias que son estrictas en su cobranza, son muy unidas entre ellas,  como presidenta esta  la señora Maria  Elena H. A., ella es lider de su grupo, vende dulces y juguetes en la puerta de un colegio, vive en casa familiar tiene 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja como  taxista libre. Como tesorera esta la socia Maria Sonia R. M. quien es tambien socia antigua, muy responsable y  sociable. Esta casada y tiene 2 hijos. Tiene su kiosko en donde vende una variedad de refrigerios y masitas (pasteles) y por la noche vende pizzas; el credito lo utiliza para  aumento de capital para su kiosko. Como secretaria esta la socia Jenny C. A. quien es una socia joven, es madre soltera de un hijo, vende cosmeticos por catalogos y entrega ropa a credito por su barrio, ella se mantiene sola.

loans.use: AUMENTO DE CAPITAL

loans.name: Erodelia

texts.en:
Erodelia is 41 years old and married to Conrado Sr.  They were blessed with five children: Rodalyn- 22 years old; Conrado Jr.- 21 years old, a security guard; Lanie-15 years old, 3rd year high school student; Eric- 8 years old, grade 2, in a primary level, and their youngest is John Carlo- 6 years old, already in preschool.  They are residing in San Francisco, Alicia, a rural and plain baranggay, their house is located between the rice fields and irrigation area.

She manages a duck-raising business and sometimes she also sells balut.  Her daily net income is PHP1,000.00. She decided to borrow a loan in KIVA amounting to PHP5,000.00 as business capital. She believes that "doing the best things comes the best gift that we always want".

loans.use: Additional capital in her Duck- Raising Business

loans.name: Ana Cruz

texts.es: Ana Cruz V. D. M. D. 49 años D. edad resiD. en San Pedro Mazahuat en el departamento D. La Paz junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Ana es muy conocida por sus vecinos por ser una persona amable y responsable actualmente tiene una tortillería en su casa con catorce años D. experiencia , también maneja un pequeño inventario en productos D. consumo diario los cuales coloca en una mesa en el terreno D. su casa, el deseo D. Ana es poder consolidar y hacer un negocio formal, instalando una tienda en su casa surtida D. variedad D. productos para el hogar, es por ello que solicita D. un crédito que le permita hacer crecer su negocio que con mucho entusiasmo esta emprendiendo.
texts.en:
Ana Cruz V. D. M. is 49 years old and lives in San Pedro Mazahuat in the department of La Paz with her husband and children. She is well known among her neighbors as a kind and responsible person. Ana has been making tortillas out of her home for 14 years. She also manages a small inventory of everyday consumer products which are displayed on a table outsiD. of her house. Ana would like to turn this into a formal business and establish a store in her home that is stocked with a variety of household products. Therefore she is requesting a loan to grow the business that she has enthusiastically undertaken.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more inventory for her business

loans.name: Lovina

texts.en:
N. Lovina S. is forty-eight years old; she is a widow and the mother of five children who have completed school.

Lovina runs a shop dealing with clothes and tailoring materials. She is requesting the loan with the interest of adding more tailoring materials (for example: more sewing threads, knitting wool, polyesters and cotton materials and others) in order to increase her sales.

Lovina’s future plan is to expand her business by buying more rolls of different materials to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To add more tailoring materials to her shop

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen Y., 40, is married and lives with her four children in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who works for US$3 each day, while her husband is a worker making US$2 per day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Pen Y. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$400 to purchase farmland, a water pump and pipe. In order to increase her profits and possibly raise her standard of living, she would like to purchase more land to produce fruit with the loan given to her through CREDIT.

loans.use: To purchase farmland, a water pump and pipe.

loans.name: Saroem

texts.en:
Saroem C., 63, is a widow with two sons and one daughter. One is married and lives outside the family home and the others assist their mother in her business. They live in a small village along National Road Number Two, about 13 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Saroem sells food: porridge and soup in front of her house and has done so for more than 10 years.  She is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase additional materials such as tables, chairs, dishes, spoons and so on.  It will be easier for her to operate her business, as well as more lucrative, when she has enough materials.

loans.use: Purchase additional materials to operate her business.

loans.name: Jessica Janina

texts.es:
Jessica tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de tres años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, ubicado a dos horas de Chiclayo.

Su esposo trabaja como maestro de construcción civil, pero lo que gana no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos familiares. Por ello, desde hace un año, se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores. Ella cría cerdos y algunas aves de corral para luego venderlas a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona.

La continua demanda por sus animales ha hecho que el número de animales con los que contaba disminuya por lo que Jessica se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y ampliar su negocio.

Ella es una mujer bastante responsable y entregada a su familia. Su más grande anhelo es ver a su hijo convertido en un profesional.
texts.en:
Jessica is 29, married, and has a 3-year-old son. She lives with her family in the Oyotún district, which is located 2 hours from Chiclayo. Her husband works as a civil construction worker, but he doesn't earn enough to cover all of their family's expenses. This is why she has raised and sold small animals for a year. She raises pigs and some poultry that she later sells to merchants in the area. The continuing demand she has had for her animals has made the number of animals she has decrease. This is why she is requesting a loan for the first time with Edpyme Alternativa for 800 PEN to buy more animals to expand her business. She is quite responsible and devoted to her family. Her biggest dream is to see her son become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase small animals to expand her business.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
El señor Santos Ramírez Castellón se dedica a la compra venta de novillos y la agricultura en el municipio de san Juan de Limay departamento de Estelí se le otorgo el crédito para retención de seis novillos de engorde el cual piensa vender a finales de este año  su negocio comenzó con la agricultura siembra de sorgo, maíz y frijoles luego se dedico a repastar terneros de engorde y venderlos a comerciantes hoy en día solamente se dedica a la agricultura y  vender animales de pesa para el matadero ya que le generan más ingresos don santos tiene más de treinta años de trabajar en este negocio el espera que  con la retención de estos novillos le baya muy bien ya que con los créditos que ha obtenido anteriormente le a  no ha tenido muchos problemas por lo que piensa seguir trabajando de esta manera.
 
Don santos es casado y tiene cuatro hijos bajo su cargo sus padres ya no se encuentran con el ya que fallecieron. Este es el quinto crédito que tiene con Ceprodel y tiene seis años de estar trabajando  nos dijo que sus créditos con Ceprodel la han ayudado mucho a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y sus ingresos por lo que está agradecido y desea seguir trabajando con Ceprodel por más tiempo.
texts.en:
Santos Ramírez Castellón works farming and purchasing and selling calves in the municipality of San Juan de Limay in the department of Estelí. He is seeking the loan to raise six calves for fattening which he hopes to sell by the end of this year. He began his business growing sorghum, corn, and beans. Later he started to raise calves and sell them to different vendors. Today he works both farming and raising animals that he sells to slaughterhouses because this earns him more money. Mr. Santos has more than thirty years working in this business, and he hopes to continue his business this way because he has not had problems with the previous loans he has received. Mr. Santos is married and has four children. He used to live his his parents too, but they have passed away. This is the fifth loan that he has had with Ceprodel over the course of six years. He told us that his loans with Ceprodel have helped him improve his quality of life and increase his profits. He is thankful for the opportunity and hopes to keep working with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and feeding six calves

loans.name: Dilnoza

texts.en:
K. Dilnoza is 24 years old. She and her husband, a woodworker, have a little daughter. Dilnoza sells blankets at the market. She has been in this business for two years. As a rule, Dilnoza travels to the neighboring town every week to purchase new goods. She tries to choose a variety of goods with good quality and attractive prices. This allows her to keep her clientele. Today Dilnoza requests 4000 Somoni. She’ll spend the loan for purchasing  new goods. She promises to pay the loan back on time. She thanks everyone for support.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the range of goods, purchasing of new knitted jackets, skirts, sweaters for selling.

loans.name: Las Conquistadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo  de personas, se encuentran ubicado actualmente en la Colonia Santa Marta
Mazatenango, Suchitepéquez, en la cual son personas que se conocen entre si, y cada una 
de ellas tiene su pequeño negocio en la cual están colaborando al ingreso familiar, y como
también son personas que visionan la buena vida de sus hijos, dándoles una educación y
salud para tener una vida mejor,  ellas han venido desde atrás, luchando cualquier 
dificultad en la vida y a base de eso han creado sus propios negocios en compra y venta de 
ropa,  productos básicos, como azúcar, frijol, y venta de comidas, en la cual no tienen un
local propio y son ambulantes, pero les da un ingreso para poder sostenerse, la cual 
con la visión de que sus negocios tengan estabilidad, y proporcionar un mejor servicio
 a sus clientes se vieron en la necesidad de acudir en la Asociación Asdir, para la solicitud de 
un préstamo para el cubrimiento de sus necesidades y una vida mejor.
texts.en:
This group of individuals currently lives in the district of Santa Marta Mazatenango, Suchitepéquez. They know one another and each of them has a small business from which they generate income for their families. In addition, they envision a good life for their children by providing them with an education and good health in order to have a better life. Coming from behind, they have fought to overcome any difficulty in life. As a result, they have created their own businesses buying and selling clothing; basic products such as sugar and beans; and prepared foods. They do not have their own shops, but work as traveling merchants instead. The income they generate allows them to support themselves, stabilize their businesses, and provide the best service to their customers. They decided to request a loan from Asociación ASDIR to help them cover their necessities and achieve a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to expand their respective businesses

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restock her business with fresh produce

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Coumba D. est une femme de 50ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DAROU-KOUDOSS depuis 3ans et demi, elle a 7 bonnes expériences avec le crédit. Elle développe un petit commerce de tissus, elle vend des tissus teintés, des pagnes en couleur et des grands boubous cousus avec du tissu léger. Avec les revenus générés par son activité de soutenir son mari pour la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Coumba D. is a 50 year-old married mother, with one child. She has been a member of the Darou-Koudoss Banc Villageois (credit association) for three and a half years and has successfully received seven loans. She operates a small fabric business, selling dyed fabrics, coloured pagnes (West African cloths) and large boubous (flowing robes for men or women) made of light fabric. She would use the revenues generated by her business in order to support her husband in seeing to the family's needs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her revenue-generating business

loans.name: Georgette

texts.fr: Née en 1971 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, A. Georgette est mariée à SOSSOU Philippe, un chauffeur. Le couple a trois enfants à leurs charges, dont deux sont leurs propres enfants. Il y a près de 12 ans que Georgette s'est installée au quartier Fiégnon à Cotonou, avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différents besoins de la famille. Georgette n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis douze ans, Georgette vend des condiments de sauce (tomates fraîches, oignons, piments, huile, etc.) à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Georgette  s'approvisionne dans le même marché. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu auparavant trois crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Georgette ambitionne renforcer son activité en l'agrandissant et en la diversifiant, afin de mieux faire face à la demande des clients et se faire plus de revenu. C'est pour y parvenir que Georgette sollicite un quatrième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1971 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Georgette A. is married to SOSSOU Philippe, a driver. The couple has three children to care for, of whom two are their own. Some 12 years ago, Georgette settled with her children and her husband in the Fiégnon borough of Cotonou. The couple jointly shares the various family expenses. Georgette has not attended school. For the past 12 years she has sold sauce condiments (fresh tomatoes, onions, hot peppers, oil, etc.) in Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. She gets her supplies from the same market. Georgette is a regular client of ALIDé, having already been granted three previous loans, all reimbursed in full. She wishes to strengthen her activity by increasing and diversifying it, to better meet customer demand and generate more income. To reach that goal she is now requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sauce condiments (tomatoes, hot peppers, onions, etc.)

loans.name: Ana Rosalia

texts.es:
Ana S. es socia del bankito Prosperidad  ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca, localidad que está dividida en dos partes por el río Tomebamba, demarcando el centro histórico al norte con sus hermosas casas hasta el barranco y la moderna al sur con sus barrios residenciales, edificios, centros comerciales y amplias avenidas.

Ana tiene 24 años vive en unión libre  con su pareja y sus dos hijos de 4 y 2 años, su esposo trabaja en un patio de  compra y venta  de vehículos, fruto del esfuerzo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia. Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa por catalogo, se encuentra en este negocio hace dos  años, también es secretaria de un radio taxi, en el cual se encuentra trabajando 4 meses, tiene horarios rotativos por lo que puede desarrollar sus otras actividades.

Se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo y fue invitada por una amiga del bankito comunal, los créditos le han ayudado para pagar las facturas de sus productos como de cosméticos, con su nuevo crédito va a comprar  cremas, labiales, perfumes,  pantalones, blusas, camisas, sacos,  para ir incrementando su negocio. Su meta es de  a comprar un vehiculo.
texts.en:
Ana Suqi is a member of the Prosperidad bank, which is located in the city of Cuenca. This area is divided into two parts by the Tomebamba River. In the north there is the historic center with its beautiful houses up to the gully. In the south are the residential neighborhoods, buildings, commercial centers, and wide streets. Ana, age 24, is in a common law marriage. They have two children, 4 and 2. Her husband works in a place that buys and sells vehicles. As a fruit of their marital efforts they have been able to build their own house. She sells cosmetics and clothes by catalog. She has been in this business for two years. She is also a secretary for a radio taxi. She has been doing that work for four months. She has a rotating schedule, and she is able to work her other activities. She is in her fourth cycle. A friend invited her to join the communal bank. The loans have helped her pay the bills for her products such as cosmetics. With the new loan she will buy creams, lipsticks, perfume, pants, blouses, shirts, and jackets in order to increase her business. Her goal is to buy a vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy creams, lipsticks, perfume, pants, blouses, shirts, and jackets

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
Apolinar pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 73  años y tiene tres hijos. Su principal actividad económica  es vender colchones los días domingos en el mercado modelo de Calca y su actividad económica complementaria es vender comestibles en su domicilio. Ya son tres años que trabaja en el negocio y le va muy bien. El requiere el crédito para comprar colchones. El nos cuenta que su negocio bajo porque  no hay clientes debido a que el puente de la ciudad de Pisaq se cayó por causa del aumento el caudal del rio Vilcanota
   
Apolinar  se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Apolinar is a member of the “Valle Sagrado” (Sacred Valley) Communal Bank, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. He is 73 years old and has three children. His main business activity is selling mattresses every Sunday at the standard market in Calca. He has another business selling food from his house. Apolinar has been in this business for three years and is doing very well. He needs a loan to buy more mattresses. At the moment, he says business is slow because there are no customers since the bridge in the city of Pisaq collapsed due to overflow from the Vilcanota River.

Apolinar is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase mattresses

loans.name: Ta-Landeneh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Ta-Landeneh” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Aminata K. who is pictured on the left. Aminata is 40 years old.  She was born in a place call Makali. Her husband is a professional worker and her children are attending both primary and secondary schools. For five years now, Aminata has been selling locally dyed clothes call “gara lappers”. With her share of the loan, she will invest in her business by buying materials like inks, caustic soda, powder, white cotton, etc. to make gara lappers.

loans.use: To buy inks, caustic soda, powder, white cotton, etc.

loans.name: Fawzia Hafez Group

texts.en:
Mohammad Hafez, 41, is the leader of the Fawzia Hafez group.  He lives in district 7th of Kabul, Afghanistan.  He is married and the father of five children.  Mohammad Hafez has a small cart that he tried to keep full of fresh fruits and vegetables to sell.  He needs a loan to buy more vegetables and fruit to sell to support his family.

Mohammad Hafez is very happy for the chance to get a loan in Afghanistan and that poor workers can use loans to help change their lives.   He says thanks to all lenders around the world.

loans.use: Buy fresh fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio Crisologo pertenece al banco comunal YANAPAKUY; El socio vive en el ddistrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 54 años de edad y tiene 4 hijos es casado y se dedica junto a su esposa a prestar servicio de comidas, él tiene un negocio de preparación de todo tipo de comidas para eventos desde la decoración hasta la música. El socio solicita el préstamo para implementar algunos pequeños detalles en su negocio.

El socio agradece y valora infinitamente el crédito otorgado y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Crisologo is a member of the communal bank YANAPAKUY. He lives in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco. He's 54-years-old and has 4 children. He's married and, with his wife, he offers food service. He has a catering service which offers all types of foods for events, in addition to decorations and music. He's asking for the loan so that he can add a few small details to his business. Crisologo values and is infinitely grateful for this loan, and he promises to pay off the debt within the established period of time.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Adding a few small details to his business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna B., 35, is from Sta Cruz, Tangub city. She is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products such as shampoo, candies, soap for laundry and in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Myrna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Myrna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth M. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, dried fish and onions at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of maize flour and rice to sell.  Elizabeth is 40 years old and is married to an administrator. She has 4 children, who all attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: Stock bags of maize flour and rice to sell

loans.name: Saff Loxo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SAFF LOKHO est né le 20 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 14 femmes issues du même village. Les membres ont décidé de se regrouper au sein du même groupe parce qu’elles habitent le même quartier et ont des affinités. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageoise de KOUNOUNE AIR FRANCE

Madame Ndèye Penda K. tout à fait debout à droite de la photo, levant la main gauche, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de céréales locales (mil et maïs), de niébé et de la pâte d’arachide et des condiments pour cuisine. 

Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter un sac de mil, un sac de maïs, 20 kilogrammes de pâte d’arachide et des condiments pour cuisine. 

Elle a comme objectif de participer à la prise en charge de la dépense quotidienne de la famille et d’assurer l’habillement de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Saff Lokho was created on December 20, 2009. It is composed of 14 women living in the same village. They have decided to create a group togehterbecause they are friends and live in the same neighborhood. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of Kounoune Air France. Mrs. Ndèye Penda K., standing to the far right in the photo raising her left hand, is the group’s leader. She is 47 years old. She is married and the mother of five dependent children. Her business is selling local cereals (millet and corn) , “niébé” [a type of black-eyed peas], peanut paste and food condiments. With her new loan she would like to purchase a bag of millet, a bag of corn, 20 kg [44 lbs] of peanut paste and some food condiments. Her goal is to contribute to the family budget and to provide for her children’s clothing.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing local cerals, black-eyed peas and peanut paste

loans.name: Meissa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Meissa D. est un jeune pêcheur  de 28 ans qui habite a Mbenguene  a Yoff. Il est marié et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 2 et 5 ans. 
Monsieur D. a hérité cette activité de ses parents qui étaient  des anciens pêcheurs. Il fait aussi du plongeon en haute mer. Monsieur D. a une seconde activité qui consiste à louer des bâches, des tentes et des chaises.
Il est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis juin 2008. Il a déjà  remboursé un prêt antérieur. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de chaises destinées à la location. 
Ce financement  lui permettra de développer  son activité. Il souhaite aussi  renforcer son épargne pour disposer d’un local pour y exercer son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Meissa D. is a young 28 year-old fisherman who lives in Mbenguene, in Yoff. He is married and the father of 2 children, ages 2 and 5. Mr. Monsieur inherited this business from his parents, who were formerly fishermen. He also does deep sea diving. Mr. D. has a second business that consists of renting tarpaulins, tents and chairs. He has been a member of the Yoff credit union since June, 2008 and has already repaid a previous loan. He is asking for a loan of 500,000 frs with which he plans to buy chairs to rent. This financing will enable him to expand his business. He also wants to increase his savings so that he can get a place to operate his business.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chairs to rent

loans.name: Mujeres Con Suenos Y Metas 2 Group

texts.en:
Paulina is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres con suenos y metas 2 (Women with Dreams and goals). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to build her house with a concrete block structure. It is still wood and she needs a stronger structure. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to work.

Paulina is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for a year and a half, starting because her husband built a stand to sell goods and she heard about Esperanza loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying soda, cookies, fruits, vegetables, snacks and candies, etc. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wants to improve her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy goods for her food stall

loans.name: Iragi Group

texts.fr: Kabira K.  est  présidente  groupe Iragi, âgée de 39 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants, son mari est  chauffeur. Son fils ainé a 22 ans et le cadet a 3 ans et tous étudient, sauf le cadet.  Il y a 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette petite activité de production de boisson locale Mandrakwa. Elle a commence avec ses fonds propre. Avant d’embrasser cette activité, elle vendait les pommes de terre, la braise, etc. Elle vend ses marchandises à son  domicile. Ce crédit va lui permettre d’augmenter  son chiffre d’affaire en achetant  les 3 sacs des intrants (maïs, sorgho) pour la production Madrakwa. Le grand obstacle est  qu’elle vend en monnaie nationale (franc congolais). Cependant cette monnaie congolaise n’est pas stable, elle subit de plus à plus l’inflation, ce qui entraine de perte de change avec la devise (les dollars), comme tous les congolais craignent le franc congolais, pour garder leurs économies en dollars. En outre, ce travail de production boisson madrakwa est trop fatiguant étant donné qu’elle utilise encore la technologie rudimentaire, ainsi donc, elle souhaiterait changer le secteur d’activité dans le futur. Elle souhaite voir  ses enfants finir les études. Kabira K. a déjà réalisé plus de gain d’impact visible avec  le crédit de Hekima, elle a déjà construit une maison de 2 chambres et salon, qu’elle met à la disposition des locateurs pour accroitre ses revenus. La cliente Kabira K. remercie  Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres citoyens exclus de banque classique.  Il sied de signaler que ce groupe Iragi est composé de 14 membres.
texts.en:
Kabira K., the leader of the Iragi group, is 39 years old and married with seven children. Her husband is a driver. Her oldest son is 22 years old and the youngest is only 3; all, except the youngest, are in school. Since about ten years ago, she has been making a traditional local drink called “Mandrakwa” for sale. She started with her own funds. Before launching into this business, she used to sell potatoes, charcoal etc. She sells out of her home. This loan will allow her to increase her working capital and purchase three bags of ingredients (corn, sorghum). Her big challenge is that her receipts are in local currency, the Congolese Franc. However, this is not a stable currency and the inflation is growing, which results in losses when Congolese Francs are exchanged into hard currency (US dollars). Like all locals, distrusting the Congolese currency, Kabira keeps her savings in US dollars. In addition, the production of “Madrakwa” is very labor-intensive, given that she is still using a very rudimentary technology, and thus she would like to change her type of business in the future. She would like to see her children finish their studies. Thanks to the loans from Hekima, Kabira K. already has made visible progress: her earnings have allowed her to build a house with two bedrooms and a living room; she rents out the house to increase her income. Kabira Kalondera thanks Hekima for assisting impoverished citizens who do not have access to the traditional banking system. It should also be mentioned that the Iraqi group consists of 14 members.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 3 bags of ingredients (corn, sorghum)

loans.name: Mary Nana Ama

texts.en: Mary Nana Ama W. B. sells smoked fish and 'gari' (manioc grits) at Elmina. Mary has not received any formal education.  She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She responsibly helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy extra fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to further her dependents' education.

loans.use: buy extra fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 30 years old and is an aggressive businessman.  He runs a mobile phone shop in a very competitive environment but he still keeps his business profitable. He was previously selling clothes to earn a living. He has managed to stabilize his business which is three years old through Faulu Kenya. Joseph hopes that someday, he will transform his business into wholesale.  He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kes to buy more phones.

loans.use: To buy more phones

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn L. is from the village of Dalacon. She is 35 years old. Arlyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Arlyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Arlyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Arlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. Arlyn is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Arlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Tseveenkhuu

texts.en:
Mr. Tseveenkhuu S. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live together in a small house, except for his daughter, Otgonzul, who is 15 and lives separately.  Their son, Lkhavgabayar, is 9 and is a local secondary school student.  

He has been operating a taxi business in the city with his own car for three years. He enjoys transporting people. Tseveenkhuu is a very hardworking person, and in the future he is planning to build a wooden house for his beloved daughter.

His wife, Oyunchimeg, recently opened a butcher shop in “Denjiin 1000” food market, and she took out a loan from KIVA. She used it appropriately and paid it back in full on time.  The loan he is requesting is for his wife’s business expansion.

loans.use: for the expansion of his wife’s business

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra M. is from the village of Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Alejandra is widowed and has four adult children. To make a living, Alejandra owns & operates a business planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell. Alejandra has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Alejandra joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alejandra has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used for additional capital for her business. Alejandra is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Alejandra from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Diosdado

texts.en:
Diosdado L. is from the village of Minsapinit, Gingoog City. He is 48 years old. Diosdado is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Diosdado is a chainsaw operator to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for more than five years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Diosdado joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to expand the services he provides. Diosdado is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of the chainsaw. This will be the second loan taken by Diosdado from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for the maintenance of his chainsaw

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon, 26 years old, is a single young man who is very ambitious.  He supplies stationery and schoolbooks in the area of Oloitoktok. Simon was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and has not borrowed from other sources before.

He has been running this business for two years and he is hopeful that as the New Year approaches, he will get some good sales as the schools resume for the first semester of the year. 

This is the first loan he is getting from KADET and he intends to use it to buy more of the recommended books and school stationery, so that he can supply to as many schools and institutions in the area.

loans.use: He plans to buy more books and stationery for schools

loans.name: Catarin

texts.en:
Catarin has been practicing mixed farming in Litein in the Rift Valley of Kenya for over 30 years. Her mixed farm produces milk, tea and maize, which are all sold locally. She also operates a hotel in the same region.

She has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, a Kiva field partner, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve her family's living standards. Her biggest challenge has been lack of clean water for her dairy cows.

Catarin is 55 years old and married. She has 8 children between the ages of 13 and 40. Two of the children currently attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Teodusio

texts.en:
Teodusio E. is from the village of Eastern Looc. She is 42 and single. To make a living, Teodusio owns a general store. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Teodusio joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Teodusio from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 33 años y reside junto a su esposa en su casa propia en la parte rural del caserío Molino El Carmen – Motupe, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años, Jorge brinda servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consiste de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Transporte la gente en la ruta entre Motupe y sus caseríos. Adicionalmente, el trabaja como chofer en la empresa de Osseja SRL - Backus. Desea realizar algunas mejoras a su vehículo que es su herramienta de trabajo. También desea comprar algunos accesorios que necesita para mantener su moto en buenas condiciones y seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio. Con la ayuda de un préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos y hacer algunos arreglos en su domicilio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Jorge is 33 years old and lives together with his wife in his own home in a rural area, in the small village of Molino El Carmen, Motupe.  This is an agricultural area located in Lambayeque province, one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

For three years Jorge has been providing a passenger transport service in his 'mototaxi', a vehicle that consists of a motorbike with a cabin in back for transporting passengers.  He transports people on the route between Motupe and its villages.  He also works as a driver for the company Osseja SRL - Backus.

Jorge would like to make some improvements to his vehicle which is his work tool.  He would also like to buy some accessories that he needs to keep his mototaxi in good condition and to continue offering a good service.  With the help of a loan, he hopes to increase his income and make some repairs to his home.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To repair his mototaxi

loans.name: Juana Gladys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HACIA EL TRIUNFO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Juana, La socia tiene 52 años de edad, la socia  es casada y tiene 2 hijos, la socia se dedica a la enfermería, ella es enfermera de profesión en el hospital Antonio Lorena, la socia es una mujer muy dedicada y responsable y alterna su trabajo y en su tiempo libre ella vende ropa, la socia realiza esta otra actividad para poder incrementar su economía y de este modo dar mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. La socia desea el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de ropa.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana, 52, is a member of the Hacia El Triunfo ("On To Victory") community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Sra. Juana is married and has 2 children.  She works as a nurse at the Antonio Lorena hospital.  She is a hard-working, responsible woman and she supplements her nursing income with a clothing sales business.  She set up the business to increase her income so that she could provide a better standard of living for herself and her children.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise for her clothing business.

Sra. Juana is grateful for the loan and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for clothing business.

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.en:
Mrs. Esterlina Y. J. is from the village of Pulot, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Esterlina is married to Johnas J. and they are blessed with three adult children. As of now, she is receiving monthly support from her son's work abroad. 

In August 2008, Esterlina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlina has successfully repaid a loan of 50,000 PHP.  Esterlina is now requesting a new loan of 45,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials for house repairs. 

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials to be used for house repair

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
42-year-old Fatima is a married woman with six children. Her oldest child is 18 years old.

Fatima is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for five years. She usually earns about 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month from this farming.

Fatima's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es:
Olimpia vende en su casa de habitación, desde hace varios años ya que logro poner una pulpería en donde hoy en día, con AFODENIC sus niveles de venta aumentaron al ofrecer más variedad en sus mercaderías.
Contenta ya que ha logrado el equilibrio y el apoyo  a su familia,  mediante la inversión, ya que cuando inicio lo hizo con venta de tortillas. Lo que mejoro mediante doce ciclos de financiamientos. Con este nuevo préstamo hará nuevas compras en productos enlatados, jugos, gaseosas, frutas, verduras, productos personales de limpieza entre otros productos que ayude a mejorar sus niveles de ventas
texts.en:
Olimpia set up a grocery store in her home several years ago and she sells products from her home.  With the help of AFODENIC, her sales levels have risen and she now sells a wider variety of merchandise.

Olimpia is happy because she has managed to achieve some balance and support her family through her investments as, when she started out, she only sold tortillas.  She has improved her business through twelve loan cycles.

Olimpia will use this new loan to buy canned goods, juice, soda, fruit, vegetables, personal care products etc. which will help her to improve her sales levels.

loans.use: to invest in canned goods, juice, soda, vegetables and other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more car radios.

loans.name: Famory

texts.fr:
Agé de 28 ans, Monsieur Famory est marié, père d’un enfant et réside dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Wayerma I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  Famory, après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès notamment la vente de carburants, s’est finalement  initié au commerce d’articles divers pour  Alimentation (Eau minérale, boissons, Déodorants, cartes de recharge de téléphone Malitel/Orange,  etc.) Son magasin située à Wayerma I Sikasso et il exerce cette activité iI  y a environ cinq ans. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de trois années et est à son cinquième prêt individuel. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce  cinquième  prêt lui permettra d’acheter, 45 cartons de l’Eau minérale, 25 paquets de boisson NBB, 5 cartons de biscuits, 7 cartons de Déodorant, 600 cartes de recharge Malitel/Orange, etc. Ses marchandises sont achetées auprès de commerçants grossistes sur place et des représentants des deux réseaux de télécommunication avant de les revendre en gros et en détail à une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales de la ville.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 300 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
At 28 years old, Mr. Famory is married, the father of one child, and lives in a large extended family in Wayerma I, one of the working-class neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso (the third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 

Mr Famory, after having managed many businesses without success, notably the sale of fuel, finally began a business of selling various household items (mineral water, drinks, deodorant, rechargeable telephone cards from Malitel, Orange, etc.).  His shop is located in Wayerma I in Sikasso and he has conducted his business there for about five years.  He is very sought after because of the quality of his products. 

In order to better satisfy his growing clientele, over three years ago he decided to rejoin the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is on his fifth individual loan.  All former loans were properly paid back.  This fifth loan will allow him to purchase 45 boxes of mineral water, 25 packages of NBB drinks, five boxes of cookies, 7 boxes of deodorant, 600 rechargeable Malitel/Orange cards, etc.  This merchandise is bought from local wholesalers and representatives from the telecommunication companies before being resold wholesale and retail to a clientele made up of all social strata of the city.

With this loan, he hopes to earn a monthly profit of at least 300,000 FCFA which will be used primarily for growing his working capital, contributing to household expenses, and paying the interest on his loan.

loans.use: to purchase various household items for resale.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 60 years old and married to a farmer. The couple is blessed with six children. Leticia sells grocery items in her store and has operated this business for almost seven years. She's asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase detergent bars/powders, carbonated drinks, cooking oil, vinegar, condiments, eggs, and canned goods. She earns 7,000 PHP monthly from this business.

She hopes that Kiva lenders will continue to support her in the future, as she looks to expand her business and eventually increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase detergent bars/powders, carbonated drinks, cooking oil, vinegar, condiments, eggs, and canned goods.

loans.name: Alva Nora

texts.en: Alva Nora lives in the Choluteca region of Honduras with her husband and two children. For the past four years, she has operated a small business selling women’s cosmetics.  Occasionally her sisters assist with the business. She is a returning loan client and is requesting an HNL 8,000 loan with which to buy merchandise to sell. In her free time, Alva Nora raises pigs and chickens at home.

loans.use: to purchase women's cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosalvina

texts.es: Rosalvina, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri de 56 años de edad es una mujer campechana y muy trabajadora, esta  casada  con Juan 61 años de edad y fruto de su amorío tienen  04 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa. Rosalvina, cree que todavía no alcanzo la cima para dejar de trabajar y por ello se esmera por continuar y ofrecer lo mejor a sus queridos hijos. Expresa que a su edad no es impedimento para poder  sobresalir y  poner  su creatividad en el negocio. Es así que se dedica en la venta de diferentes productos, razón por la cual su tienda lleva el nombre de multiservicios Rosalvina, donde ofrece el servicio de Fotocopias, anillados, espiralados, venta de cuadernos  y un stand de artículos personales y para el hogar. Menciona que al ofrecer variedad de mercadería le es más favorable porque sus clientes encuentran lo que necesitan en un solo lugar. Su negocio esta situado en su propio domicilio en el populoso distrito de Quimbiri, donde viene ofreciendo sus productos desde hace 11 años; le gusta  este negocio por que le favorece crecer  económicamente y a la vez socializarse con todo tipo de personas. Sus hijos son los pilares, para que su negocio sobresalga hacia delante. Los planes que tiene es abastecerse de mercadería  y no caer en la escasez. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP y por lo cual necesita el apoyo de todos ustedes para seguir creciendo, además se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito solicitado comprará  útiles de escritorio para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en: Rosalvina, who is a native of the city of Quimbiri, is 56 years old.  She is a straightforward woman and very hard-working.  She is married to 61 year old Juan, and they have 4 children, fruit of their love.  They all live together in their own home.  Rosalvina believes that she still hasn't reached the point of retiring.
