And so she does her best to continue working and offering the best to her dear children.  She expressed that her age is no impediment to succeeding or putting creativity into her business. She makes her living selling different products, which is why her store is called "Multiservicios Rosalvina" (Rosalvina's Multi-Services).  Her store offers photocopy and spiral binding services, sells notebooks and has a stand for personal and household items.  She notes that offering a variety of merchandise is better for her because her customers can find everything they need in just one place.  Her business is located in her home, in the highly populated Quimbiri District.  She has been selling her products and services for 11 years.  Rosalvina likes her business because it allows her to grow economically and at the some time to socialize with all sorts of people.  Rosalvina's children are the pillars on which rest her desire for her business to succeed.  Her plans are to stock up with merchandise and not fall into shortage.  This will be Rosalvina's second loan with MFP, and she needs all of your help to keep growing.  In addition, she promises to comply with her repayment schedule.  With the requested loan, she will purchase office supplies to stock her store.

loans.use: to purchase office supplies to stock her store.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 45-year-old married woman with 4 children. The oldest is 22 years old and the youngest is 6.

Jane is a farmer who tills land in Trento, Agusan Del Sur. She grows rice crops to sell. Jane usually earns about 8,000 PHP per month from farming. She plans to use her loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

In the future, Jane hopes to be financially stable and be able to send all her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Muy pronto la Hija de Luz Marina estarà en su noveno semestre de Contaduria Pùblica y esto es gracias a los financiadores de Kiva con los cuales ella, su hija y toda su familia estàn felices y muy agradecidos. Muy pronto Kiva y la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo con su mancomunado apoyo lograrán una profesional mas en Colombia y esta es una gran satisfaccion.  Esta es la razòn por la cual Luz Marina envia un reconocimiento a este casi logro: "Gracias, que Dios los siga ayudando a travès de esta obra ya que así es que pude sacar adelante  a sus hijos............... Y que sigan ayudando a mas personas". Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Luz Marina ingrese a los siguientes enlaces:
http:// kiva.org/lend/173039 
http:// kiva.org/lend/221228
http://kiva.org/lend/268002
texts.en:
Soon Luz Marina’s daughter will be starting her new semester of studying to be an accountant, thanks to the Kiva loans she’s gotten.  Her daughter and the rest of the family are happy and grateful.  Soon Kiva and “Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo,” through their support, will produce one more professional in Colombia and this is of great satisfaction.  This is the reason why Luz Marina is giving recognition to this nearly complete accomplishment.  “Thank you.  May God continue to help you with this work and allow you to continue getting your children ahead and that you continue helping people.”  If you would like to know Luz Marina’s story, check the following links:

http:// kiva.org/lend/173039
http:// kiva.org/lend/221228
http://kiva.org/lend/268002

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Angel Pablo

texts.es:
Angel de 58 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hija en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del departamento de Lambayeque.  Zona que desarrolla la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismos (cuenta con varios sitios arqueológicos).

La actividad que desempeña  Angel es como chófer de una empresa de transporte público, teniendo la ruta Chiclayo – Lambayeque y viceversas, con una experiencia de 8 años y todos los días realiza el mismo recorrido, los ingresos que adquiere le ayudará para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1700 nuevos soles para  invertirlo en los estudios superiores que va realizar su hija, lo que le permitirá en un futuro alcanzar sus metas y poder ayudar a sus padres económicamente.  Angel es un padre responsable y preocupado, que lo único que desea es que su familia se supere.
texts.en:
Ángel, 58, lives with his wife and daughter in his own house which has running water and electricity and is located in an urban part of Lambayeque Department and is an area of farming, livestock raising and tourism (it has several archaeological sites).

Ángel is employed as a Driver at a public transportation firm on the Chiclayo-Lambayeque round trip route.  He has 8 years’ experience and every day he travels the same route.  Income he earns will help him provide his family with a better quality of life.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1700 new sol loan to invest in his daughter’s higher education which will permit her to reach her future goals and then be able to help her out her parents economically.  Ángel is a responsible, concerned father whose only desire is that his family progresses.

loans.use: to invest in his daughter's higher education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase nursery seeds and fertilizers to plant coffee

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tires and tubes for a puncture shop.

loans.name: Elsi Maricela

texts.es:
Elsi Maricela tiene 25 años de edad es soltera vive con la mamá y con la hija 4 años de edad  en Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

 Los miembros de la VRC Virgen de Guadalupe se encuentra ubicada en la Ciudadela 10 de noviembre, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a labores comerciales.

Elsi se dedica a la  venta de productos de yanbal, avon las compras las realiza en Guayaquil y las vende en Ventanas cada 15 días, Solicita el crédito para  incrementar el negocio, comprar más  productos  y obtener más utilidades.

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder tener utilidades al momento de vender los productos y reunir lo suficiente para invertir en otro producto, Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentemente es la competencia  que la ha sabido manejar eficientemente  para poder  vender los productos.
El sueño es poder comprarse un local para poder exhibir los productos. Y poder venderlos fácilmente.
En los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Elsi Maricela is 25, and single.  She lives with her mother and 4 year old daughter, in Ventanas canton, De Los Rios province. The members of the "Virgen de Guadalupe" communal bank live in the Ciudadela 10 de noviembre neighborhood of Ventanas canton, and work in commercial activities. 

She sells Yanbal and Avon products. She purchases them in Guayaquil, and sells them in Ventanas every 15 days.
She is applying for the loan in order to buy more products, increase her business, and earn more profits. The loan will really help her make profits when she sells products, and to make enough to buy other products. 

The challenges that very often arise include competition, which she has learned to handle effectively in order to sell her products. 
Her dream is to buy a shop to display her products, and to sell them more easily. In her free time she likes to listen to music.

loans.use: To buy more products, and increase her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman who has two school going children. They live at a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past seven years, Grace has operated a restaurant business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a challenge of price fluctuation in her business. Grace dreams of establishing an M-pesa(mobile money transfer) business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour and sugar for the restaurant business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour and sugar, for the restaurant business.

loans.name: Efraín

texts.es: El señor Efraín es un hombre emprendedor que le gusta tomar nuevos retos de los cuales sea beneficiada su familia. Hace 7 meses el comenzó su negocio de abarrotes en una casa de sus hijos, por que cuenta Efraín que en ese lugar no hay competencia alguna para el, ya que en ese lugar las tiendas se encuentran muy retiradas. Al ver Efraín en el sector que había colocado su negocio pensó que funcionaria muy bien ya que los clientes tenían que caminar demasiado para ir a comprar algo. En este momento este negocio ha funcionado a la perfección por tal motivo Efraín se ve en la necesidad de comprar mas mercancía por que la que tienen no abastece las necesidades de sus clientes. Por tal motivo quiere comprar comida de lata, sopas, jabón en polvo, suavizantes, refrescos, botanas y mas, de esta manera sus ventas incrementaran.
texts.en: Efraín is an enterprising man who likes taking on new challenges that will benefit his family.  Seven months ago he started his grocery business at the house of one of his children because Efraín relates that he has no competition there because stores are located very far from there.  When Efraín installed his store there he thought that it would do very well because customers had to walk long distances to buy anything.  At present, the store has performed to perfection and because of this Efraín needs to buy more merchandise because he doesn’t have enough to meet customer needs.  He wants to buy canned food, soups, powdered detergent, fabric softeners, soft-drinks, snacks and more to increase sales.

loans.use: to buy canned food, powderd detergent, soft-drinks and more.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 39 years of age and married with four children. Susana owns & operates a business venture, baking & selling a variety of baked goods in the local community.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.   Susana needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase an extra oven for her bakery.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Susana joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Susana's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase an extra oven for her bakery

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 36 years old and married to Daniel. Together they have four children, aged 15, 13, 8 and 5 years old. She is into a recycling business. She buys scrap shoes and plastics for recycling. She has been in the business for the past five years. She gets a monthly income of about KES 20,000 from the business.

This is her second loan term with KADET LTD. She paid her previous loan successfully. She will use this loan amount to purchase scrap rubber soles and plastics in larger quantities for resale. 

She will plow the anticipated profits back into the business. Her dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy rubber and plastics in large quantities.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 50 años, es una mujer emprendedora y alegre, muy trabajadora. Esta casada con Esteban y juntos viven en su casa propia en compañía de sus dos hijos de 18 y 15 años de edad y un sobrino, a quien apoya en su educación.  La actividad que realiza Rosa en la venta de comida por las noches, tales como arroz chaufa, pollos fritos,  asados de pollos y demás, los cuales vende en una mesa que instalada en el frontis de su casa, en donde atiende a sus clientes. Dicha actividad lo realiza con el apoyo de su hijos. Paralelo a ello, vende cervezas,  para lo cual cuenta con un congelador donde guarda esta bebidas y las puede vender a la temperatura que les agrada a sus clientes. Teniendo seis años ejerciendo este trabajo y gracias a ello puede tener un ingreso económico, así apoya a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, ya que muchas veces con el sueldo de empelado público de salud que tiene su esposo no les alcanza para poder pagar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos.  Manifiesta que siente productiva, y es indenpendiente, y ahora anhela ampliar su negocio y consolidarse. Este sería el préstamo número seis con la institución MFP, se siente a gusto con su trabajo en su banco comunal y desea poder seguir formando parte. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de cerveza al por mayor, para tener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa, 50, is an enterprising and happy woman, and very hardworking. She is married to Esteban and they live together in their own home with their two children, 18 and 15, and a nephew who they support in his schooling. 

Rosa sells food at night like Peruvian fried rice, fried chicken, grilled chicken and other things. She sells them on a table in front of her house, where she tends to her customers. Her kids help her with this business. On the side, she also sells beer that she keeps in a freezer so she can sell them at the temperature that her customers like. She has been doing this for 6 years and it has given her an income so that she can help her husband with the costs of the home; often his public employee's salary does not cover their children's college studies. She feels productive and independent, and now wants to grow and consolidate her businesses. 

This will be her 6th loan with MFP. She likes her work in the village bank and hopes to continue being a part of it. With the requested loan, she will buy beer in bulk so she can make more profit.

loans.use: to buy more beer.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 58 years old and married with 3 children.

Conchita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a grocery store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her grocery store.

Conchita has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the grocery store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending and dealing in household and beauty products.

Conchita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell in her grocery store

loans.name: Nestor Oswaldo

texts.es:
Néstor de 47 años, empezó a trabajar como costurero desde su niñez y desde entonces le ha gustado mucho esta actividad, trabaja en un local donde alquila por más de 9 años.

Trabaja solo todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. Gracias a Dios no ha tenido ninguna dificultad en su negocio.

Esta separado de su esposa, pero tiene 3 hijos de 15, 8 y 6 años que estudian en instituciones fiscales. Quiere comprar con el prestamo telas, hilos para mejorar sus ingresos.  Su meta es poder establecer un local en su propia casa, para así trabajar cómodamente.
texts.en:
Néstor is 47 years old and started working as a tailor as a young child and since then has always enjoyed sewing. He has worked in rented premises for the last 9 years.

He works alone every day from 8 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon. "Gracias a Dios" (thanks to God) he has not had any difficulties with his business.

He is separated from his wife but has 3 children, 15, 8 and 6 years of age who study in state schools. With the loan he wants to buy fabric and thread to improve his income. His goal is to establish a working area in his own house in order to work comfortably.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Vorn has spent most of her life cultivating rice and vegetable crops from an urban area of Takhmao town. She is very hard-working in order to ensure that her crops are well-grown. After her vegetable crops are ripe enough, Mrs. Vorn harvests and brings them home to one of her daughters who is in a selling business in Takhmao market where she acts as a fruit and vegetable seller. 

And now Mrs. Vorn has applied for a loan from HKL, one of Kiva partners, to purchase stocks of fruits and vegetables to support her daughter’s business. Vorn hopes to improve her family’s businesses and have a good standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of fruits and vegetables to support her daughter’s business.

loans.name: Dwi Rahayu 1 Group

texts.en:
The 10 members of Dwi Rahayu 1 group are located in the village of Pesagi - Tabanan, Central Bali. The group was formed from the expansion of the service area of a branch office in Badung, which was inaugurated three months ago. Badung is the fourth branch of MUK. Pesagi - Tabanan is a rural area where the inhabitants work as farmers. To increase the family income, they want to get training on pig raising and lending funds from MUK. So far, they only maintain local pigs and to increase knowledge about pigs, they join MUK.

Ni Made, 42, was appointed as head of the group and is responsible for the business loans of the members. The total loan for the group is Rp 35,000,000 and Ni Made receives Rp 3,500,000. The loan will be used to buy superior quality piglets, to buy food and to fix the cage. She hopes her efforts will go smoothly and no pigs will die. She plans to use the profits to improve her homes. Ni Made is in the back row, number one from the right, in a pink shirt.

loans.use: To buy superior quality piglets, buy food and fix the cage

loans.name: Aliyah

texts.en:
Aliyah is a 43-year-old married woman, mother of three beautiful boys, who represent her whole life.

Aliyah is a hardworking woman, 21 years ago she started her small business. She is a skilled tailor and well known in the region.

To start a business was a bit hard for her because she wanted to keep taking good care of her children but the family's needs forced her to do both.
Aliyah didn't regret this step at all, and she is very proud of herself since her fears weren't true and she was capable of managing both her business and being a special mother.

Aliyah has been a Al Majmoua (Kiva partner) borrower for two cycles, her previous cycle helped to support her family's needs a lot. 

Today Aliyah is requesting a loan, in order to buy a new, updated sewing machine, necessary to update her business and to provide her customers good quality in a short period of time.

Aliyah hopes to open a special clothes factory in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new, updated sewing machine.

loans.name: Akouavi Solange

texts.fr: Akouavi Solange est âgée de 40 ans et vit au Bénin. Akouavi Solange n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Akouavi Solange est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Clément. Le couple a deux enfants scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Akouavi Solange vend depuis cinq ans, divers produits vivriers (soja, maïs) par le système de distribution. Akouavi Solange s'approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Akouavi Solange contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Akouavi Solange sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts reçus par Akouavi Solange ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Akouavi Solange is 40 years old and lives in Benin. She did not attend school. Akouavi Solange is married to a driver named Clément. The couple have two children, both of whom are in school and live in the care of their parents. The couple provide for the household together. To meet her needs and those of her children, Akouavi Solange has sold various basic food staples (soybean, maize) through the distribution system for five years. She gets her supplies in a region in Benin. Thanks to the income her activity generates, Akouavi Solange contributes to various family expenses. To satisfy her growing clientele, she is seeking a third loan with ALIDÉ. The two previous loans she received were both repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy bags of soybeans and maize.

loans.name: Presicur

texts.en: Presicur is a 37-year-old married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest and kind. She operates a grocery store  where she sells vegetables and fruits such as onions, tomatoes, passion fruits, kale, cabbages, etc.  She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located at a densely populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy vegetables and fruits for resale. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler of vegetables and fruits within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Muhamed

texts.en:
Muhamed is 60 years old, married and has two children. He is a government employee . He has a smart boy in primary school. Because of his low salary he always worries about making enough money to cover his family needs and saving some for his children school expenses. With this loan now he can accommodate all these expenses.
He is requesting a 3000$ loan to pay for his son's tuition fees and other school expenses. He is aim see his children get best education. 
The story of Muhamed and his son is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients that are able to get better education.

loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
She is married and has six children living in a nine room’s house at Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.she hates thinking about the death,sickness,and the attacked by harm rubbers . She is very confident that the business will be successful because she has grasp perfect knowledge about her petit trading business, booming sales during Christmas and the strategic location of the business.
      The loan from Ghape will be used to buy poultry, seedlings like high grade corn, beans, cassava, plantains and coco yams. The community will benefit from manure from poultry, and sell of farm produce at cheaper prices.

With the profit from the business, she will be able to expand her business, educate her children in school, look after her health situation, and also cater for the needs of the family. She prefers a loan from Ghape because it has low interest rates and a new loan can be given as soon as you finish the old one, also couple with the fact that GHAPE offers non financial services that is training and social networking

loans.use: TO BUY seedlings like hi corn,  beans, cassava, plantains and coco yams.

loans.name: Luz Nelly

texts.en:
Luz is 55 years old and lives in the municipality of Medellín. She is a widow that has found her way through life, with her 3 daughters, who thanks so much to her mother for providing for them and turning them into great women. Before her husband die, he taught her to sell and left her a place to sell products like snacks, coffee and cigarettes. 

She has been working in that for around 9 years, and she loves working in it. She hopes she can improve her business so it can last for more time because is the only way she has to provide for her family. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy more inputs and some thermos to carry more coffee. 

Luz dreams with improving the conditions of her house and with having a good quality of life. You can help Luz with the loan she needs and get her closer to accomplish her goals.

loans.use: buy more inputs and some thermos to carry more coffee

loans.name: Ephraim

texts.en: Ephraim is married with six children.She lives in Vituka area of Dae es Salaam.Ephraim owns and runs a refleshment Center located near her residence.He is a retired Civil servant,the business is a sole income generating unit for the family.He opened this center from the retirement benefits accrued to him for his service in the public sector.In his center he sells cold drinks,alcoholic drinks and different kinds of snacks.The most popular snack of which people travel a long way to get it is ‘fried pork meat’ locally known as ‘kitimoto’.The demand during x-mass was imaginable.His center is used by the  people of the area as a place to reflesh after working hours.He is in a plan to improve the business by adding enough stock of drinks and more important sitting chairs and tables.He experienced chairs and tables shortages during x-mass.He do not want to lose so many customers as he losed during x-mass due to insufficient chairs.He is in need of USD 1000 to increase the stock of drinks, sitting tables and chairs.

loans.use: Adding stock of drinks,chairs and tables

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en:
4 years ago Rasim decided to start this business. 
In the beginning of his business he borrowed $600 and bought welding apparatus.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy materials.
This 42-year-old man is anInternally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region , settled in Fizuli region Mahmudlu village. He is married and has 3 children.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Telena

texts.en:
Telena is the President and the Centre Chief of SPBD’s center in the Samoan village of Sagafili Mulifanua. She operates an elei printing (hand-painted fabrics) and sewing business. Telena will create a fabric design, hand paint it, and custom tailor it all according to her customers’ wishes. Her whole family – her four children and their spouses – all participate in the business and help her make the designs and paint the fabrics. She extended her home to include a small shop where she can display her products and consult with her customers. She also hung a sign on the front of this shop to help market her capabilities.

Telena has a long and successful history with SPBD and has used four previous loans to help her grow her now-successful enterprise. With an outstanding record of on-time repayment, she is eligible for future funds, and she will use the opportunity to continue to reinvest in and upgrade her business.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics and paints

loans.name: Maman

texts.en:
T. Maman is a young single mother with 2 children. She sells utensils. She lives in Yopougon, a township in northern Abidjan. She is solely responsible for the educations and living expenses of her children, and her business is her only revenue source.

She joined the AE&I microcredit program in June, 2004 when she heard about our institution from her sister. Her dream is to open a big store someday. She requests the loan to increase her stock of goods and improve her margins.

loans.use: Touré Maman will use the loan to purchase household goods in bulk.

loans.name: Evelin Polanco

texts.en: Evelin Palanco is 23 years old, married and has a 7-year-old daughter. Her husband is a proud man who works in a law office. Evelin's life is very busy because she is a self-employed saleswoman who buys clothes in the capital and resells them in her town.  One way she attracts new customers is by allowing people to buy on credit and repay her at the end of the week. Demand for her clothes is high, and Evelin would like to expand her business -- and her income -- by acquiring new inventory. To do this, she is asking for a loan of $350, which she will repay in 6 months.

loans.use: To buy new products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Dayie Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dayie is an enterprising woman for whom the key to success is good, hard, strenuous work. She worked for six years and with the savings was able to open a store in the small dwelling that she shares with her mother. Now, after significant effort and time spent, she is able to see the fruits of her labor and of the high level of attention she gave to her sales. It is for this reason that she plans to continue progressing and increasing the quantity of goods she sells in her small store. She dreams of owning her own home and having the satisfaction of having succeeded in raising her only two children to be self supporting. Let us help Dayie continue on the path of progress.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Dayie es una mujer emprendedora consciente de que solo el trabajo esforzado es la llave del éxito, estuvo trabajando desde hace 6 años y con sus ahorros pudo abrir una tienda en la pequeña morada que habita con su madre. Luego de mucho tiempo y esfuerzo ahora puede observar los frutos de la calidad de atención que la caracteriza y de las ofertas que otorga. Es por ello que tiene en mente seguir progresando e incrementando aún más la cantidad de artículos de su pequeño centro de ventas porque sueña con tener su propia casita y la satisfacción de haber logrado que sus dos únicos hijos puedan sostenerse por sí mismos.Apoyemos a Dayie a seguir en el camino del progreso.

loans.use: Increase in capital for the purchase of basic goods so that she can better satisfy the needs of her dear clients.

loans.name: Ma

texts.en: Mrs. Ma N., age 49, is a widow who works selling rice and various kinds of Khmer food, earning about $6 per day. She has six children. Two are employed at a garment factory, earning about $70-80 per month each, one is a student, and three are married and live separately. She would like to request a loan of $600 in order to purchase more inventory and expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her inventory of rice and Khmer food.

loans.name: Sartinah

texts.en: Sartinah, 36, raises ducks at her house, and then sells their eggs to the market, earning USD16. Her husband, S., sells kerosene door-to-door and earns USD26 a week.  She is requesting a loan of USD150 to buy more ducks to raise. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more ducks

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 28-year-old man. He lives in the Beirut suburbs with his wife and their 2 children. Ali owns a grocery store. He needs a loan of US$ 1200 loan to buy merchandise for his business. Ali is doing his best to support his family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to expand his little grocery business

loans.name: Veronica's Tumaini. Group

texts.en:
Veronica is a married woman with 3 children, ages 12, 6 and 2 ½. She owns a small charcoal store, which she started in 2001, and is a batique designer. She works everyday from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $290 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan of $725 to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in cloth selling, chicken keeping and wholesaling.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal  for her business.

loans.name: Sedina

texts.en:
Sedina was born in 1973 and she lives together with her husband in a small village near the town of Gračanica. Her husband works as a policeman. His monthly salary is 700 KM (about US$ 560). He has a full-time job. They have two children, 9 and 14 years old, and both of them are going to primary school.

This is Sedina's second loan at MCO WWI. Sedina will use this loan in the amount of US$ 975 to buy a cow. Her wish is to improve the living standard of her family with additional money that she will earn by selling milk and milk products.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Sorahon

texts.en: M. Sorahon lives in the Asht region. As many of her fellow villagers, she is engaged with livestock. It is a family business but she is responsible for her own duties. Mrs. M. Sorahon is responsible for the taking care of the animals and its milk production and sour products making. It is  very hard work so her children help out. Mrs. M. Sorahon is married and has 4 children. She also works on the collective farm. She works hard to ensure a good future for her children. Now Mrs. M. Sorahon applies to KIVA for a business development loan of 1900 TJS for 7 months. She will use the loan to purchase special modernized equipment  for milk processing and milk-sour products production.

loans.use: To purchase special modernized equipment  for milk processing and  milk-sour products.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard N. sells electronics. He is single and his income is not sufficient for Richard and his three dependents. Demand for his goods is high and he is looking to expand his business. He is asking for additional capital to expand his business to increase his profits.

loans.use: To expand his business selling electronics.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Click this link to view Getrudes' first loan.

Getrudes is a member of the Arco Iris Village Bank. She is 36 years old and is married with five children at home. She travels to the regional fairs where she sells fruit and vegetables and where she buys cereal, cheese, and at times processed cereal that she sells in the markets of the city of Ayacucho. Gertrudes works on a farm during crop season.

Gertrudes needs a loan of 1400 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($US525) to buy more pigs, sheep, cheese and cereals in order to expand her business.

Gertrudes' dreams are that her working capital increases, that she will be economically established and that her children will become professionals.

loans.use: To buy more pigs, sheep, cheese and cereals in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr:
Born on March 29, 1976 in Abomey, the ancient capital of Benin, Ms. Emilienne A. is married to Mr. Nicolas Avoce. She has two children who are both in school. Three years ago, she opened a computer store which offers different services to the public, such as photocopying, scanning, typing of documents, and even training in computers. In order to offer quality services to the public, she is requesting her second loan for 360,000 francs so she can buy computer accessories.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 29 Mars 1976 à Abomey dans la capitale historique du BENIN, dame A. Emilienne est mariée à monsieur AVOCE Nicolas. Elle est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Elle a ouvert depuis trois ans, un centre informatique qui offre au public différents services tels que la photocopie, le scannage, la saisie de documents et même la formation en informatique. Dans le but d'offrir au public des services de qualité, elle sollicite pour son deuxième crédit 360 000 francs pour l'achat d'accessoires informatiques.

loans.use: Purchase of two laser printers, two cartons of A4 paper, and 4 ink cartridges

loans.name: Mwaka's Hiyari Ya Moyo Group

texts.en:
Mwaka is 40 years old. She is a single mother of three children, aged 17, 15, and 11 years old. She has been a bedsheet seller since 2003. She works at her business everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Mwaka is requesting a loan to buy more bedsheets for resale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling either clothing or firewood.

loans.use: To buy more bedsheets for resale.

loans.name: Mr. Ban Vebol's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Ten people in Chrolong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province have formed to request a village bank loan which will be used for various purposes. Mr. Ban V. is the village bank president and he is a fisherman in the local lake. In order to catch more fish, Mr. Ban V. has decided to request a loan to purchase more fish nets. His wife, Mrs. Eourn Im, owns a small store in the local village from which she sells desserts . Mr. Ban V. is 27 years old and the father of two young children who are both too young to work or study.

This is a village bank loan consisting mainly of end-of-term loans. The members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more fish nets

loans.name: Nhy

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhy C. is a villager in Andoung Samrith village in Takeo Province. She owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn her income. She is currently facing an obstacle in earning enough money for her needs.

Her husband, Mr. Yin Samorn, is a construction worker and does not earn much money.  Therefore Mrs. Nhy C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding purposes. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living standard with this loan. She is 40 years old and the mother of two children.  Two are employed in a garment factory and the other two children are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding purposes

loans.name: Israel Feliciano

texts.es: El señor Israel Feliciano S. Vásquez, de 41 años, la cual se dedica a la fabricación de cortes típicos, cuenta con 25 años de experiencia, ya que cuando fue joven laboro para doña Juana García, quienes se dedicaban también a la fabricación de cortes típicos, de donde adquirió experiencia en las diferentes etapas para la elaboración de los materiales de este tipo de artesanía, siendo entusiasta inicio su propio taller de fabricación de cortes típicos, en donde fue creciendo poco a poco a través de los prestamos que adquirió en la Asociación ASDIR, por lo que ahora cuenta con demasiada demanda y solicita un préstamo de Q, 5, 508.00, quetzales para comprar mas telares y materia prima, para así poder incrementar su capital, ya que con ello también ayudara a que mejoren la condición de vida de su familia y ayudara a generar dos fuentes de empleo en su comunidad del Caserío Chotacaj, Aldea Vásquez, Totonicapán Guatemala.
texts.en:
Mr. Israel Feliciano S. Vásquez, is 41 years old and works in the handicraft of typical native dress. He has 25 years experience, having worked for Mrs. Juana García in the same business when he was younger and learned the different stages of processing the materials. Empowered by that experience, Israel started his own handicraft workshop for typical native dress, growing slowly with the help of loans he acquired through the ASDIR Association. He is now in high demand and is applying for a loan of 5,508 quetzales to buy more looms and raw materials, in order to increase his capital, so that he can improve the quality of life for his family and help generate two sources of employment in his community of Caserío Chotacaj, Aldea Vásquez in the Totonicapán Region of Guatemala.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts (To raise capital)

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa R. is forty years old. She is married and the mother of three kids -- one is her biological child, and she also is taking care of her late brother's kids. Currently all the kids are in school. 

She and her family live in Atebubu. Where they live is a typical farming community, where most settlers do farming, specifically crop farming. But Hawa opts to deal in supplying cloth, a business she started fifteen years ago with an amount of $20 at that time. Now Hawa can boast of its business expansion, which she accomplished with that little seed money with which she started her business. Since that time she has maintained product quality and customer relations. She requests the loan to buy more clothing materials like cloth, linen, and lace. Hawa treks her product to the surrounding communities to sell during their market days. 

Through the proceeds from her output she has able to build a three-bedroom house with the able help of her husband. She is prepared to sell everything on her to give her kids good quality education. She said she would be grateful for your support. 

Hawa belongs to a group in her community known as ‘Ruth.’ The group members agree to guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more fabric to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.fr: Aida N., 33 ans mariée, 11 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Mbirdiam à Thiès. Elle veut acheter de la marchandise (céréales, légumes, poissons séchés et poissons fumés)  pour renforcer son commerce. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer le bien être et la santé  de ses enfants.  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Aida N., age 33, is married and has eleven children to look after. She is a member of the village council of Mbirdiam in Thiès. Aida wants to buy merchandise (grain, vegetables, dried and smoked fish) to boost her commerce. The income derived from her commerce enables her to improve the well-being and health of her children. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell grain, vegetables, dried fish, and smoked fish

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana es una joven que desea progresar en la vida, a sus 21 años es madre de la pequeña Katerine de 4 años, a la cual cuida con mucho amor y dedicación, vive en su casa propia de manera independiente y quiere darle unos buenos estudios a su única hija. Yendo casa por casa, Roxana vende sus productos cosméticos a sus habituales clientes, es una convincente vendedora, puesto que acaba con sus productos fácilmente, ella se divierte mucho vendiendo, ya que conversar con sus clientes es lo que más le gusta de sus trabajo, anhela poder tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus productos de belleza sin necesidad de salir a la calle todos los días, ya que le resulta muy cansado ir casa por casa y es muy difícil luego cobrarle a las persona que compraron sus cosméticos. Lleva 2 años en este negocio y sabe que tiene que ponerle todas sus ganas y esfuerzo para salir adelante y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, puesto que quiere brindarle a su hija una buena vida y unos adecuados estudios. Es el segundo préstamo de Roxana con MFP y es muy puntual en sus cuotas, ya que siempre ahorra para poder pagarlas, en su banco comunal es muy activa y siempre está pendiente del bienestar de las demás socias. Roxana invertirá los seiscientos nuevos soles en incrementar la cantidad de sus productos de belleza, para brindarles a sus clientes una mayor opción de compra.
texts.en:
Roxana is a young woman who desires to get ahead in life. At 21 years old she is mother to young Katerine, who is 4 years old. She cares for her with a lot of love and dedication. She lives independently in her own home and she wants to provide her only child with a good education. Roxana sells her cosmetic products from house to house to her regular customers. She is a convincing saleswoman and easily sells out of her products. She has a lot of fun selling since conversing with her customers is what she likes most about her job. She desires to be able to have a store where she can sell her beauty products without the need to go out on the street every day, as it is tiring going from house to house and difficult to later collect payments from the people who bought her cosmetics. She has been in this business for 2 years and knows that she has to put all her will and strength into it in order to get ahead and improve her economic returns. She does this so she can provide her daughter with a good life and appropriate studies. This is the second loan Roxana has had with MFP and she is very punctual in her payments since she always saves to be able to pay them. She is very active in her community bank and always attentive to the well-being of the other members. Roxana will invest the 600 nuevos soles in increasing the quantity of her beauty products to be able to offer her customers more purchasing options.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: El señor Víctor Manuel, habita en el barrio San Juan ubicado en la Concepción junto a su esposa y tres hijos, la esposa de don Victor se dedica al comercio desde hace veinticinco años y él es agricultura; los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de sus hijos ya que todos duermen en un mismo cuarto, los sueños de don Victor es llegar a establecer mas cultivo de pitahaya para obtener mas ingresos y darle un mejor futuro a sus pequeños. Con el financiamiento quiere comprar fertilizantes para aplicárselo al cultivo y así obtener una mejor producción y vender a mejor precio al mercado.
texts.en:
Mr. Victor Manuel lives in the San Juan neighborhood, located in La Concepción, together with his wife and three children. Victor’s wife has dedicated herself to commerce for the past twenty-five years, and he is a farmer. His plans for his family include providing better living conditions for them, since they all sleep in the same room. Victor dreams of being able to plant more pitahaya (“dragon fruit”) crops, so he can earn a better income and provide a brighter future for his young ones. With the financing, he would like to buy fertilizers to apply to his crops. In this manner, he can have a better rate of production and sell his goods for a better price at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and agricultural products to improve his production.

loans.name: Las Pioneras Group

texts.es: El grupo " Las Pioneras esta representada por L. señora Rosemary  y conformada por 12 miembros los cuales se dedican a actividades económicas D. ventas D. productos como batidos, alfombras, cosméticos, fruta y abarrotes. Los socios (as) tiene  ingresos diarios pero en días particulares L. venta es mínima y L. competencia granD. en especial con los juego D. los precios, pero L. mayoría D. las socias ya saben como salir adelante para llevar el pan d cada DIA a sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para L. adquisición D. materiales insumos para mejorar L. calidad D. sus productos y poder hacerle frente a L. competencia en precios y calidad. El grupo lleva cursando su segundo ciclo con L. institución demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos por lo que saben como administrar sus propios fondos sin desperdiciarlos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosemary is the representative of the group "Las Pioneras" (The Pioneers), maD. up of 12 members who work selling different products like milkshakes, carpet, cosmetics, fruit, and groceries. The members have daily income but on certain days sales are down, especially because of price competition. However, the majority of the members already know how to get ahead to proviD. the daily bread for their families. The loan is to acquire supplies to improve the quality of their products and be able to take on the competition in price and quality. The group has completed two loans with this institution and shown themselves to be punctual and responsible with their payments since they know how to manage their money without wasting it.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business supplies

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita P. has a business raising hogs. Through her simple business, she is able to help her husband provide for the needs of her family and send their youngest child to school. She doesn't depend too much on the remittances her husband, who is working abroad, sends home. To further expand her business, Merlita is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 that she will use as additional business capital. She hopes that someday she can generate a bigger income and become successful to better provide for her family.

Merlita is 50 years old and her husband Victoriano is working as a domestic helper abroad. They live a simple life in Barangay Rizal, Quirino, Isabela. They have six children: Mary Jane is 31, Marivic is 29, Marites is 27, Noverly is 25, Erwin is 23, and the youngest is Maria Teresa, a 13 year old high school student. Merlita prays that her youngest daughter will finish her high school and college education.

loans.use: To invest in her business raising pigs.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Mr. Yin H. uses a horse and cart to transport passengers and merchandise around his community. From this service, he makes $5 a day to meet his family's daily living expenses. He is married with two teenage children who are students in the local school. In addition, his wife raises a few pigs at home for sale.

Mr. H. would like a loan from Kiva's partner HKL to establish a rice mill machine to provide a service hulling rice for farmers. The family hopes to earn extra income as the mature rice season is approaching.

Mr. H.'s wife is pictured.

loans.use: To establish a rice mill machine

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 40 años, es una madre jornalera y muy cumplidora, vive en su casa propia con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos, por lo que lucha incansablemente a diario, con la finalidad de convertirlos en hombres de bien para la sociedad. Tiene cultivos de arverjas y papas, para ello se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno de su esposo que regresa a las 7.00am después de haber trabajado en sus cultivos durante la madrugada. Los 22 años que lleva como agricultora le han dado la experiencia necesaria para conocer las temporadas y el clima, para de acuerdo a ello determinar qué productos deberá sembrar primero. Ana está muy complacida con sus cultivos y más aún con sus cosechas, las cuales le son muy rentables en su tiempo. Para más adelante espera incrementar el número de sus cultivos, aunque hay que tener mucha paciencia para desarrollar sus plantas desde muy pequeñas hasta que maduren, como ésta, su chacra de arvejas, donde decidió tomarse la foto. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, durante los periodos consecutivos de crédito demostró ser una cliente muy responsable con cada uno de sus pagos a su banco comunal, asimismo para este ciclo hace promesas de seguir trabajando con el mismo dinamismo. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos, para el desarrollo de sus cultivos de arvejas, flores y papas que viene sembrando cada año.
texts.en:
Ana is 40 years old, she is a very hard working mother, she lives in her own house with her couple and father of her 3 children, so she works tirelessly in order to turn them into men of good for society. She grows peas and potatoes, so she wakes up very early to prepare breakfast for her husband who comes back at 7am after working on the farm during the early morning hours. The 22 years she has been working as a farmer give her enough experience to know the season and weather, which is very profitable for her. In the future she expects to increase the plants she farms, although you need a lot of patience to grow plants from the beginning like the pea plants where she took the picture. This is her 5th loan with MFP, during the previous loans she showed to be a very responsible with all her payments to the community bank, she promises to keep on paying the same way. She will invest the money on buying chemical fertilizers in order to develop the pea plants, flowers and potatoes that she farms each year.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Asyaxanım

texts.en: Asyaxanım Y. and her husband regard education as the most important inheritance they can give their four dear children. They are both very responsible parents, and work hard in farming so that they can give their children the opportunity to finish school – an opportunity they never had due to poor finances. Asyaxanım is a happy mother who has been working in agriculture since getting married. With the unconditional support of her husband and elder son, she buys and sells cattle in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. She now finds herself with more expenses, and she would like a loan in order to enlarge their capital by increasing the number of cattle they own. Asyaxanım and her family are awaiting your support.

loans.use: To purchase three baby calves

loans.name: Rudy Ramiro

texts.es: El Sr. Rudy Ramiro A. A., tiene como actividad económica la confección de chamarras y otras prendas las que realiza según temporada,  actividad que desarrolla hace 14 años, constituyéndose en una fuente principal de ingresos para el y su madre. Los madre e hijo son los que trabajan en la confeccion, siendo don Rudy el principal sosten de su sñora madre.
texts.en:
Mr. Rudy Ramiro A. A. has been making jackets and other articles of clothing, according to the season, for 14 years. He and his mother both make the clothes but he is the principal bread winner in the family.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crédito destinado para la compra de materia prima.

loans.name: Conforte

texts.fr:
K. Conforte est née en 1938 à Avrankou, un village situé dans le département de l'Ouémé à quelques kilomètres de Porto-Novo, la capitale de la République du Bénin.  Conforte est mariée et mère de quatre enfants qui ne sont plus à sa charge.  Actuellement, elle habite à Cotonou, la ville la plus grande de Bénin. 

Conforte vend des bananes, plantains, des fruits saisonniers. Elle fait ses achats au marché Dantokpa, un grand marché à Cotonou.  Elle revend ses marchandises de façon ambulante et à domicile.  Elle est actuellement à son troisième crédit d’Alidé.  Conforte sollicite un nouveau crédit pour rehausser le niveau de son activité.  Elle voudrait acheter plus de bananes, plantains, d’autres fruits.
texts.en:
K. Conforte was born in 1938 in Avrankou, a village located in Ouémé county a few kilometers from Porto-Novo, the capital of Republic of Benin. She is married and the mother of four children, who she no longer supports. Currently she lives in Cotonou, the largest city in Benin. Conforte sells bananas, plantains, and seasonal fruit. She makes her purchases at the Dantokpa market, a large marketplace in Cotonou. She resells her merchandise door-to-door and out of her home. She is now on her third loan with Alidé. She is requesting a new loan to raise her level of business. She would like to buy more bananas, plantains, and other fruit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bananas, plantains, and other fruit

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa E. is married and has 6 dependents. She has received no formal education. Adjoa sells fish at Ankwandah near Elmina, which she has done since 2001. Her husband is a farmer. Adjoa uses her income to pay housekeeping expenses.

Adjoa will use the loan to purchase more fish for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Carlina

texts.en:
Carlina is 53 years old and married to Leopoldo.  They are living in Cabisera 25, Ilagan, Isabela. His husband is working as a carpenter and sometimes as a farmer.  They are blessed with eight children, seven of them are already married. Most of them finished a two-year course in college. 

Carlina has been managing her village store for almost six years.  However, due to financial difficulties brought by economic crisis, she had experienced failure in her business.  She is glad that she was able to maintain the business.  She wanted to improve it and she is now asking for  and to further improve it, she is requesting a loan amounting to PHP10, 000 as additional business capital to make her business more progressive and sustainable for the future of her family.  The loan will be of big help towards the survival of her business and she hopes that through the loan, she could expand her business.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Abisola

texts.en: Abisola sells notebooks, textbooks, toys and cosmetics in her shop. She has been in this business for a long time. Abisola is 40 years old and married with three children. Abisola is very enthusiastic and hopes to increase the growth of her business. Abisola is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more notebooks and textbooks to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more notebooks and textbooks to sell

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe U. runs a sari-sari (general store) selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc. in his community. He is 78 years old, widowed and has two adult children. He is from the village of Poblacion 1 Clarin Misamis Occidental. Felipe has been in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 20,000 pesos a month.

In 2006, Felipe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Felipe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 pesos from GDMPC. Felipe is requesting a new loan of 50,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 36th loan taken out by Felipe from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 43 years old and she is married with seven children. She sells foodstuffs like bags of rice and beans and has been in this business for a long time.

Florence is determined to lift her business and family above poverty and hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She hopes for the loan of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Tuafale

texts.en:
Tuafale M. is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Laulii Maagila. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Tuafale owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling baked goods in the local community. Tuafale just begun this business and earns approximately 300 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Tuafale joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tuafale is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Tuafale plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Akoma Adweo Group

texts.en:
Theresa is married and has three kids and lives with her family in a small farming community in the eastern region of Ghana. She is 28 years old.

Theresa sells lingerie products like underwear, panties, brassieres, skirts, etc., and has been in business for three years now. She also trades in earrings and sells through hawking (selling on foot) in and around the community market.

Theresa is constrained by funds to run the business. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up her business progress as we approach Christmas festivities. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality and a large quantity to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for that assistance.

Theresa is the leader of a trust bank group called “Akoma Adweo” which literally means a “sober heart”. She is the one seated in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers respectively. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and provide peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase items like lingerie, underwear, material, etc.

loans.name: Emi

texts.en: Emi T. is a 55-year-old woman living in the town of Vaimoso Jr. She is married and has twelve adult children. Emi owns and operates a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 550 WST a month. In 2008, Emi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Emi is now requesting a new loan of 1,750 WST which will again be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. Emi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreypov Y., 30, and her husband, Mr. Vun Sok, 49, live along national road number one about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2006 and have three children: one son and two daughters. Besides her children, she also has her mother  living with her.

Sreypov has been selling sugar cane juice in front of her home since 2008, while her husband has been a construction contractor for six years. He does not have enough materials for operating his business, so Sreypov is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase additional construction materials for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Nheb

texts.en: Nheb K., 38, is married with three school-aged children. She resides in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia with her husband (pictured) and children. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of grinding rice and selling it to her existing and new customers, earning an income of US $5 per day. Her husband transports dirt and sand to fill out the land for people in the province, earning an income of US $14 per day. Both sources of income from K. and her husband help cover the family expenses. K. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, K. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase a machine to pump sand from the rivers and ponds. This is her third loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. She hopes that in the future she will be able to run a big business of selling dirt and sand. She even wants her children to finish high school and continue to the university.

loans.use: To buy a machine to pump sand from rivers and ponds.

loans.name: Tsedenbal

texts.en:
Tsedenbal is 30 years old and lives with his wife and 4-year-old son in Uvs province, Mongolia. His son is in kindergarten while his wife operates a milk-trading business.

Tsedenbal operates a raw material business in his town where he sells things like sheep and goat skins. He started his business in 2004 with the help of his brother and enabled himself to buy a car in order to start a taxi service as well. His raw material business is the most profitable in October and November when Mongolians prepare meat that will be eaten during the winter.

Tsedenbal would eventually like to expand his house as his children get older so that the family can be more comfortable. He says, “I want to save enough money for my children’s education.”

Tsedenbal is requesting an 800,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase more raw materials for the upcoming busy season.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita M. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread at a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to purchase soft drinks such as sodas, water and juice to sell. Rita is 29 years old and married to a teacher. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a beauty salon.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC, a Kiva partner, has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks such as sodas, water and juice to sell

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El Señor Miguel tiene 28 años, esta casado con la Sra. Eva Jara y  tienen dos hijos menores de edad. 
Miguel se dedica a la venta de artículos varios, como prendas deportivas, accesorios y aparatos celulares, electrodomésticos pequeños y todo tipo de mercaderías de acuerdo a los pedidos que recibe, sus ventas las realiza en ciudades del interior del país como Concepción y San Pedro.  Se inició en esta actividad en el año 2008.
Ellos viven en la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
Este crédito será de mucha utilidad para la compra de mercaderías que respondan a los pedidos de temporada escolar que ya se está iniciando, pues están realizan mas viajes de lo previsto gracias a que están aumentando los pedidos y la clientela.
El anhelo de este matrimonio es poder ampliar la casa que con mucho sacrificio están logrando construir, ademas de poder adquirir un vehículo propio que les permita realizar sus viajes de una forma mas segura .
texts.en:
Miguel is 28 years old. He is married to Eva Jara and they have 2 young children. Miguel sells various goods, such as athletic clothing, cellular parts and accessories, small household appliances, and all kinds of requested merchandise. He works in the interior regions of the country, such as in Concepción and San Pedro. He has been doing this work since 2008. Miguel and his wife live in the city of San Lorenzo. The loan will be used to purchase merchandise being requested for the upcoming school year. He is making more sales trips than he expected, thanks to more orders from his customers. The goal of this couple is to be able to expand their home, which they are currently doing with a lot of sacrifice. They would also like to be able to buy their own vehicle, which would provide them a safer means of travel.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cellular phone accessories, sandwich grills, lunch boxes, insulated thermoses, cotton t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Magezi Bugaga Group, Mukono

texts.en:
At the top left of the group photo is N. Jane. She is 50 years old and the leader of her lending group in Mukono. Jane is a hard-working lady with a retail shop business in Kisega that has been in existence for 20 years, and she is happy that she is able to make weekly profits amounting to 100,000/=. She is married with 7 children as she also takes care of  orphans. In order to continue taking good care of her family in every way, she hopes to expand her business by constructing her own business premises so that she can stop renting.  This will also enable her to provide school fees for all her dependents. 

Jane needs a loan to be able to restock her shop with more goods as well as to pay school fees for her children. She says that all in all, her loans help to boost her capital base. (At the back left is the Accountant for the branch, hence not part of the group.)

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more goods and completing school fees for her children

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es: La señora M. tiene un tramo ubicado en el Mercado Ernesto Fernández el cual le permite que tenga ingresos para poder subsistir junto con su familia, ella tiene tres hijos menores los que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella visito las oficinas de Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito y comprar ropa de bebé, pantaloncitos de niños y niñas, blusitas y camisetas, una paca mixta de niños e insumos de costura, esto para surtir un poco más su negocio y poder brindarle una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos con la ganancia que obtenga.
texts.en:
Señora M. has a stall in the Ernesto Fernández Market, which permits her to have income to enable her and her family to have a means of support. She has three young children of school age. She visited the offices of Ceprodel to apply for a loan to buy baby clothes, boys' and girls' pants, blouses and shirts, a bale of mixed children's clothes, and sewing supplies. This will stock her business a little more, and the earnings that she will obtain will offer her and her children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy baby clothes, boys' and girls' pants, blouses and shirts, a bale of mixed children's clothes, and sewing supplies

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina,  tiene 49 años y tiene cinco hijos D. las cuales todos son independientes,  ella es una madre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario apoyar a sus hijos.

Josefina alterna sus actividades del hogar con su negocio D. venta D. chicha D. quinua D. forma ambulatoria. Ya son 20 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella venD. el vaso D. chicha a 50 céntimos y por día venD. tres baldes D. chicha y gana aproximadamente 60 soles. 

Josefina pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” D. la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son 15 años que funciona el banco comunal y ella participa. Su primer crédito D. la socia fue D. 100 dólares D. las cuales invirtió en su negocio. Actualmente,  la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo quinua, azúcar y leña. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Josefina is 49 years old and has five adult children, all independent. She is a responsible mother who constantly searches for opportunities to advance and give support to her children. She alternates her household responsibilities with those of her business, selling “chicha” on foot. (Chicha is a fermented drink.) She has been doing this for 20 years and it has been going very well, thanks to the effort she puts into it. She sells each glass of chicha for 50 céntimos and sells a total of three buckets per day, earning approximately 60 PEN. Josefina is a member of the “TERCER MILENIO” (Third Millennium) communal bank of the Arariwa Association. The bank has been operating for 15 years. Her first loan was for $100, which she used to invest into her business. Now she is needs a loan to buy supplies, such as quinine, sugar, and firewood. She is grateful for the opportunity she has been given and promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplires

loans.name: Nai

texts.en: Mrs. C., 39, is a married woman living in Phnom Penh. She is a crop grower and a good homemaker who currently stays at home to care for her children and do housework. She has three kids: two are studying and also work; another one is no longer in school and helps her planting crops. She has a life partner in her husband who assists with her on the farm. C. is taking out her loan to purchase different kinds of fruits to sell for Khmer New Years. This will provide C. with additional income.

loans.use: To purchase fruit.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor es un joven emprendedor de 26 años, casado y juntos viven solos en su casa propia. Hace más de 10 años que trabaja en su panadería, por lo que agradece el haber encontrado este trabajo, en donde aprendió todos los secretos para elaborar pan. Durante estos años de experiencia le han valido a Víctor ser muy conocido y valorado su trabajo, pues nadie prepara el pan como él, por todo esto, se siente muy contento y motivado para seguir adelante y más por familia. Su mayor anhelo es instalar un negocio en el que Víctor y su esposa puedan trabajar juntos, como una tienda de comestibles o un bazar, pero aún no lo tienen definido. Ellos esperan progresar poco a poco y así preparar el hogar para sus futuros hijos. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual en todos los pagos de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará ingredientes para la preparación de sus panes y además hacer algunos arreglos en la infraestructura de su hogar y acondicionar su futuro negocio.
texts.en:
Victor is a 26-year-old entrepreneur. He and his wife live alone in their own home. For more than 10 years, Victor has been working in a bakery. He’s grateful for his job, which has allowed him to learn all the secrets to bread-making. Victor’s many years of experience have earned him plenty of customer appreciation-- no one bakes it like Victor! This praise is exactly what he needs to keep him working hard and supporting his family. Victor wants to set up a storefront, where he and his wife can work together selling groceries or other products. At this point, though, it’s still just a dream. Little by little, they are hoping to prepare their home for any future children. This is Victor’s third loan with MFP, and he has promised to make all his payments on time. Victor plans to buy ingredients for making bread, make a few repairs to his home, and put a little toward his future business.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients for making bread; completing home repairs.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Ms. Augustina R. V., 30 years old, is a single mother with two children in school. Very entrepreneurial, Augustina weaves blankets and handmade tablecloths, taking her products monthly to sell in the markets in Luque, which is 100 Km from her city. Thanks to this enterprise she now has her own house and is able to provide a dignified and comfortable life for her children.

Augustina is now requesting a loan that will go towards purchasing thread and colors to weave hammocks, as this is the season when many of her clients are requesting them.

loans.use: To purchase threads and colors

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy C. is from the village of Bantug. She is 55 years old. Remy is widowed and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Remy owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alterations & tailoring services to local community members. Remy has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Remy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. Remy is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & threads. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Remy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & threads

loans.name: Group 2

texts.en:
Nedilen O., from the village of Puntod Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental, is the 29-year-old group leader of a three-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Married with three school-aged children, Nedilen owns and operates a business venture that sells fresh fish in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 1000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Nedilen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC, she is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used as additional capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the daily needs of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Mr. Tha Aom Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mr. Tha A. was born in 1972. He is the village bank president who has been selected by 13 people who live in Preaek Louk village in Kandal province.
