Ella es comerciante y se dedica a la venta varios productos como plásticos, ollas, cucharas, etc. lleva en el negocio hace un año y medio, trabaja todos los días sin un horario fijo.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su cuñada, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercadería como ollas, artículos de plástico, cucharas, etc.

Su meta es culminar sus estudios secundarios.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the “El Ahorro” (The Saving) communal bank.  She lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca.  The city has a cold climate and great natural and cultural beauty. Cuenca offers a diverse cuisine which entices its visitors.   Its people are kind, cordial, and charismatic.   They still maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.  

Carmen, age 26, is in a common-law marriage.  She has an eight year old son who attends a city school.  Her husband is a merchant.  They do not have their own house; they rent where they live.

Carmen is from the Portoviejo province.  She came to this city to visit her relatives.  However, she liked the city, and she stayed to work.  She is a merchant.  She sells various products like plastics, pots, and spoons, etc.  She has been in the business for a year and a half.  She works every day; she does not have a fixed schedule.

This is her first loan in her communal bank, which her sister-in-law invited her to join.  She will use the loan to buy more merchandise like pots, plastic products, and spoons, etc.

Her goal is to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy pots, plastic products, and spoons, etc.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 53 years old. She is a widow with four children.

Merlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Merlinda has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 25 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Merlinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es: Tania, de 37 años, es una mujer entusiasta con ganas de progresar. Es madre soltera, vive con sus tres hijos de 17, 8 y 2 años en su casa propia. Ella es madre y padre, por lo que tiene que esmerarse día a día. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de bebidas tales como; gaseosa, yogurt, néctar, lo cual realiza en un espacio muy bien  acondicionado en su propio domicilio, siendo muy concurrido por sus vecinos. Esta actividad viene realizando hace un año, contando con el apoyo de su hija en la atención al público. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que ha logrado ser conocida en el lugar, gracias a ello tiene mayor clientela, y eso le genera ganancias, para así brindar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Nos comenta que tiene planes de implementar su negocio y seguir creciendo. Este será su cuarto crédito con la institución MFP, lo cual se siente contenta por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo, y dice sentirse muy bien con su grupo por que son personas responsables. Con el préstamo solicitado, comprará variedades de bebidas como gaseosas, refrescos en mayor cantidad, así incrementará sus ganancias, y tener más acogida en su negocio.
texts.en:
37-year-old Tania is an enthusiastic woman who has a desire to make progress.  She is a single mother and lives with her three children, who are 17, 8 and 2 years old, in her own home.  She is both mother and father to her children and so she must try very hard every day.  Tania's business is selling drinks such as soda, yoghurt and nectars.  She carries out this work in a very well-adapted space in her own home which is very busy with neighbors.  She has been in this business for one year and has the support of her daughter in serving her customers.  What she likes about her work is that she has managed to become well known in her area, which means she has a lot of customers, which makes her profits, which enables her to provide her children with a better quality of life.  She tells us that she has plans to stock her business and continue growing.

This will be Tania's fourth loan from MFP.  She feels happy with the financial support that she has received and says that she feels very happy within her group because they are responsible people.  Tania will use the loan she has requested to buy a variety of drinks, such as sodas and soft drinks, in larger quantities.  This will increase her profits and her business will do better.

loans.use: to buy soda and soft drinks

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is 44-years-old and married with two grown up children. Roberto is a very hardworking and kind person. He is engaged in the farming business where he plants corn seed. Aside from farming, his spouse has a little store in front of their house.

Roberto is asking for a loan of P 30,000 to buy fertilizer and corn seed for his farm. He hopes that someday his business will expand enough to have a quality of living condition.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Niu

texts.en:
Niu is a 27-year-old woman living in the town of Sili. She is single and has one infant. Niu owns and operates a business raising crops, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Niu has been engaged in this business for over one year and earns approximately 600 WST a month from it.

In 2011, Niu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Niu is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  This will be Niu's 1st loan from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Tipapa

texts.en:
Tipapa is 30 years old, married and with his wife they have two children. He has been a maize farmer for the past five years. 

He learned about KADET through an advertisement done by KADET in the area where he lives. He is currently applying for his third loan with KADET, with which he plans to buy maize seeds for planting and also chemicals for spraying. 

He plans to use the proceeds from the loan to plow back into the farm. He is an honest man who can achieve more if supported financially.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds for planting.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, aged 46, is a single mother of one child, aged 22 years. She has been a dairy farmer for thirteen years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 8,300.

This is Mary's first loan with KADET. She will use the funds to buy cattle feeds, hay and tick spray.  Mary hopes to be a large scale dairy farmer in the future.

loans.use: To buy cattle feeds, tick spray and hay

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FIGURACORO, un des villages de KANGABA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est   l’arachide et riz  avec   FATOUMATA, 3ème personne debout de la  droite vers la   gauche de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau de KANGARE, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 70.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aider  aussi son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Mariela Nohemi

texts.en:
Mariela is a 41 year old woman, she lives under the marital law of Free Union, she has been living with her partner for a long time, with him she has 3 children, one of them, the oldest found "the one" and married him, now she has a family of her own. Mariela and her husband are still providing for two young children, who are 12 and 6 years old, they both attend school. 
In order to make a living, and help her husband to make a higher income she sells clothes on a street stand, her husband also owns two other stands in which he sells clothes too. Mariela's stand sells mostly lingerie and under clothes for women.
Mariela describes her self as a calm woman and a family person, she enjoys listening music and spending time with her children, she is proud of them and seeing them grow up is the biggest cheer she could have asked for.

loans.use: To stock up her stand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Gladys would like to invest in shares on the stock market.

loans.name: Yobani

texts.en:
I work making keys in one of the largest areas of the capital. I help people by unlocking their car door or by unlocking the door of their house. I now need to buy a small machine so that I can offer my clients better service and make higher-quality keys.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Me dedico a la elaboracion de llaves, este negocio lo tengo en una de las colonias mas grandes de la ciudad, tambien hago trabajos a domicilio cuando las personas me requieren para abrir puertas de carros o casas. Ahora necesito comprar una pequeña maquina para brindar a mis clientes un mejor servicio y fabricar llaves de mejor calidad.

loans.use: To buy a copper machine to make keys

loans.name: Zamina

texts.en:
Zamina wants to increase her earnings by offering new products.
She breeds calves and  cows and now she plans to increase the number of dairy cows , which will enable her to sell more milk.
Now she needs a loan of $950 to buy a milk cow.
Zamina is 38, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village. She is married andhas 3 children.
She has been in this business for 5 years.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Seam

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Seam was married in 1976 and has 7 children. She learned to weave silk in 1992 from her neighbor and then started making silk in the same year. Besides that, her family also plants rice and raises cows in the village. Her husband plants the rice, and sometimes assists his wife in weaving silk when he is free from the rice farm.         

She has borrowed loans from MAXIMA for four cycles already. The current loan amount is $600 which will be used to buy silk material and sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing thread on the loom. She is an existing client of MAXIMA and has the ability to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchase silk material and sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing thread on the loom.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata J. sells cosmetics in the open air market in Magburaka, Sierra Leone.  Forty seven years old and a mother of four children, she assists her husband to pay some of the family expenses.  She would like to increase her stock to generate more income.  She needs a loan of $200

loans.use: Increase her cosmetics business to help her family earn more income.

loans.name: Thi Thanh

texts.vi:
Ms Thạnh is 30 years old, she has 2 children. Her husband is a skilled worker. He used to work for others because he did not have money to start his own business. Now he has his own shop producing home furniture. He has a lot of orders from his customers so he has to hire someone to help. Ms Thạnh takes care of the household and helps him out when she has time. This time she applies for a loan to buy new tools in order to augment production.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si,.Kiva volunteer.

Chị Thạnh năm nay 30 tuổi, đã có hai con.Chồng chị là thợ có tay nghề cao, trước kia anh đi làm thuê vì cưa có vốn.Hiện nay anh mở xưởng làm tại nhà, sản xuất đò nội thất.Khác đặt hàng khá đông nên anh chị phải thuê người làm thêm.Ngoài công việc chăm sóc chồng và con cái chị còn phị giúp công việc làm cho chồng.Đợt vay vốn này chị mua thêm dụng cụ trong nghề nhằm nâng cao năng xuất hơn nữa.

loans.use: Having loans for buying producing tools

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch M., age 31, is a garment worker, earning $2 per day. Her husband is a carpenter, making about $2 per day. They have one child who is a student. She would like to request a loan of $600 in order to purchase a motorbike for her family’s transportation and to buy a plot of farmland to grow crops.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Central A (Iii) Group

texts.en:
Prossy is a livestock farmer. She rears cows, goats and sheep on a small scale. She wants to use the extra profits to construct a kraal and buy a water tank.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Gesusa

texts.es:
Gesusa A. lives, along with her husband (Mr. Modesto Cori) and five children, in her own home in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz. Mrs. Gesusa has a sales stand in the “Strongest” market in the Cotahuma zone, and her husband works in construction. The loan being solicited would be earmarked for building a dormitory for her children. This is the fourth time she seeks credit, and a socioeconomic analysis indicates that she is a favorable candidate for a loan. She has been a client of ours since 2005, and her previous loans were repaid under the established terms.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gesusa A. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo, el señor Modesto Cori y sus cinco hijos. La señora Gesusa tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado Strongest de la zona de Cotahuma y su esposo trabaja como constructor. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una habitación en obra fina, que será destinada a dormitorio para sus hijos. Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Ella es cliente nuestro desde el año 2005 y los créditos anteriores fueron pagados de acuerdo a los plazos establecidos.

loans.use: Build living space/dormitory for her children.

loans.name: Gabil

texts.en:
Gabil was born in 1980. He is married, has one child, and settled in the town of Khirdalan. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Zangilan region in Azerbaijan.

He has been selling fruit for 10 years. Now he is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Hazaia

texts.en:
Hazaia is the mother of four children, who are all in school. She has been buying and retailing groundnuts for the past ten years. Hazaia buys her nuts from Savlugu (northern part of Ghana) and it takes about twelve hours to arrive back to the village. She wants to use her loan to buy more bags of groundnuts to reduce her frequent trips to Savlugu.

Hazaia is a member of the group called One People. Members use peer pressure on themselves as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: Hazaia would like to buy more bags of groundnuts.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal M. is a widow with six children. Five of her children are married and live outside the family home. The youngest daughter is living with her and assisting in her business. The family lives along Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sophal has been in the business of selling flowers and bananas for over twenty years. She buys them from farmers in her village to resell at market in Phnom Penh.  Sophal  is requesting a loan of US$600 to purchase more flowers and bananas to resell.

loans.use: To purchase flowers and bananas to resell.

loans.name: Rosa Bertilda

texts.es:
Mrs. Bertilda M. runs a store selling cosmetics and clothes out of her humble home in San Rafael in Managua. She started the business with little merchandise but over time, she has been able to fill her display cabinets and offer all types of cosmetics and clothing for men and women.

She is now looking for a loan from Ceprodel in order to purchase additional merchandise to sell in her store. She is a faithful customer, having repaid all her previous loans on time and according to the rules of the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Bertilda M. se dedica al negocio de venta de cosméticos y ropa en su humilde casa de habitación en la ciudad de Managua específicamente en el municipio de San Rafael. Inició en el negocio con poca mercadería pero a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo ha logrado llenar sus vitrinas y ofrecer todo tipo de cosméticos y también ropa para caballeros y damas.

Hoy en día ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito con el cual comprar de sus proveedores la mercadería para luego ofrecerla a sus clientes en su sector de habitación. Actualmente es una fiel cliente habiendo cancelado todos sus créditos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido en la institución.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es:
I have a small tool business, which has been successful. It is my second source of income for my family since the company for which I work pays me minimum wage. With this business, I can cover the necessary household expenses. I am requesting a loan of $200.00 USD so that I can purchase more merchandise and have a well-stocked tool business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Cuento con una pequeña venta de herramienta, la cual me va bien es un segundo ingreso que aporto a mi familia ya que en la empresa donde laboro es mínimo el salario, de esta manera puedo sustentar mas lo s gastos necesarios en mi hogar, solicito préstamo por $200.00 para de esta forma comprar mas mercancía y tener surtido mi pequeño negocio de venta de herramienta.

loans.use: Supply tool business with merchandise

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es:
Franklin is a taxi driver. He works from Monday to Sunday and his wife works at a fast-food restaurant in one of the neighborhoods in the south part of La Paz. He has three school-age children who are 14, 13 and 11 years old. Franklin and his family live in the Alto Seguencoma area of La Paz, in a rented house.

His loan will be used to repair and maintain his taxi, which is his working tool and with which he is able to earn the income he needs to support his family.

This is the first time he has applied for a loan with IMPRO. The loan will help him a great deal, as he will be able to do a thorough maintenance so his vehicle will be in good working condition for at least a year. This way he will improve his income and quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Franklin es chofer de radio taxi; trabaja de lunes a domingo y su esposa es empleada en un snack de la zona Sur de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene tres hijos en edad escolar de 14, 13 y 11 años cada uno. Franklin y su familia viven en la zona de Alto Seguencoma de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa alquilada.

El crédito será destinado la reparación y mantenimiento de su radio taxi que es su herramienta de trabajo y con la cual logra ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia.

Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el crédito le ayudará de gran manera ya que podrá realizar un mantenimiento completo y el vehiculo podrá trabajar en buenas condiciones por lo menos un año, y así mejorará sus ingresos y calidad de vida.

loans.use: Maintainence and purchase parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy D. est une jeune femme née à bambey le 1 janvier 1981. Aprés les travaux ménagers, elle s'adonne au petit commerce d'habits et de pots de fleurs. Elle sollicite ce pret pour s'approvisionner en marchandise.
texts.en:
Amy D. is a young woman who was born in Bambey on January 1, 1981. After she has done her housework, she sells clothing and pots of flowers. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy more merchandise.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of clothing and pots of flowers

loans.name: Ablonazar

texts.en: K. Ablonazar was born in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 3 children. He is an economist, but livestock provides most of his income. Mr. K. Ablonazar has worked in the livestock business for his whole life, since he started helping his father to take care of their animals. Now he is engaged in livestock purchasing and selling. He has good business skills. Although he has a good group of livestock, he now wants to buy one more pedigree bull. Consequently, he is seeking a business development loan through KIVA in the amount of 2600 STJ (USD $775) over 3 months for that specific purpose.

loans.use: To buy one more pedigree bull

loans.name: Sary

texts.en: Mrs. Sary L. is a villager in Prey Meas village in Takeo Province. She owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice to earn her living. She and her husband, Mr. Vong Hort, are farmers. They do not make much money to support their living conditions. Thus, Mrs. Sary L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding purposes and thus start a new business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living situation with this loan. She is the 41-year-old mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory and the other two children are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding purposes and thus start a new business.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Julián tiene 38 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su padre. Es el heredero de varios terrenos de su padre, quien es propietario de varios terrenos frutales, lo malo es que estos terrenos se han llenado de maleza  y arbustos que no son nada productivos en sus chacras, por ello, quiere contratar personas para que con machete saquen estas yerbas. Por lo menos le llevará una semana la limpieza de sus tierras, y quedarán listas para sembrar. Lo que cultivará serán frutas cítricas, sobre todo carambolas, futro que nunca ha dejado sembrar. Nos dice que es bueno sembrar en épocas diferentes para que constantemente pueda cosechar de una u otra chacra, la dificultad que tiene es que le falta mano de obra, él y su padre no se abastecen. Este es su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que solicita va mandar a limpiar y preparar su chacra, además comprará plantas de cítricos.
texts.en:
Julián is 38 years old, single, and lives with his father. He is the heir of various plots of land from his father, who owns several fruit groves. Unfortunately these plots of land have filled with weeds and bushes that are not productive for his crops, therefore he wants to contract people to take out these invasive plants by machete. It will take at least a week to clean up his land to be ready to plant. He will grow citrus fruits, mainly star fruit, a fruit he has never stopped growing. He tells us that is it is good to plant in different seasons so that he can constantly harvest one or another crop. The difficulty that he has is the lack of laborers, as he and his father can’t do everything. This is his third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money he will hire help to clean and prepare his land and buy citrus plants.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hire help to clean and prepare his land and buy citrus plants.

loans.name: Maria Atanacia

texts.es:
Doña María tiene ya mas de 20 años con su negocio de abarrotes este ha sido su fuente de ingresos. 
Desea que su negocio tenga más variedad de productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para surtir el negocio.
En la colonia donde está establecida la tienda  solo está ella así que tiene demanda de productos y buenas ventas.
texts.en:
Doña María has had her grocery business for more than twenty years, and it has been her source of income. She wants her business to have more variety of products to offer her customers, but she doesn't have the necessary capital to supply her business. In the area where she lives, her store is established as the only one, so she has a demand for her products and good sales.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La Señora de María de los Ángeles A. García tiene la edad de 50 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña María no tiene hijos solo tiene un nieto a su cargo y tiene la edad de 25 años y cursa el 4 año de secundaria, sus propósitos son incrementar su inventario para obtener mas productos que ofrecer a sus clientes sus deseos son de mejorar el nivel de vida para su familia ya que la situación del país esta muy difícil y es así como le demuestra a su nieto que tiene que esforzarse por tener un medio de ingresos que le ayude en un futuro para sus propios hijos los sueños de Doña Maria son de preparar profesionalmente a su nieto ya que es importante para su vida misma y para el de la sociedad ya que es importante en esta situación en la que el país se encuentra obtener un grado de aprendizaje mucho mas alto y lograr cumplir metas para su vida misma.

Su actividad económica es una pulpería en la que ofrece los productos como: golosinas, café, cigarrillos, pan, refrescos naturales entre otras cosas, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 6 años, Doña María inicia este negocio por la necesidad de tener una actividad económica para  el sustento de su familia por lo que al principio inicio con capital propio ya que trabajo en el extranjero y con esto que pudo recaudar decidió venirse a su país de origen y establecer una pulpería con pocos productos como: caramelos, gaseosas, huevo y  jabón y con esto no lograba satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes  por lo que decide realizar un préstamo con Fundación León 2000 iniciando así un nuevo portal de ayuda para ella es por eso que ahora necesita del financiamiento para la inversión de su capital de trabajo en lo que consiste la compra de: gaseosa, granos básicos tarjetas telefónicas y productos de limpieza por lo que retribuye  a Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas que muestran el interés por sacar adelante a la gente que le gusta trabajar.
texts.en:
Mrs. María de los Ángeles A. García is 50 years old and single. She has no children, just one nephew in her care who is 25 years old and in his 4th year of secondary. Her intent is to increase her inventory so that she has more products to offer her customers. She wants to improve the quality of life for her family since the situation in her country is very difficult. This is how she will show her nephew that you have to work hard to earn a living, which will help him in the future with his own children. Maria dreams that her nephew will be prepared professionally since it's important for his own life and to society, since in the difficult situation the country finds itself in, it's important to achieve a high level of learning and accomplish your own life goals. Her main economic activity is running a grocery store where she sells products like cookies, coffee, cigarettes, bread, juice drinks, and more. She runs her business out of her home, and has owned the business for six years. María began her business out of need to have some economic means of supporting her family. She began with her own money from working abroad. With the money that she could save up, she decided to return to her native country and open a grocery store with a few products such as caramels, soda, eggs, and ham. This couldn't satisfy the demand of her customers, so she decided to take out a loan with Fundación León 2000, thus opening a new means of support for herself. She currently needs financing to invest in her work by buying sodas, basic cereals, telephone cards, and cleaning products. She will repay Fundación León and its sister organizations that take interest in helping people who want to work get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Tariq

texts.en:
Tariq S. is 23-years-old, single and lives in district two in Jalalabad. He is uneducated because he has the responsibility to take care of his family. He is a hard working man and has been involved in agriculture for more than seven years. Now he wants to enlarge his business.

He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghanis with a term of 26 months, to enlarge his shop and improve his business. This will bring more success and provide a good monthly income for his family.

Tariq wants to thank lenders around the world and thank KIVA and AFSG for this fantastic process of getting a loan. He would like to say that at his age this is such a good program in Afghanistan as people are faced with lots of difficulty. He would love to see more success in the future.

loans.use: To purchase some necessary things for his land

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
Pich S. is 38 years old and works as a local teacher in the Siem Reap province. She started teaching in 1990 and is able to make $2 every day. Her husband, pictured here, is a moto-taxi driver and makes $3 a day.

This couple has three children: Two are in school and one is a barman.

Pich S. is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a moto-taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthy Chab Village Bank Group

texts.en: The Village Bank, which consists of twenty-eight members, is located in Dei Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal province and they plan to use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Chanthy C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it but she does not have enough money. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to add to her business to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Horm Chamnab, is a worker in a bread shop who gets a little salary to support his family. Mrs. Chanthy C. is 26 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Mrs. Sam Srey Oun, who is a group guarantor, is also shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to add to her business

loans.name: Vanu

texts.en: Vanu L., 25, is married with no children.  She has two years of experience in the elei  business. She sells to the general public three days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 104 Tala.  SPBD loans are Vanu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase paints, brushes, gloves, elei printing board, threads and needles.

loans.name: Manuel Jr.

texts.en:
Manuel A., Jr. is a farmer. He got his name from his father, who is also a farmer. He is 25 years old and has 1 child. He believes that the real treasure is in the soil. Manuel is working very hard to support his family.

He is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 (USD 225) from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides. He will also buy rice seeds for his farm. The loan will really help him increase his yield. It will help him increase his income.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of World Vision Philippines. CEVI gives not just loans but also provides training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and quality rice seeds.

loans.name: Efrena

texts.en:
Efrena R. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. Efrena owns and operates a "sari-sari" or general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Efrena has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In May 2008, Efrena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Efrena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC.

Efrena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees and other educational expenses of her children. 


About GDMPC:
Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) aims to empower people by providing livelihood opportunities through various types of services. Its contribution to community development in upland, lowland and coastal areas is through a professionally managed credit and savings operation, training, and the provision of social services. In addition, GDMPC also actively assists various livelihood projects for small farmers and fisherfolk including access to technologies, procurement of inputs and marketing of products.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
D. Nguyễn Thị (539071100), a 49 year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên, is married and has four school-aged children. To making a living, D. raises cattle for sale. D. has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 3200000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2006, D. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 5000000 VND from TYM Fund that was used to expand the business, D. is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND to purchase breeding livestock. This will be her third loan from TYM Fund, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: César Augusto

texts.es: César Augusto L. N. de 22 años de edad reside en San Pedro Perulapán, junto a sus abuelos paternos. El es un joven muy visionario el cual desea sobresalir y tener una mejor vida, ya que durante cinco años trabajó en la gran ja  de su tío en lo relacionado con la avicultura y ya hace dos años creó su propia granja teniendo a la fecha 300 pollos, también trabaja en un taller de costura cerca de su hogar. César solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda aumentar la cantidad de pollos de 300 a 500, el desea crecer mucho más en su negocio por lo cual se esfuerza mucho y a su corta edad ha demostrado ser un joven muy emprendedor con muchas ganas de superarse.
texts.en:
César Augusto L. N. is a 22-year-old who lives with his paternal grandparents in San Pedro Perulapán. He is a young visionary who hopes to get ahead and have a better life. For five years, he worked in his uncle’s poultry farm, and two years ago, he started his own farm. At this time, he has 300 chickens. He also works in a garment factory near his home. César is seeking a loan with which he can increase his number of chickens from 300 to 500. He hopes to expand his business even more, which is why he exerts himself. At his young age, he has demonstrated to be a very enterprising man with the desire for self-improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more chickens

location.town: San Pedro Perulapán, departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mohamed Traoré est âgé  de 29 ans et vit avec  son enfant et son épouse  chez son père  à Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord.
Après l’école coranique, Mohamed décida d’aller tenter sa chance en dehors du Mali, précisément en république de Côte d’Ivoire à la recherche d’une vie meilleure.
Ses ambutions n’ont pas été réalisées, il décida de retourner à Bougouni auprès de son père pour apprendre le commerce notamment la vente des articles de fête etc. Avec une expérience de 10 ans, Mohamed Traoré maîtrise bien son activité et est très sollicité.
Afin  de  renforcer ses activités, Monsieur Mohamed décida d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier prêt, pour acheter des articles de fête, tissus....
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali), auprès des grossistes et vend  ses articles à une clientèle composée  de toutes les catégories sociales. 
Les fêtes réligieuses et les grandes cérémonies (baptêmes, mariages, circoncisions, anniversaires etc) sont les périodes où les ventes de ses articles sont intenses.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Mohamed Traoré compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000 FCFA.
Son  ambition est dans les années à venir  d’agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Mohamed Traoré, age 29, lives with his child and his wife at his father's in Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali), in the Hérémakono Nord neighborhood. After Koranic school, Mohamed decided to try his luck outside Mali, in the Republic of Côte d'Ivoire, in search of a better life.

His ambitions did not fulfill, and so he decided to come back to his father in Bougouni, to learn the business of selling party items. With 10 years of experience, Mohamed Traoré now masters this business and is in high demand.

In order to bolster his business, Mohamed decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, from which he is seeking his first loan to buy party items, fabrics, ... He gets his supplies from wholesalers in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali), and sells his products to a clientele comprising people of all social categories.

Religous holidays and ceremonies (baptisms, weddings, circumcisions, birthdays, ...) are the periods where the sales are very high. With this loan, Mr. Mohamed Traoré counts on turning a monthly profit of XOF 65'000 (ca US$ 140). He ambitions to expand his store in the coming years.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell party supplies and fabrics

loans.name: 14 De Septiembre Group

texts.es: La asociación comunal “14 de Septiembre”  pertenece al centro Focal Villa Adela, trabajan  junto  a Pro-Mujer hace sietes año. Este grupo en su mayoría son vecinas y amigas, ellas se dedican  a la confección de ropa, por ejemplo algunas confeccionan  polleras y centros, busos deportivos, camisas, tejido de mantas en macramé, otras también venden jugos naturales. Esta asociación desea comprar materia prima ( telas en mayor cantidad) para ampliar sus ventas, de este modo generaran mayores ganancias y por lo tanto mejores ingresos para el bienestar de sus familias.
texts.en:
The community organization "September 14th" belongs to the Focal Villa center, which has worked alongside Pro-Mujer for 7 years. This group is made up mostly of neighbors and friends who work making clothing such as skirts, sports bras, shirts, and woven blankets. Others also sell all-natural juices. This association is looking to buy raw materials (fabrics in greater quantity) in order to expand their sales and in this way generate more profits and better income to provide for the well-being of the members' families.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Suhair

texts.en:
Suhair works very hard in her clothing sales business.She lives in Palestine where she is married and has one child. At the moment she needs to purchase clothing to continue her business so she has turned to Ryada to request a loan. With this amount of money she will be able to get ahead with her business, which really needs this investment.

Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the husband of the female entrepreneur. With some families in Palestine, it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman on the Internet, but the loan is to the female entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Stellamaris

texts.en:
Stellamaris is a 40-year-old business lady who owns a clothing boutique in Nairobi. She has been in this business for the past three years. Stellamaris is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings in order to add to her stock of clothes.

A mother of four, Stellamaris hopes to educate her children, buy her family a home in Nairobi and become a clothes supplier one day. She describes herself as development-conscious and outgoing.

About Faulu Kenya:

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy stock for a clothing boutique.

loans.name: Preoung

texts.en: Preoung P., age 36, is a widower. He lives with his two young children in Battambong Province. To make a living, He is engaged in a business of selling groceries in front his house, typically earning an income US $10 per day. P. has to work hard everyday to ensure a good living for his family and his two children. Therefore, he is seeking to increase his income and improve his business. He is asking for a loan of US $1100 to purchase a new motorbike as a means of transporting the goods he purchases from the markets in the town and to resell in this village. By doing so, he believes that he will be able to raise the standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley A. is now 33 years old, happy and contented with her partner in life Moises A. who is now 36 years old. They have five children May Ann 17 years old, Ana Marie 15 years old, Caren 14 years old, Keyzee 8 years old and Elizabeth 6 years old. As of now they’re all studying, so they spend more money for the school expenses of her children. She and her husband work hard for them to earn enough income for their everyday expenses in the house and expenses of her children in school.

Aside from her sewing different kinds of dress, they have a fishing business that becomes their main source of income. This business runs for 2 years now and they really want to continue it because it gives them more income. It suits their place because their near the sea maybe this is one reason why it give them income. Her husband manages it with her help of course. She will use the loan that she received from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) to buy things for this business like different kinds of fishnet and accessories for it.

Shirley hopes that someday her children will finish their studies because this is the reason why they work hard for them to have a good education. And one hopes of Shirley is to make her business stable for them to alleviate from poverty.

loans.use: Will be used to finance her fishing business

loans.name: Muava

texts.en:
Muava S., a 42-year-old woman living in the town of Salamumu, sells traditional handicrafts to tourists and members of her community. Muava was not affected by the tsunami which hit Samoa on 9/29/09. She is married and has two grown children. Muava has been in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 550 tala a month.

Muava joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Having successfully repaid a previous loan of 1250 tala, which was used to purchase handicrafts to sell, Muava is now requesting a loan of 2000 tala which will be used to purchase additional handicrafts to sell. This will be her third loan from SPBD. Muava plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail A. is single and has four children. She has received a senior-high education. Abigail sells cooked rice and fried plantains at Elmina near Dentedo, which she has been doing since 2000. Abigail uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills. Abigail will use the loan to buy bags of rice and other foodstuff for the preparation of food for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abigail plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and other foodstuff for the preparation of food for sale

loans.name: Ide

texts.en:
Ide P. is currently in the business of selling charcoal from her home and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. Ide is 30 years old and is divorced. She has 4 children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children. About BRAC: BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Taban

texts.en:
Taban A. is currently in the business of selling beans, onions and charcoal, and is requesting a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She is 30 years old and a widow. She has four children and they all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children and build a house for her family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel, de 28 años, es un joven muy tranquilo y sencillo, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro con tal de mejorar su calidad de vida.
La juventud que tiene Manuel es su principal arma para sobresalir en la vida, puesto que su labor diaria no es sólo de un trabajo, sino que desempeña hasta tres a la vez. Su principal ingreso es por la crianza y venta de animales, como llamas, ovejas, gallinas, etc; pero paralelamente ayuda a su hermana con sus tejidos artesanales, ya que sabe que ese también es un ingresos para su familia; y por las noches, toma prestado el motocarro de su cuñado y sale a ganarse unos cuantos soles transportando a las personas, con el único fin, de que la economía de su familia mejore.
Lo que más le gusta a Manuel de su trabajo es cuidar a sus animalitos, ya que les tiene mucho cariño, lleva un año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus animales hasta las principales ferias de la ciudad. 
Para más adelante, espera seguir trabajando duro, ya que lo que más desea es que sus negocios crezcan y le puedan brindar mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Manuel con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no desea meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querido por ser el más joven del grupo. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más forraje (pasto) para sus animales, ya que sabe que tiene que alimentarlos bien para mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Manuel, 28 years old, is a quiet and humble young man; he lives in the house he inherited from his parents and he is willing to work hard to improve his quality of life. Manuel’s youth is his main weapon to survive in life, since his daily work is not just one job but sometimes three jobs at a time. His main income comes from raising and selling animals such as llamas, sheep, chickens, etc.; but in parallel, he helps his sister with handmade fabrics, since he is aware this is an additional income for his family. At night, he borrows his brother-in-law’s moto-taxi and goes out to earn a few “soles” transporting people, with the only objective of improving his family’s finances. What Manuel enjoys most about his work is taking care of his beloved animals; he has been doing this for a year now, and he thinks the most difficult chore is taking the animals to the main fairs of the city. In the future, he expects to continue working hard since his biggest desire is to grow his business and increase his income. This is Manuel’s second loan with MFP; he pays on time to avoid problems for the other members of his community bank, where he is well liked for being the youngest in the group. With the five hundred nuevos soles he is requesting, he will buy feed for his animals, since he knows he must feed them well to improve his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy feed for his animals

loans.name: Ismael's Group

texts.en:
Ismael M. is from the village of Barucboc. He is 53 years old. Ismael is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ismael's Group.

Ismael is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Ismael owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ismael has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 35,000 per cropping for these activities.

In 2009, Ismael joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ismael has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Ismael is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Ismael from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante C. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City. He is 38 years old. Dante is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Dante owns and operates a business, providing motorcycle transport services to local community members. Dante has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $100 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Dante joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation by engaging in business activities. Dante is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in his business. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in his vehicle

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Erlinda P. is 53 years old, married, and has five children. She is from Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. Her husband is a retired salesman and supports their basic daily needs. Erlinda owns a sari-sari (general) store and, at the same time, is a SmartLoad retailer. She has managed her store for almost ten years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP per month.
Erlinda joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 13,000 PHP taken from PMPC. The purpose of that loan was to expand her sari-sari store. As of now, she has a new loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC, which is to be used as additional capital to buy products to sell. This will be her fifth loan from PMPC.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Este joven se llama Teresas de Jesús L., tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera,  tiene dos hijos, las dos son niñas y están en escuela primaria, ella curso hasta el primer año de secundarias, desde muy joven ella comenzó a trabajar en un mercado vendiendo carne de cerdo, el cual lo dejo por que este mercado lo desaparecieron. 

Actualmente el negocio de esta joven es una pequeña pulpería que tiene en su casa de habitación, el negocio lo administra solamente ella. 

Con nuestra institución es el primer crédito que se le esta otorgando.
texts.en:
This young woman is named Teresa de Jesús L.. She is 38 years old and a single mother with two daughters in elementary school. She finished the first year of high school but started working when she was quite young, selling pork in a market. She left that job when the market disappeared. At the moment this young woman runs a small grocery store out of her one-room house. She is receiving her first loan from this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (rice, oil, sugar, eggs, soap, bleach, laundry detergent, tomato sauce, toilet paper, coffee, soft drinks, instant soups, light bulbs, deodorant, batteries, firewood, toothpaste, juices, cookies, candy, produce)

loans.name: Carla Mayela

texts.es:
La Señora Carla Mayela P. P.  es comerciante de este mercado desde hace  11  años es casada tiene tres hijos por los cuales ella se esfuerza grandemente por sacarlos adelante.
Su negocio empezo con un capital de C$5,000.00 que fueron aporte de su esposo con esto ella empezo vendiendo solo bolsos pero se iba a vender a la ciudad de el viejo luego decidio dejar de vender en el viejo y puso su negocio en la acera de el negocio de su esposo. Ella ocupa los financiamientos para comprar mercadería para su negocio y tenerlo surtido comprar bolsos finos, billeteras de hombres fajas, carteras de mano de dama fajas de dama, chinelas de marca de dama y de varón vende de todo un poco.
Sus niños estudian los tres en tiempos   libres le ayudan a vender en el negocio ella se esfuerza por la educación de sus hijos para sacarlos adelante, según doña Carla P. le agradece infinitamente a la institución  por que nunca le han dicho que no siempre le han ayudado a inyectarle a mi negocio y a ir mejorando mi calidad de vida para mis hijos ya que hemos sabido administrar muy bien los créditos.
texts.en:
Carla Mayela P. P. has been a shopkeeper in the market for the past 11 years. She is married and has three children. They are the reason she puts forth such a big effort to get ahead. Her business began with a capital of C$5,000.00, an investment provided by her husband. With this, she started selling just bags in the city of El Viejo, but later, she decided to stop selling there and instead sell on the sidewalk in front of her husband's business. She needs the financing to buy merchandise for her business and have a varied purchase of good quality purses, men's wallets, men's and women's belts, women's handbags, name brand men's and women's sandals, etc. She sells a little bit of everything. All of her children attend school, but in their free time they help her sell her merchandise. She works hard for the education of her children so that they come out ahead. Carla says "I really appreciate the institution because they have never told me no and have always helped foster the progress of my business so I can improve the quality of life for my children, now that we know how to manage the loans well.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags and wallets

loans.name: Portia

texts.en:
Portia P., age 55, is from the village of Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has four grown children. To make a living, Portia is engaged in the agriculture sector, particularly in the planting of rice. Through this activity, she is able to earn a monthly net income amounting to 5,000.00. 

In 2003, Portia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Portia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business . Portia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm supplies. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Portia from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Aquiles Adalberto

texts.es:
Aquiles de 62 años de edad habita junto a su familia en la Comarca San Esteban, esta casado con la Sra. Reyna Guzman con quien procreo 4 hijos, Ariel de 18 años es el mayor y trabaja, Alejandra de 15 años estudia el 3er año de secundaria, Juan de 12 años y Diana de 9 años estudian la primaria. Don Aquiles trabaja para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 28 años como conductor.  

Esta solicitando su 1er credito a esta institucion para mejorar su vivienda repellando y poniendole ceramica a un cuarto, y de esta manera tener mas comodidad.  

El mayor sueño de Aquiles es poder tener una vivienda bonita y digna para su familia, que es por quienes trabaja.
texts.en:
Aquiles is 62 years old and lives with his family in the region of San Esteban. He is married to Sra. Reyna Guzman, with whom he has four children. Ariel is the oldest child. He is 18 years old and working. Alejandra is a 15 year old student who is in her third year of high school. Juan is 12 years old and Diana is 9 years old. Both are in elementary school. Don Aquiles has worked as a driver for the City of Juigalpa for the past 28 years.

He is requesting his first loan from AFODENIC in order to make improvements to his home by plastering the walls and installing a ceramic floor in one of the rooms to make it more comfortable. Aquiles says his greatest wish is to have a beautiful and decent home for his family, which is why he continues to work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plaster the walls & install a ceramic floor in a room of his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital and payment to AgroCapital

loans.name: Dim

texts.en:
Dim T. is 28 years old and resides in Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia, where she makes an income by raising crops on her farm.  She has a partner in her husband who appears in the photo here. He always assists her in growing various crops.  This couple has two kids who attend school.

As the potato-growing season is approaching, Dim T. is requesting a loan amount of $300 from HKL, a Kiva field partner. She will use the loan to grow a better crop of potatoes.

loans.use: To grow a better crop of potatoes.

loans.name: Lilia María

texts.es:
Lilia es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad que vive junto su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola de la provincia de Piura, ubicado en la región del mismo nombre. Se encuentra ubicado a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su vivienda. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de artículos de uso diario. Este negocio le permite hacerse de ingresos permanentes con los cuales apoya a su esposo en el mantenimiento de su familia.

Lilia desea adquirir mas productos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias. Por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.

Lilia es una mujer honrada y bastante trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Sus vecinos y clientes la consideran una mujer amable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Lilia is a 37 year old mother who lives with her husband and three children in the district of Tambogrande. This agricultural district is in the province of Piura, which is located in the region of the same name. The area is more than three hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than five years, Lilia has been selling basic necessities and groceries from a store she operates out of her home. There she offers her customers all types of everyday products. This business allows her to earn a steady income that helps her husband support their family.

Lilia wants to acquire more products to satisfy the demand of her customers, increase her sales, and earn more income. In order to do this, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN to help reach her goal.

Lilia is a honest and hardworking woman. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman so that she can improve the quality of life for her family. Her neighbors and customers consider her to be a kind and trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
Huệ Nguyễn Thị (20203020058) is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Huệ is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đông Thái nhóm 11 (Nhóm 11).


Huệ is married and has 2 adult children.  To make a living, Huệ owns & operates a business venture making & selling food.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community.  Huệ has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


Huệ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.      She is now requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.  This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Huệ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Cao Thị H. (0) is a 28-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business operating a service-based business.


2.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) is a 30-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.


3.  Trương Thị B. (0) is a 47year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business making & selling food.


4.  Tô Thị T. (0) is a 46-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business making & selling food.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Huệ Nguyễn Thị (20203020058) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Huệ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đông Thái nhóm 11 (Nhóm 11).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán thức ăn nhanh & những loại thực phẩm cao cấp khác trong cộng đồng địa pH..  Huệ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Huệ kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND.  Huệ đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  0    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Cao Thị H. (0) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


2.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


3.  Trương Thị B. (0) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


4.  Tô Thị T. (0) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Komi Mokpokpo

texts.en: Mr. Komi A. is 36 years old and married to a merchant in Lomé, Togo. He’s been the proprietor of his own internet café since 2008 and his business is growing. He already has two employees. Komi is now taking his second loan from WAGES of 500,000 CFA to help him expand his business. He will purchase two computers and 5 desks to house to serve his growing number of clients.

loans.use: To purchase two computers and 5 desks

loans.name: Pastef Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité PASTEF est né le jour de l’inauguration du Banc Villageois de SANTHIAB. COKI1. Outre le voisinage, les 14 femmes qui composent le groupe ont des liens de parenté, des relations excellentes et comme dénominateur commun l’amour du travail.

Madame Fary F., à l’extrême droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 6 autres enfants. 

Elle achète des légumes, des condiments pour cuisine (poivre, ail, piment etc) pour revendre au marché. 

Son crédit lui servira à renforcer son niveau d’approvisionnement en marchandises afin de générer plus de bénéfices. 

Son vœu est d’avoir un chiffre d’affaire consistant pour pouvoir aller dans les plus grands marchés hebdomadaires pour trouver davantage des légumes (oignons, choux, carottes etc.
texts.en:
The solidarity group PASTEF was born on inauguration day of the Banc Villageois of SANTHIAB. COKI1. Besides being neighbors, the fourteen women who compose the group have ties of kinship, an excellent relationship, and a love of work as a common denominator. Ms. Fary F. is the group's leader (found at the far right in the photo). She is 53 years old, married, and the mother of six children. She also has six other children to support. Fary buys vegetables and condiments (black pepper, garlic, chili peppers, etc.) to resell at the market. Her loan will be used to bolster her stock of merchandise in order to generate more profit. Fary's wish is to have substantial sales to be able to go to the biggest weekly markets and find more vegetables (onions, cabbage, carrots, etc.)

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Devloping and advancing her business

loans.name: G.s. Triunfadores Group

texts.es: El señor Félix Pedro tiene 62 años de edad, es casado, su esposa labora en una panadería, el tiene 4 hijos los cuales todos son mayores de edad y viven aparte. El señor se dedica a la elaboración de pan, cabe señalarse el señor ya tiene 25 años de dedicarse a esta actividad con una clientela bien establecida en el municipio. Este negocio, en principio fue heredado por su mama, quien en ese tiempo también elaboraba este producto y le enseño como hacerlo. Otro integrante de este grupo es don Pablo José el tiene 46 años de edad, Su esposa es ama de casa y sin embargo, también elabora tortillas para venderla en el municipio, por lo que obtiene un ingreso para la familia. El señor se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollo, tiene tres años de trabajar en este negocio. Es por eso que juntos se han unido para realizar el financiamiento y así comprar materia prima para su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Félix Pedro is a 62-year-old married man whose wife works at a bakery. He has 4 children who are all grown and live on their own. Mr. C. makes bread for a living. It must be pointed out that he has been making bread for the last 25 years, and he has a solid client-base in the municipality. This business was initially inherited by his mother, who used to bake bread at the time and showed him how to do it. Another member of the group is Mr. Pablo José, who is 46 years old. His wife is a homemaker who, nevertheless, makes tortillas and sells them in the municipality, allowing her to earn a living for her family. Mr. Pablo raises and sells chickens for a living. He has been in business for three years. These two men have joined forces so that they can obtain a loan and purchase more raw materials for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 45 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de sus padres y de sus hijos que ya son jóvenes. Recuerda como empezó en la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca, desde entonces ya han pasado 3 años. En la actualidad no solo comercializa su mercadería, si no también capta nuevas vendedoras lo que le permite obtener buenos incentivos y ganancias de la empresa para la que trabaja.  Además esta muy satisfecha pues el trabajo es muy tranquilo y lo puede realizar en la comodidad de su casa, donde ha instalado una vitrina y ahí muestra los productos que tiene en stock, entre cosméticos, perfumes y accesorios trata de colocar toda su mercadería a buen precio. Y como es una dama muy emprendedora para mas adelante tiene planeado comprar otra vitrina para surtirla de mayor  cantidad de productos de belleza, pues con frecuencia sus clientes se acercan en cualquier momento a comprar, ya que necesitan para regalos ocasionales. Es el noveno crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues  no quiere quedar mal con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Luz tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en productos de belleza, pues desea surtir mejor su vitrina y de esta manera ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luz is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her parents and her teenage children. She remembers starting to sell beauty products of a known brand three years ago. Not only does she sell merchandise, but she also recruits new sales representatives since she is offered good incentives and earnings from the company that manufactures her products. Luz is very pleased with her work because it is peaceful and allows her to be comfortable at home, where she has a display cabinet where she can store and exhibit her inventory of cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories that she offers at a good price. Being an enterprising woman, Luz has plans to get ahead even further by purchasing another display cabinet so that she can be stocked with more beauty products since her customers frequently by products at the spur of the moment when they need gifts for special occasions.

This is her ninth loan with MFP. Luz promises to complete her payments on time because she does not want to look bad to everyone who made this loan possible so that she can continue working. She plans to invest the loan she requested in more beauty products so that she can restock her display cabinet and offer greater variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdoulaye G. est un jeune éleveur de 32 ans. Il est marie sans enfant. Après avoir arrêté ses études, il s’est oriente vers l’aviculture depuis 1996. Ainsi les revenus que lui   procure son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge de sa famille. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Bambilor depuis mai 2010.Il n’a pas antérieurement bénéficié de prêt dans l’institution. Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000f qui sera destine a l’achat de 300 poussins en vue de développer son activité.  L’augmentation de ses  revenus  lui permettra   d’assurer la dépense quotidienne et de payer les  factures  électricité.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye G. is a young livestock farmer aged 32. He is married and has no children. After having ended his studies, he turned to poultry farming in 1996. The income from his business allows him to take care of his family. He has been a member of the Bambilor fund since May 2010. He has not benefited from any previous loans with this institution. He is seeking a loan of 150,000 F, which will be used to buy 300 chicks, with the goal of developing his business. The increase in his income will allow him to meet daily expenses and pay for electricity.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and raise chickens

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose C., from the village of Karagsakan, is 60 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Jose owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transport services. Engaged in his business for over 21 years, he earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jose joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid his previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to repair his vehicle for better service, he is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be Jose's the third loan from ASKI, and he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his enterprise.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
