Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Geroncia

texts.en:
Geroncia H. is from the village of Bulwa, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 73 years old. Geroncia is widowed and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Geroncia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap ,toothpaste, canned goods and snacks in the local community. Geroncia has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Geroncia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Geroncia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell and working capital. Geroncia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Geroncia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata J. is 40 years old. She is from the Siaya district and is married to Jacob J.. They have four children who are all above 18 years old and in college.

Consolata has a business selling second hand towels and curtains. She has been doing this business for the past five years and has created a huge clientele. She wants to buy two bales of curtains to add to her stock and has applied for a loan of Kshs 70,000 from KADET LTD. Her monthly income is Kshs 15,000, which is her profit and is basically being used to pay college fees for her children.

Her desire is to be able to open up a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy two bales of second-hand curtains to add to her stock

loans.name: Dam

texts.en:
Dam M., 43, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Seim Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat temple. M. raises pigs to sell, earning an income of about USD 5 per day. Her husband buys cows to resell, earning an income of about USD 5 per day. M. has to spend USD 25 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 10 on other necessary expenses every month.

M. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase cows to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. M.'s husband appears in the photograph because M. is not available.

loans.use: To buy cows to resell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily A. is from the village of Deboloc in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Emily is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Emily owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells daily-use products, such as dried fish, bagoong (fish paste), canned goods, sardines, pancit (noodles), shampoo, soap, & toothpaste in the local community. Emily has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Emily joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emily is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Emily from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marionito

texts.en:
Marionito A. is from the village of Kinangay Sur Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 38 years old. Marionito is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marionito owns and operates a transportation services business. The main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle transport services. Marionito has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marionito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marionito has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Marionito is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP that will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Marionito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Erik Roger

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CHIKON”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Erick Royer; el tiene 36 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; el socio se dedica al negocio de restaurante el socio trabaja todos los días brindando el servicio de almuerzo y cena, a la vez el socio trabaja en un colegio de Urubamba como docente siendo estas dos actividades las que realiza el socio para el sustento de su familia.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos como arroz, azúcar, menestras entre otros mas para su 
negocio. 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Erik Royer is a member of the community bank, Chikon. The bank is located in the Urubamba district of the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

Erik is 36 years old, is married, and has three children. He works every day in a restaurant which offers both lunch and dinner. He also teaches at a school in Urubamba. He does all of this in order to support his family.

He has requested this loan in order to purchase supplies for his business such as rice, sugar, and grains, among other items. He is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: This bank member has requested the loan in order to purchase supplies for his business such as rice, sugar, and grains, among other items.

loans.name: Nyansio

texts.en: Forty-year-old Nyansio would like a loan to pay his school fees. He is a salary earner. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda, in a rented house. He desires to have his children educated and to build a residential house.

loans.use: to pay his school fees

loans.name: Tyas

texts.en:
Mrs. Tyas S. (in the photo with her young son) is 44 years old.  She and her husband, Mr. Mat Ell, live along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have four children – three sons and one daughter.  

Tyas sells snacks from home. Her husband is a fisherman. She is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase a fishing boat for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a boat for her husband for fishing

loans.name: Mariolina Nery

texts.es: La señora Mariolina Nery E. Lévano se dedica a la venta de ropa y a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo. Adicionalmente percibe otro ingreso como obrera en el Fundo Proexi. Vive en casa propia de material noble con sus dos hijos. Requiere del crédito para comprar mercadería de campaña escolar. Presenta experiencia crediticia en Tiendas comerciales como Elektra lo cual está pagando en forma normal, por tal motivo se le otorgará el crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariolina Nery E. Lévano sells clothes and beauty products via catalogue.  She also earns additional income as a field hand at Fundo Proexi.  She lives in her own house, built with substantial materials, with her two children.

She needs the loan to buy merchandise for the coming school term.  She has credit experience with department stores, like Elektra, which she is repaying in a normal manner.   Because of this the loan is granted.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Khlang

texts.en:
Klang H. farms rice on a plot of land he inherited from his parents in Kompong Tom province. He has six children; three are married. Of the other three single children, two are studying in school. His wife works in the farm field with him. 

In addition to their farming work, Klang H. and his wife own a small, wooden-bed business. They order beds and resell them to make a profit. 

Klang H. will use his loan to buy a used motorcycle for picking up his items to sell in the mobile place and to purchase some planks to make wooden beds for selling.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle for picking up his items and some planks to make wooden beds for selling

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret N. lives in the Nalukolongo neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 8 children, one of whom is in school. She also takes care of her in-laws and her late sister’s children.

Margaret has a business of poultry farming. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Margaret sells her products from home, by means of wholesale/retail. Margaret has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of chicken feed. She also generates additional income through selling piped water and renting rooms.

The main business challenge(s) for Margaret include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own 2,000 laying birds and also to build more rental houses.  Margaret lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bags of chicken feed.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 52 years old. She has 6 children who are between the ages 12 to 30 years old. She has a store in which she sells cooking oil, rice, and salt. She has done this business for one year and it has enabled her to develop herself and meet her needs. She is requesting a loan to buy cooking oil, rice and salt to fill her store and make more profits.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, rice, and salt.

loans.name: Andrea's Group

texts.en:
Andrea N. is from the village of Dalig Viejo. She is 52 years old. Andrea is the leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Andrea N.'s Group.

Andrea is married. To make a living, Andrea owns and operates a tricycle transport service. (A tricycle is a motorcycle with an attached passenger cab.) Andrea has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Andrea joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Andrea has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase tires and other accessories. 

Andrea is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her vehicle for better service. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Andrea from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Khoudor

texts.ar: خضر في عمر 54 سنة متزوج وله ولدان يعمل في بيع اللوحات والبراويز له في عمله 37 سنة يحب عمله ويبتكر فيه يريد دائما التطور والتحسن في العمل كان للقرض السابق من المجموعة الاثر الجيد في تحسين الوضع المادي للمحل وتطوير المهنة يتميز بالبضاعة المميزة والاسعار الرخيصة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة للمحل ومساعدة الاخت في دفع مصاريف الزواج وذلك من خلال ما يميزه في ربط العلاقة العائلية ومساعدة الغير فهو يريد دائما ان يطور نفسه وعائلته وكل من حوله يحلم دائما بان يمتلك مكان اكبر حتى يستطيع تطوير العمل
texts.en: Khoudor is 54 years old and married with two children. He works selling paintings and frames. He has 37 years of experience in this field. He likes his work and is innovative in it. He is always looking for ways to develop his business. His last loan from al-Majmoua had a positive impact on the financial aspect of his store similarly as it helped him to progress in his profession. He stands out in his field due to his unique inventory and low prices. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy new inventory for his store, as well as help his sister pay her marriage expenses. He wants to help his sister because he has a strong relationship with his family, as well as because he believes strongly in helping others. He always strives to develop himself, his family and those around him. His dream is to own a bigger store so that he can develop his business even further.

loans.use: buy new inventory for his art store as well as assist his sister in paying expenses for her marriage.

loans.name: Khudoykul

texts.ru: Аланазаров Худойкул проживает в районе Пяндж. Возраст, 57 лет. Женат. Имеет 8 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Худойкул имеет среднее образование. Он занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет большой участок земли, где выращивает овощи, арбуз и сажает фруктовые деревья. В этой области он 20 лет. Целью кредита является закуп минеральных удобрений для посева арбуза.
texts.en: Khudoykul A. lives in Pyandj. He is 57 years old, married, and has eight children. His wife is a housewife. Khudoykul has a secondary education. He is a farmer. At his house he has a large plot of land where he grows vegetables, watermelons, and fruit trees. He has been doing this work for twenty years.   He is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizer for the watermelon crop.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer for his watermelon crop

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a 54-year-old married woman living in the village of Villa Norte Maddela Quirino. Angelita has two children who already have their own family. Angelita’s spouse works as a welder.

She earns about PHP 2,500 per month doing this kind of business. Angelita has operated this welding shop for 25 years. Angelita is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 to purchase materials needed in her welding shop such as metals.

In the future, Angelita hopes to improve her business through taking additional loans from ASKI through the KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for her welding shop

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Fortaleza, tiene 40 años, solicita un préstamo para invertir en su negocio de agroquímicos y veterinaria.  Ella es madre soltera de su hijo de ocho años que esta en el tercer grado.  El primer préstamo que recibió de FINCA Perú lo utilizó para aumentar de capital. También estará usando este crédito para el aumento de capital, y para empezar en la siembra de papa. Julia estudio ingeniería química, y vio la necesidad en el campo de agroquímicos, entonces decidió abrir su propio negocio cuando nació su hijo. Desde que comenzó con FINCA Perú ella pudo trabajar y cuidar a su hijo al mismo tiempo, ya que su negocio estaba en su casa. Ahora que su hijo es más grande va poder poner a alguien a cargo del negocio en casa para poder salir a trabajar.  Lo que más le gusta de FINCA Perú son sus amigas, las reuniones y la distracción que le da de su vida diaria.  También le gusta el hecho de que FINCA Perú la ha ayudado a ahorrar, y que gracias a ese ahorro va a poder comprar su carro.  Las capacitaciones que ofrece FINCA Perú le han enseñado sobre la violencia familiar y como prevenir que le afecte su vida.  El mes de Enero, Febrero y Marzo es época baja para su negocio, y está tratando de buscar una manera de reemplazar su negocio durante esa época.
texts.en:
Julia, 40, is a member of the village bank Fortaleza. She is requesting a loan to invest in her agrochemical and veterinary business. She is a single mother of an 8 year old son who is in the third grade. The first loan that she got from FINCA Peru was used to increase her capital. She will also use this loan to increase her capital and to begin planting potatoes. 

Julia studied chemical engineering and saw a need in the field of agrochemistry, so she decided to open up her own business when her son was born. Since she started working with FINCA Peru she's been able to work and take care of her son at the same time, because her business was based in her home. Now that her son is older she will be able to have someone else take care of the business at home so that she can leave to work. 

What she likes most about FINCA Peru are her friends, the meetings and the distraction from her daily life. She also likes the fact that FINCA Peru has helped her to save, and thanks to those savings she will be able to buy a car. The trainings that they offer have taught her about familial violence and how to keep it from affecting her life. The months of January - March are the slow season for her business and she is trying to find a way to replace her business during that period.

loans.use: to buy agrochemical products.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.es: Nelia de 34 años de edad, casado con Emilio de 39, que fruto de esta relación  tienen 4 hermosos hijos, por los que Nelia trabaja arduamente. Nelia desde muy joven trabajaba en la venta de productos de primera necesidad, actividad que lo realiza en la casa de su madre. Para ella es muy importante este trabajo ya que así se genera  ingresos económicos para el sostén de su familia. Con el tiempo fue ahorrando capital que le sirvió para comprar su propio terreno, logrando construir su propia casa, acondicionando un espacio para su tienda. Por ahora anhela abrir su propia tienda para ello espera abastecerlo de variados productos. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que se compromete hacer puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar con su negocio. Con los 2.000 nuevos soles adquirirá nuevos productos para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Nelia is 34 years old and married to Emilio, age 39. Their relationship resulted in four beautiful children, which is why Nelia works so hard. Ever since she was a young woman, Nelia has worked at a store selling basic necessities. She operates this business from her mother’s house. This business is very mportant to her because it generates income to sustain her family. Over time she saved enough capital to buy her own land, build a house of her own, and renovate a space for her store. Now she wants to open a store in her own space and hopes to stock it with different products.

This will be her second loan with MFP. Nelia promises to be punctual with her loan payments. She hopes to receive everyone’s support so that she can continue her business. This loan of 2000 PEN will be used to acquire new products to stock her store.

loans.use: to acquire merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Begg Thierno Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Bëgg Thierno est créé depuis le 10 décembre 2010 jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois de Sop Borom Darou Mousty;il est composé de onze femmes  qui habitent le même quartier et qui font toutes du petit commerce.


Madame Faty la responsable est âgée de 35 ans,elle est mariée mère d'un enfant; elle mène une activité de petit commerce de parfums et de fruits selon la saison; elle est debout sur la photo à droite est habillée en robe jaune marron et a levé la main gauche.


Elle achéte ses parfums dans une grande ville, les mangues,oranges dans le marché hebdomadaire et revend dans son quartier.


Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter plusieurs variétés de parfums pour satisfaire la clientèle et en même temps se faire beaucoup de revenus.

Elle appuie son mari avec ses bénéfices obtenus pour la nourriture et augmente aussi son épargne.
texts.en:
The Bëgg Thierno microcredit group was formed on the 10th December 2010, the same day that the Sop Borom Darou Mousty community bank was founded. The group is made up of eleven women who all live in the same quarter and are all involved in the same trade. 

Madame Faty is the group leader and is 35 years old, married with one child. She sells perfumes and fruits, depending on the season. In the photo she is standing on the right hand side, wearing a brown and yellow dress with her left hand raised. She buys her perfumes from a large nearby town, and buys mangoes and oranges from her town's weekly market, re-selling them in her quarter. 

This loan will enable her to purchase a greater variety of perfume in order to satisfy her customers' demand, as well as generating more sales. She supports her husband with the profits she generates, in order to buy food and boost their savings.

loans.use: to purchase various perfumes and fruits for sale

loans.name: Gulnara's Group

texts.en:
Gulnara, 54, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of the small village of Bokonbaevo. Gulnara is a mother of two kids who are in middle school. She has been raising and reselling cattle for 15 years now and very often sends cattle to the highlands in summer. The whole summer, a hired shepherd looks after the cattle carefully. Her initial investment was about 20 000 soms. Gulnara asks for a loan that will be used for the payment of a shepherd's services. “Investment in business will hopefully generate more profit that I would like to spend on finishing the construction of my house”, Gulnara says.
 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
	
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to pay for a shepherd's services

loans.name: Ever

texts.es: El señor Ever es empleado en un taller de torneria, cumpliendo labores como tornero. El crédito lo requiere para la cancelación de estudios universitarios ya que el se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Derecho (Leyes). Ever vive en casa de su tía  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani en la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y por la cualidad social del mismo es que solicitamos la ayuda de los financiadores en Kiva.
texts.en: Ever is employed in a metal shop working as a lathe operator.  He needs the loan to pay off his university costs since he’s studying Law.  Ever lives in his aunt’s house which is located in the Tembladerani zone in the city of La Paz.  He’s single and has no children.  This is the first time he’s gotten an IMPRO loan and because of the social nature of it we are requesting help from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay tuition to continue his Law studies.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
This is Cleofe, who is 49. She is a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Renato, her business partner. She is a mother of two children who are already working. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Cleofe operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings, when all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands (dishes) cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 850 Philippine Pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php17, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Cleofe dreams to make her business grow in the coming years and hopes to maintain her good health. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week, and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Gulu region of Uganda.  He is married and has three children. All of his children are currently in school. Julius has a retail shop business, which he has had for three years.         

To help expand his business, Julius has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like salt for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Julius hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Julius hopes to expand his business. Julius is a member of BRAC’s Small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like salt to sell

loans.name: Jenilyn

texts.en:
Jenilyn is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Jenilyn has a food shop that makes & sells dishes like pancit bihon (noodles), adobo (a stew) & fried fish. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingedients needed for making the meals.
Jenilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jenilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingedients needed for making meals

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with six children, all of whom go to school. She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis. She has been in business for 16 years and works six days a week. She also has a motorcycle as her other source of income. 

Florence has requested a loan of 900,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal to sell. Her major challenges include transportation. Her inspiration goal is to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expense includes school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Luciano Javier

texts.es: Luciano de 47 años de edad es casado, habita en una comarca de Nueva Guinea donde se dedica al cuido de su pequeña finca. Solicita refinaciamiento a la institución de AFODENIC, para el establecimiento de pasto mejorado variedad taiwán el cual utilizara para comercializar y para asegurar la alimentación de sus propios animalitos en verano y mantener ganado de calidad, en producción de leche y carne, sus ingreso durante el año son de la producción de la finca, en su crédito anterior cancela en tiempo y forma demostrado mucha responsabilidad con sus compromisos adquiridos.  Su mayor sueño es poder mantener bien cuidado el patrimonio de su familia para que cuando el falte les quede un medio de trabajo.
texts.en: Luciano, 47, is married and lives in Nueva Guinea where he works his small farm.  He’s asking AFODENIC for financing to plant better pasture grass of the Taiwan variety that he’ll sell and also assure the feeding of his own animals in summer to keep good quality cattle in milk and meat production.  His annual income all comes from the farm’s production.  He repaid his previous loan in a timely fashion showing much responsibility with respect to his acquired commitments.  His greatest wish is to be able to care for his family’s assets so that when he’s no longer here they will have a way to earn their livelihood.

loans.use: to plant grass.

loans.name: Narcisa De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Narcisa es socia del banco comunal Corazón de María, vive por la parroquia del Valle (Cuenca), este lugar se encuentra rodeado por montañas las que nos regalan hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Narcisa tiene 31 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 11 y 9 años de edad  que estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como carpintero en su propio taller, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.

La Señora. Narcisa trabaja en la atención de una librería, esta actividad la desempeña hace 2 años y trabaja de lunes a viernes solo medio tiempo. En su casa se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y también a la cría y venta de cuyes.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir para la compra de cuyes.
 
Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Narcisa is a member of the communal bank Corazon de Maria. She lives near the Parish of Del Valle (Cuenca). This area is surrounded by mountains that give us beautiful scenery. The people are dedicated to commerce, livestock farming, and agriculture. Many set out to work in the city in a variety of businesses. They maintain their culture and the traditions of their towns.

Narcisa is 31 years old and she is married. She has conceived 2 children from her marriage, aged 11 and 9. They are both attending primary school in the city. Her husband works as a carpenter in his own shop. They don't have a house of their own so they live in her parents' house. They share the household expenses.

Narcisa works by managing a bookstore. She has had her business for 2 years and she works from Monday to Friday on a part time basis. At home she takes care of the children and she also raises and sells guinea pigs.

She has been with her communal bank for 2 years and she will invest her new loan in the purchase of guinea pigs.

Her goal is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is 32 years old and married. She lives in Tukura, Zamboanga del Sur, with her two children. Elsie owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She has had this business for more than three years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000 doing this type of work. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional products to sell. Elsie has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year. Elsie wishes to gain more income and to expand her business as well as to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni, de 40 años, es una mujer carismática, emprendedora. Vive en compañía de su pareja y de sus tres hijos de 17, 10 y 3 años en su casa propia. El trabajo que realiza Marleni es la elaboración de pan, para lo cual cuenta con un  horno ubicado en la casa de su madre, en un ambiente apropiado para la elaboración de pan. Tiene cinco meses realizando esta actividad, tiempo suficiente para ser conocida dentro de su localidad. Para dicha actividad cuenta con la ayuda de un empleado, que le ayuda en la elaboración de la masa, y de su hija para la venta. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da un ingreso económico, que le permite saciar sus necesidades, y dar una buena educación a sus hijos. Sin embargo, se requiere de mucho esfuerzo para hacer este trabajo, pero eso no la desanima y nos comenta que espera seguir creciendo y construir su propio horno. Este será el tercer crédito con la institución MFP, se siente feliz por formar parte de un grupo responsable. Con el préstamo solicitado de 600 soles, comprará materiales para la elaboración de pan como harina, manteca, levadura y demás al por mayor.
texts.en:
40-year-old Marleni is a charismatic and entrepreneurial woman.  She lives together with her partner and three children, who are 17, 10 and 3, in her own home.  Marleni's business is making bread.  She has an oven located in her mother's house, in an environment which is suitable for making bread.  She has been in this business for five months, enough time for her to become well known in her town.  In her business, she has the help of one employee who helps her make the dough.  Her daughter also helps her make her sales. 

What Marleni likes about her work is that it gives her an income which allows her to meet her needs and provide her children with a good education.  However, it requires a lot of effort to do this work.  This does not discourage her though and she tells us that she hopes to continue growing and to build her own oven.

This will be Marleni's third loan from MFP.  She feels happy to be part of a responsible group.  She will use her loan for 600 soles to buy supplies for making bread such as flour, butter and yeast, wholesale.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter and yeast

loans.name: 070501-Thôn 7-Hoằng Thịnh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Lân is 28 years old. She is married and has one child. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 070501-Thôn 7-Hoằng T.nh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in the Hoằng Hóa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Lân works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. Lân has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Lân faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2010, Lân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lân has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Lân hopes to buy land of her own, to maintain a successful business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell.

loans.name: Rodolfo Antonio

texts.es: Don Rodolfo de 38 años de edad,originario de Esteli,nos comparte su experiencia vivida atravez del prestamo Kiva, pues fue muy positivo el lo utilizo para sembrar frijoles las ganancias por la cosecha obtenida fueron buenas a pesar de las lluvias que pasaron. El esta muy agradecido por el apoyo recibido. Ahora el solicita un segundo credito para sembrar papas, comprar insumos, semillas y pago de mano de obra para sacar una cosecha con muy buena calidad y un producto que sea competitivo en el mercado y le permita darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Rodolfo is 38 years old and originally from Esteli.  He shares his experience with his first Kiva loan.  It was very positive and he used it to plant beans.  He got a good income from the harvest, even though the rains passed.  He is very grateful for the help he received and is asking for a second loan so that he can plant potatoes, buy supplies and seeds, and pay for labor so that he can have a quality harvest and a good product that will be competitive in the market.  This will allow him to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to plant potatoes.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 30, is a married man who owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past one year, he has operated a vegetable stall business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He dreams of establishing a grocery store business in the future. He dreams of accessibility of loans to boost his business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase sacks of vegetables and renovate his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables and renovate his business.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna, 47, is married and has four children. She resides at Dinas Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Johna is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to repair her existing vehicle for better service. Johna has been a member of GDMPC for two years. 

In the future, Johna wants to purchase another transport vehicle to improve her business.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 35-year-old married woman with two children, all of whom are in school.  She has had a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for five years.

Esther is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Manuel Armando

texts.es:
Manuel Armando, tiene 30 años de edad, casado, tiene 4 hijos con edades entre 4 a 17 años de edad, el tuvo sus hijos desde muy joven, vive en Cofradia, Cortes. Su esposa se dedica al comercio.
Manuel, estudio técnico en computación y para ejercer su profesión estableció su propio negocio de un Cibernet hace 6 meses. Anteriormente trabajaba en una maquila. Inicio este negocio con fondos propios, le dedica 12 horas diarias. Actualmente es su primer préstamo y lo va invertir en el negocio en compra de accesorios para reparación y mantenimiento de las computadoras. Su plan es crecer en clientes brindando un buen servicio, para tener más solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Manuel Armando, age 30, is married and has four children between the ages of 4 and 17.  He had his children when he was very young.  He lives in Cofradia, Cortes.  His wife is a businesswoman.

Manuel studied to be a computer technician, and in order to practice his profession he established his own business, a cybernet café, six months ago.  He previously worked in a factory.  He started this business with his own funds.  He works 12 hours a day.

This is his first loan.  He will use it invest in his business by purchasing repair and maintenance accessories for computers.  His plan is to get more customers by providing good service and to be more financially solvent.

loans.use: to buy repair and maintenance accessories for computers in his internet cafe.

loans.name: Mairam

texts.fr:
Mairam est un paysan sénégalais âgé de 30 ans , le vit dans le village de kassack nord, il a commencé à exercer cette activité de culture rizière depuis qu'il est petit car il accompagnait ses parents aux champs, avec ce crédit, il va acheter du semence de riz de la variété sahel 108, de l'engrais, de l'herbicide et du carburant.

Il envisage dans l'avenir de s'investir d'avantage dans cette activité afin de lutter pour une autosuffisance en riz dans son village, il compte aussi diversifier les types de variétés de riz cultivés dans la vallée du fleuve Sénégal.

loans.use: Achat de semence de riz(variété sahel 108), d'engrais, d'herbicide et de carburant

loans.name: Vision Chieni S.h Group

texts.en:
Meet Eustace, a farmer who lives in Kerugoya. He is a member of Vision Chieni Self-help. He hails from the central area of Kenya, where he lives with his wife and three children. He has been farming for the past seven years, and this has been generating income for him. His primary sources of income are milk, eggs and tea. His biggest challenges in farming are lack of access to a market for his farm produce, and very poor roads, especially during the rainy season.

This Kiva loan will benefit Eustace and his fellow group members, enabling them to purchase "d.light" solar lamps. These lamps help to save the money that they would otherwise use to buy kerosene for their lamps. Solar lamps will also save their families the agony of smoke-related ailments, and eye problems caused by poor light. Eustace says that the savings will improve his family’s income, giving them an edge in the current economic hardships.

loans.use: To purchase "d.light" solar lanterns

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: Âgée de 42 ans, Christine a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Christine est mariée à un certain Cyprien. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et trois à leur charge. Christine vit ensemble avec son mari et les enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges du ménage. Pour cette raison, Christine vend des sacs de charbon à son domicile depuis quinze ans ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien des enfants. Christine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. La clientèle de Christine devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Christine sollicite une première fois l’appui financier de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de charbon de bois.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio es un gran hombre que trabaja de sol a sol para que a su familia no le haga falta nada, él cuenta que gracias al préstamo logro realizar la inversión en su negocio de compra y venta de ropa típica, y a sus clientes pudo satisfacer mejor, él es un hombre  con grandes propósitos en la vida por esa razón solicita un nuevo préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de productos  de abarrotería  esto con el fin de prestar un mejor servicio hacia sus clientes.
Su esperanza de vida  es fortalecer su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Compra de productos de abarrotes para su tienda.

loans.name: Yayra

texts.en:
Yayra A. was born in Tsévié in 1964. At the Tsévié marketplace, she sells condiments, canned foods, sugar, salt, oil, and other goods. She is married to a taxi driver and is the mother of three children. Her husband lost the use of his right foot as a result of a traffic accident, so she must look after him. An energetic women though illiterate, Mrs. A. dealt with this situation and is managing as best she can to provide for the needs of the family. As a good manager, she was able to handle and promptly repay two previous loans, $150 and $350 respectively.

Today, she is requesting a loan of $750 to strengthen her business and make it profitable. Then, it will grow and bring in more income, so that she may take care of her family better.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Yayra est née en 1964 à Tsévié. Elle vend au marché de Tsévié les condiments, les boîtes de conserve, du sucre, du sel, de l’huile et autres. Mariée à un chauffeur de taxi, elle est mère de trois (03) enfants. Son mari à la suite d’un accident de circulation a perdu l’usage de son pied droit, ce qui fait qu’il est resté à la charge de Madame. Analphabète mais dynamique, Madame A. Yayra a su gérer cette situation et arrive à subvenir tant que mal aux besoins de la famille. Bonne gestionnaire, elle avait su bien gérer et rembourser promptement les deux précédents crédits respectifs de $150 et $350.

Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $750 pour renforcer et rentabiliser son affaire. Ce qui lui d’accroître ses affaires et d’augmenter ses revenus afin de mieux s’occuper de sa famille.

loans.use: To augment her capital

loans.name: Lucica

texts.en: Lucica J. is a caring and humble grandmother of 63 years old. She spends most of her day looking after her four-year-old granddaughter Madeline while her daughter is at work. When not occupied with Madeline, Lucica is working on her family farm or tending to her 2 pigs and 15 ducks. In the next two months, as the weather becomes warmer, people in Moldova will be starting to plant seeds and Lucica is thinking about growing a variety of vegetables to sell at the local market this year. She plans to produce potatoes, corn, beats, cabbage and more. Lucica would like a loan to purchase some high-quality seeds and to hire someone with a tractor to plow and cultivate her land.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and hire a tractor to plow her land

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Alpha A. was born in 1969 in Anfoin and currently resides in Aklakou Fonkomé with his wife and three children. To deal with the needs of his family, he managed to open a cafeteria, where he offers quality service to his ever-growing customer base. And importantly, with this source of revenue, he is able to feed his family. Famous for the quality and flavor of his coffee, he has achieved all this through personal effort. Living adjacent to the bus station in Aklakou, Mr. A. had been quick to realize that bus drivers need coffee even very late at night. With much effort, he gathered a meager sum and then timidly began his business. Today, after six years of experience, he would like to be able to handle rush hour demands, a challenge he faces daily. To do so, he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy a stove, coffee cups, and other necessities to meet the expectations of his customers. The more his revenues increase, the more his family's living conditions will improve.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer:

Né à Anfoin en 1969, Monsieur A. Alpha réside actuellement à Aklakou Fonkomé avec sa femme et ses trois enfants. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, il parvient à ouvrir un cafétéria où il offre un service de qualité à sa clientèle qui devient de plus en plus importante. C’est d’ailleurs à partir de ce revenu que Monsieur Alpha A. nourrit sa famille. Réputé pour le goût et la qualité de son café, il y est arrivé à partir d’un effort personnel. Domicilié à coté de la gare routière d’Aklakou, Monsieur Alpha a vite compris que les transporteurs ont besoin du café même à des heures tardives. Alors il a réuni difficilement quelques maigres moyens et a commencé timidement. Aujourd’hui, après dix ans d’expérience, il souhaite être totalement à la hauteur de la forte demande qui se présente à lui quotidiennement. Il sollicite pour ce faire un crédit de $1000 pour s’acheter une cuisinière, des tasses et autres nécessaires pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Plus les revenus augmentent plus il améliorera les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying a stove, cups, and other necessities for meeting customer expectations

loans.name: Yevgeniya

texts.en:
Yevgeniya is married with two teenage sons. She lives in the town of Kamenka-Dneprovskaya located in central Ukraine. Yevgeniya runs a business selling practical household items, books and office supplies. Both she and her husband were knowledgeable in the area of office related products so when she started the business it was a good fit for her. She currently works in one of the local markets of Kamenka. Her vending kiosk is very spacious which allows her to easily re-stock her supplies and increase her inventory. It is also in a favorable location which helps attract potential customers. Yevgeniya is a sharp business owner and stays on the lookout for new and updated products that will sell well. 

Yevgeniya has repaid 10 loans from Nadiya Ukraine with no defaults. She is grateful for the financial support which has helped to make her business a success. Yevgeniya has requested a loan of $1000 to purchase a supply of household items to sell in her kiosk. She is hoping that these new items will help her business continue to be successful and will allow her to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Delvin

texts.en: Delvin owns a general store in the town of Magburaka, in Sierra Leone.  Married with four children, he buys his stock on credit.  “Though my stock levels look good, most of it was purchased on credit and this means a very small profit” said Devin.  “I need to have my own capital” he added.  His previous loan helped him purchase some goods in cash and the monthly repayments gave him the opportunity to start building his capital.  For this reason, he wants a loan of $350.

loans.use: Purchase his stock with cash to increase his profits.

loans.name: Isma

texts.en:
Isma has two businesses: a butchery and a boda boda business. In the butchery, he sells beef and goat meat. Goat meat is more expensive and is used in stews and for festive occasions. Few people sell goat meat so he has little competition selling that product.

The boda boda serves two purposes. The boda boda is a motor bike, and it gets its name from boda drivers taking passengers to the border and then another boda driver takes them once they cross the border, hence boda boda. So, Isma is a driver for hire. But he also uses his boda boda to transport his goats from the village to town.

Isma is very business oriented. He plans to build a commercial building on a plot of land he owns. For now he plans to use his loan to continue buying meat and expand his business. He is married, 27 years old, with four children. He has had the butchery for 8 years and just recently got into the boda boda business.

loans.use: To buy meat and expand his business.

loans.name: Len

texts.en: Mrs. Len P., age 28, works with her husband selling fish, earning about $3 each day of profit. They have two children who are students. In order to expand their inventory to meet customer demand, she would like to request a loan of $600 in order to purchase additional fish for her business.

loans.use: To expand her inventory of fish to sell.

loans.name: Kabowa 1(C) Group

texts.en:
Amina (group leader) is 31 years old and married with three children. She runs a small restaurant. She wants to pay school fees for the children with the extra business profits. Prossy wants to buy poultry feed with the loan. Molly intends to purchase more matooke, while Farida wants to purchase more shoes to sell with the new loan.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a fridge and food warmers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in growing rice crop.

loans.name: Kouk

texts.en:
Mr. Kouk K. and his wife, Yun Yot, have been married since 1981. They have no children. The family is about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Kouk has been selling cows for two years. He buys cows from other village to resell in his village and in nearby village for growing rice and for food. Before he started this business, he was a farmer. His wife stays at home.

Mr. Kouk is requesting a loan for the third time in the amount of $500 to buys more cows to resell.

loans.use: For buying cows for resale

loans.name: Djoureatou

texts.fr:
Born around 1972 in PARAKOU in the north of BENIN, Mrs. Djouréatou O. A. is married to Sama O., a second-hand clothes seller, and has 2 children. She has lived for more than a decade in COTONOU, the economic capital of BENIN, where she runs her business selling ready-made food in one of the most populous areas of COTONOU. For a little while now, she has been facing difficulties in obtaining the supplies needed in the preparation of her meals. Thus, she is asking for this loan to respond to the expectations of her clientele, since demand is becoming increasingly higher.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers les années 1972 à PARAKOU dans le nord du BENIN, dame O. A. Djouréatou est mariée à O. Sama revendeur de friperie et mère de 2 enfants. Elle s’est installée depuis plus d’une dizaine d’années à COTONOU dans la capitale économique du BENIN où elle exerce son activité de vente de repas prêt à manger dans l'un des quartiers les plus populaires de COTONOU. Depuis un certain temps, elle éprouve des difficultés dans l’approvisionnement des produits entrant dans la préparation du repas. Pour cela elle sollicite ce crédit pour répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle car la demande devient de plus en plus forte.

loans.use: To buy 2 bags of manioc flour (GARI) and 5 boxes of fish

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna S. and her husband, Mr. Sou EK were married in 1980 and have four sons and two daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home.  Two other sons help them in growing flowers and one daughter is in school. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River a tributary of the nearby Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Vanna has been in the business of growing flowers for many years. She grows jasmine flowers on her farm near her house. Her husband is in the business of renting musical  instruments and small generators to villagers.

Vanna is requesting a loan of US$600 for growing flowers.

loans.use: For growing flowers.

loans.name: Fresia Mercedes

texts.es:
Fresia is 33 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Villa Reconciliación. She is single and has three minor children who are in school. Fresia works in a business as a cashier and has been working for a total of six years.

The loan that they are giving her is for the construction of a wall behind her house in order to have better security. Her plans are to continue to make home improvements, provide an education for her children and to better her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Fresia tiene 33 años de edad, habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación es soltera y tiene tres hijos menores de edad, que están estudiando. Doña Fresia trabaja en una empresa desempeñándose como cajera y tiene seis años de estar laborando y con el préstamo que le otorguen es para la construcción de un muro en la parte trasera de la casa para tener mayor seguridad. Sus planes son seguir mejorando la vivienda brindarle educación a sus hijos y mejorar su nivel de vida.

loans.use: Construction of a wall behind a private home for better security

loans.name: Siempre Amigos Group

texts.es:
We discovered the group 'Siempre Amigos'(Always friends) in Guabira Villa Busch. It is a group that is in its fourth cycle of loans without repayment problems. Thanks to the collaboration of all the 14 members of the group they take responsibility and know that there is security in a group and not being late to their meetings.

There are two people missing in the photo owing to the fact that they still hadn't arrived.

Name of member, Sex, Activity, Years in the field

S. S. ROSA LENY, Female, Sale of groceries, 48

R. F. ZORAIDA, Female, 36

A. C. PATRICIA, Female, Sale of food, 36

A. C. DEONILDA, Female, Storekeeper, 36

Z. R. MARILYN, Female, Manicurist, 36

R. S. SANDRA, Female, Storekeeper, 36

C. C. JULIO ALBERTO, Female, Taxi driver, 36

V. P. AGUSTINA, Female, Tailor, 36

R. M. SHIRLEY, Female, Sale of groceries, 48

P. G. D. V. ZENOBIA, Female, Sale of groceries, 60

C. O. ROSMERY, Female, Storeowner, 12

P. J. JUAN FRANCISCO, Female, Liquor store, 12

D. S. CRISTHIAN LORENZO, Female, Driver, 12

C. A. EDUARDO, Female, Musician, 12

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

El grupo Siempre Amigos es un grupo que se encuentra en Guabira Villa Busch, es un grupo que viene trabajando en el cuarto ciclo sin problemas D. retraso. Gracias a la colaboración D. todas las socias y socios del grupo que son un numero D. 14 personas que se responsabilizan y saben trabajar en grupo conociendo que es la garantía en grupo y no dejando atrasarse en ninguna D. sus reuniones

Faltaron dos personas en la foto debido a que no habían llegado todavía.

Nombre del socio Sexo Actividad Años en el Rubro

S. S. ROSA LENY Femenino VENTA D. ABARROTE 48

R. F. ZORAIDA Femenino 36

A. C. PATRICIA Femenino VENTA D. COMIDA 36

A. C. DEONILDA Femenino COMERCIANTE 36

Z. R. MARILYN Femenino MANICURISTA 36

R. S. SANDRA Femenino COMERCIANTE 36

C. C. JULIO ALBERTO Femenino MOTOTAXISTA 36

V. P. AGUSTINA Femenino SASTRERIA 36

R. M. SHIRLEY Femenino VENTA D. ABARROTES 48

P. G. D. V. ZENOBIA Femenino VENTA D. ABRROTES 60

C. O. ROSMERY Femenino COMERCIO 12

P. J. JUAN FRANCISCO Femenino LICORERIA 12

D. S. CRISTHIAN LORENZO Femenino CHOFER 120

C. A. EDUARDO Femenino MUSICO 12

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine H. sells groceries and phone credit cards. She is married, but her husband's income as a teacher is not sufficient for Josephine and her 5 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa inició el negocio porque se quedo sin empleo y tenia que darles de comer a sus 2 hijos de 5 y 3 años, así como ayudar a su mamá que se encuentra enferma de diabetes y ya no puede caminar debido a que le amputaron ambas piernas. Ella se dedica la venta de colchas y zapatos por catalogo y gracias a esta actividad ha podido salir adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para compra de mercancía y un estante para mostrarla y así incrementar las ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa started the business because she was out of work and had to feed her two children who are five and three years of age, and also help her mother who is sick with diabetes and can't walk due to the fact that they amputated both of her legs. She works selling bedspreads and shoes by catalog and thanks to that has been able to come out ahead. She needs a loan for US$475, which she will repay in six months, to buy merchandise and a shelf to display it on and thereby increase the sales.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mrs. Hem Bora's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people I. Pou Doh Village I. Kanal Province are sharing a village bank loan. 

Mrs. Hem B., the village bank president, is a farmer. She now faces an obstacle because her field is infertile. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Hem B. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to improve her crops.

Her husband, Mr. Nu B., is a tuk-tuk driver who does not earn enough income to support his family. Mrs. Hem B. is 42 years old and the mother of seV. children, three of whom are employed I. a garment factory; other three attend the local school. The youngest one, age 4, is too young to work or study

Mr. Nem Nat did not come to the loan meeting, so his wife, who attended the meeting, appears I. the photograph. Mr. Thon Savuth, who is the group guarantor, is shown I. the picture, too. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eight members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly-payment loans. Members with end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's maI. product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is married with five children and lives in Mbengwi, a town about an hour outside of Bamenda, Cameroon. He plans to invest this loan in rearing pigs, fishing, and a feed store. He has used his past loans to support his pig business and fish farm. He plans to invest most of this loan in the opening of a feed store. He will reinforce his pig pen, purchase more fish species and ponds, and set up a food store with the money from this loan. He plans to contribute 200,000 CFA ($400 USD) of his own savings to ensure the success of this loan.

This will be Peter's fourth loan from GHAPE; he has been a member since 2004. He has found that there is an increasing demand for both fish and pigs; this loan will help him to meet the demands of those in his community. He has found that in his community, there are not many 'serious' pig farmers; this makes his pigs in higher demand than those of other farmers. The introduction of a new fish species will increase demand for fish and encourage others to take up fish farming.

With the profits from this loan, Peter plans to expand his business and increase the living standard of his family. He hopes to advance his children's education by paying for their school fees and other expenses. He also intends to complete his house and install electricity.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount to a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To set up a feed store, create more ponds for an additional fish species, and reinforce a pig pen.

loans.name: Domingo Gonzalo

texts.es:
El Señor Domingo Gonzalo G. I. tiene la edad de 44 años, su estado civil es soltero, tiene 2 hijos que dependen de el su hijo mayor tiene la edad  de 13 años que cursa recientemente el 5 grado de primaria y un varón de 12 años que cursa el 1 grado de primaria, sus propósitos son de poner una venta y en sus sueños esta el acondicionar su vivienda ya que esta le quedaría a sus hijos para que estos no tengan necesidades para el día de mañana y también darle un futuro de estudios.


Su actividad económica es la de destace de cerdo y una pulpería, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 7 años, el da inicio a este negocio por cuenta propia y decide comenzar con 1 cerdo que seria destinado para el destace y mas tarde incrementa el destace con 5 cerdos y así obtuvo la afluencia de clientes, mas tarde realizar una inversión de una pulpería donde vendería unos cuantos productos como: refrescos y golosinas y así obtiene esta venta, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que desea incrementar su negocio en granos básicos y tiene que comprar las diferente productos donde le resulten mas factible.
texts.en:
Domingo Gonzalo G. I. is 44 years old, is single and has two dependent children. His older son is 13 years old and recently started the fifth grade of primary school, and his younger son is 12 years old and in the first grade of primary school. His goals are to have his own shop, and he dreams of making improvements to his home for the sake of his children, ensuring that their needs are met in the future and that they can continue with their studies. He works selling pork and running a small store, and has owned this business for 7 years. He started the business on his own count, starting with one pig to be cut up and sold, and later increased this to 5 pigs, and in this way he built up a customer base. Later he invested in the store, where he sells a variety of products such as soft drinks and snacks. The loan is for working capital in order to increase his stock of basic supplies and purchase different products.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mr. Arng Kim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Arng K. is the elected president of the village bank located in Phum Dabprambei village in Kampong Cham Province. The village bank consists of twenty members. He and his wife, Mrs. Moeurn Da, are laborers. He is 48 years old and the father of five children. Three of their children are laborers, one is enrolled in the local school and the youngest child is less than four years old. 

Even though they work hard, they are unable to earn sufficient income to support their family well. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Arng K. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase a cow to start cattle breeding business. He hopes to increase income and to provide a better life for his family later.

loans.use: To start cattle breeding business.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Masaya la señora Candida Rosa H. se ha destacado por laborar en su negocio de venta de carne teniendo su propio establecimiento en su casa de habitación donde se desempeña con mucho esfuerzo y gran dedicación.

Ella es madre de tres hijos de los cuales dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar y necesitan de todo el apoyo de su madre para salir adelante y lograr coronar una carrera universitaria. 
Como todo negocio en desarrollo, la señora Candida hoy en día necesita la compra de la carne para comercializarla en su establecimiento y es por esta razón que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para que de esta forma al brindársele dicho crédito pueda comprar la carne y comercializarla.
texts.en:
In the city of Masaya, Candida Rosa H. has stood out for working at her business selling meats. She has her own establishment, located in her home, where she carries out her activities with a great deal of effort and dedication. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are still in school and need all her help and support to get ahead and pursue university degrees and careers. As with all businesses in development, Candida currently needs to purchase meats to sell at her establishment. For this reason, she has turned to Ceprodel to benefit from credit in order to bring her products to market.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase meats.

loans.name: 03- Đông Hải Group

texts.vi:
* Sơn Vạn, Đông Hải, Thanh Hóa là một xã ven sông. Dân cư thưa thớt, người dân đời sống rất khó khăn.Nhóm 03,thôn Sơn Vạn, xã Đông Hải bao gồm 7 thành viên, chị Lê Thị Thúy Vân , sinh năm 1984, làm nhóm trưởng.Tuy tuổi còn trẻ nhưng chị rất năng động, chị đã biết đến Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ nữ nghèo Thanh Hóa và vận động chị em vay vốn để tìm cách thay đổi cuộc sống nghèo khó từ lâu đã quen gắn bó với nghề nông nghiệp.Chồng chị là anh N. Hồng Trung sinh năm 1983,anh chị có 1 con gái còn nhỏ.Bằng đồng vốn vay được, anh chị mua lợn , gà giống để chăn nuôi thêm và đi bán hoa quả vào những lúc rảnh rỗi.Các thành viên trong nhóm cùng vay mức vốn 1.626.900 VNĐ(~92USD).
* Chị Lê Thị Tho, sinh năm 1971, chị cũng làm ruộng và mua hoa quả đi bán rong để có thêm thu nhập.
* Chị N. Thị Đông, sinh năm 1973, cũng làm ruộng và bán hoa quả.
* Chị Tô Thị Yến, sinh năm 1977, ngoài làm ruộng chị còn đi bán rau.
* Chị Lê Thị Hoa, sinh năm 1968, ngoài làm ruộng chị chăn nuôi thêm lợn gà.
* Chị Lê Thị Phương, sinh năm 1986, chị chăn nuôi lợn gà và trồng rau.
* Chị Đỗ Thị Tuynh, sinh năm 1952, chị làm ruộng và chăn nuôi lợn gà.
texts.en:
Son Van Commune in Dong Hai, Thanh Hoa is by the side of the river. The population is dispersed, and the people suffered many hardships. Group 03 Son Van Commune, Dong Hai has 7 members. Mrs. Le Thi Thuy Van, born 1984, is group leader. Despite of young age, she is very active. She heard about the Fund and encouraged her neighbors to borrow money to find ways to change their poor lives that have long been linked to agriculture. Her husband is Mr. Nguyen Hong Trung, born 1983, and they have a small daughter. With the money, they will buy pigs and chickens to raise. They also sell fruits in spare time. Each members in the group borrows VND1,626,900 (about USD92).

Ms. Le Thi Tho, born 1971, is a farmer. She buys and resells fruits to earn extra income

Ms. Nguyen Thi Dong, born 1973, is also a farmer and buys and resells fruits

Ms. To Thi Yen, born 1977, sells vegetables in addition to farming

Ms. Le Thi Hoa, born 1968, raises pigs and chickens in addition to farming

Ms. Le Thi Phuong, born 1986, raises chickens and pigs and grows vegetable

Ms. Do Thi Tuynh, born 1952, is a farmer and she raises pigs and chickens.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs and chickens to raise

loans.name: Iloai

texts.en: Iloai J., 27, is married with 2 children.  She has 1 year of experience in the vegetable gardening business. She sells to the general public and villagers, 4 days per week. She has never had a loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 750 Tala (~250 USD).  SPBD loans are Iloai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy things needed to upgrade her vegetable garden like a plant sprayer, a wheelbarrow, knives, a spade and other tools.

loans.use: To buy gardening tools such as; a plantsprayer, a wheelbarrow, knives, chemicals and a spade,

loans.name: Norn

texts.en: Mrs. Norn P. lives in Khlaung Tvea village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land she uses to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a chicken middleman. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it but she does not have enough money. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more chickens to add to her business in order to earn more income to support her family.  Mrs. Norn P. is a 45-year-old widow with three children; one works in a garment factory and the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more chickens

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh D. is a 29-year-old female living in the town of Hung yên. She is married and has four adult-aged children.

To make a living, Hanh owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food products in the local community. Out of it she achieves approximately 2,000,000 VND (approximately 110 U.S. dollars) a month. She has now been engaged in this business for over nine years

In 2000, Hanh joined the TYM Fund to gain access to financial services and to help improve her living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from the TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Hanh is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will once again be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for her grocery store

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin purchases crates of eggs from poultry farms and sells to her customers within her community in Lagos state, Nigeria. She started this business six years ago. She hopes for the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more crates of eggs to sell. Toyin is 47 years old and married with three children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda manages a humble hog raising business. She lives in the remote village of Barangay St. Teresa of Lallo, Cagayan. She is already 47 years old. Married to Manuel, 50 year-old  farmer.  The couple is blessed with one child whom they want to dedicate their sacrifices in maintaining both their farming and hog raising business. Yolanda is requesting to borrow loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP7,000 for her business maintenance and will also able to earn good profit when sold to pig buyers. She hopes to improve her business in order to help her husband uplift their way of living. 


.

loans.use: Buy hog feeds and vaccines

loans.name: Lê Thị

texts.en:
L. Lê Thị (83001114) is a 63-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has 2 adult children. To earn a living, L. owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. L. has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2001, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. L. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 9th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business.

loans.use: invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lider

texts.es:
La señora Líder, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres para el Futuro II”, Distrito Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 55 años, 08 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes y con familia.

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas D. salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio D. Venta D. Juanes, ubicada en una esquina D. la principal calle D. la ciudad, donD. hay bastante movimiento y sus principales clientes son motocarristas y chóferes que transitan por ese lugar, poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo D. actividad. 

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio donD. venD. diariamente  por las mañanas. Tiene varios años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace su meta e tener un lugar estable para venD. comida variada. 
 
Con el préstamo D. S/ 2,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando insumos como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas, pollo en kilos que los compra a diario, yucas y papas en sacos para prepara las empanadas que también venD. a diario.

Lider, se siente tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Líder belongs to the Mujeres para el Futuro II Community Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 55, and she is in a common law marriage. She has eight children who are independent and have their own families. Her characteristic fighting spirit and the desire to get ahead on her own have served her well in starting her own business of selling “juanes” (a dish traditionally eaten in the Peruvian rainforest. It’s maD. from chicken, rice, olives, and eggs and wrapped in a special leaf.) Her business is located on a corner of the main street in the city where there is lots of movement. Her main customers are people in motorcycle carts and drivers who pass that way. Little by little she has become well know among her customers. It is now going very well for her. She currently continues with the same business where she sells every morning. She has been working in the business for several years. She feels very happy with what she does. Her goal is to have a stable place to sell various foods. With the loan for 2,000 PEN she will buy supplies like kilos of rice and sugar, crates of eggs, kilos of chicken purchased daily, yuccas, and sacks of potatoes to prepare the empanadas that she also sells daily. Líder feels peaceful and happy with what she does. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to make her juanes (a typical Peruvian dish)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Selling food products

loans.name: Leyser Alexander

texts.es: Leyser Alexander A. L. tiene 33 años. Es un hombre casado. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es brindar el servicio de cantos religiosos. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Desde muy joven siempre le gusto cantar, por lo que al inicio no pensó que fuera un medio de vida.
