Pero su esposa y sus hijos tenían que alimentarse todos los días. A él le gusta mucho su trabajo pues todos los días practica para no perder su buena habilidad. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de mantenimiento en sus equipos de canto. Su mayor sueño es enseñar a tocar y cantar a otras personas y que sus hijos logren destacar su talento.
texts.en:
Leyser Alexander A. L. is 33 years old, married and has 3 children. His business is to sing religious songs and has been engaged in this business for over 7 years. He liked to sing since he was very young, but at the beginning he thought that he wasn’t going to be able to make a living to provide for his wife and children. He likes his job and practices every day in order to don’t lose his ability.

He is asking for a loan that will be invested in the maintenance of his music equipment. His biggest dream is to teach how to play and sing to other people and that his children succeed and use their talent.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Djiguiya 2 De Wayere Farakala Group

texts.fr:
Les dix   membres du groupe  Djiguiya 2 sont tous des hommes mariés  qui ont en moyenne  37ans, 5 enfants et vivent la plupart dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies à WAYERE un des villages de la commune rurale de FARAKALA, préfecture  de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Les membres du groupe Djiguiya 2 collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs cultures de maïs.
Ils sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution et comptent acheter avec ce prêt, des engrais et des herbicides pour entretenir 10 hectares. 
Leurs productions sont vendues au niveau du village, dans les marchés de FARAKALA  et  de SIKASSO après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes souvent venant de BAMAKO (capitale du Mali) ou du SENEGAL. 
Ils comptent réaliser un bénefice moyen de 55.000FCFA par campagne.
Les producteurs du groupe Djiguiya 2 souhaitent avoir des montants à hauteur de souhait.

loans.use: Achat d’engrais et d’herbicides.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget sells loaves of bread in retail to her customers within her community in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is 50 years old and married with 10 children. Bridget hopes for the loan amount of N80, 000 to purchase more loaves of bread to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila M., 32 years old  is a rice farmerin Veruela Agusan del Sur. All her life was spent in the farm. Her parents are farmers so when she got married, planting rice and harvesting the grains are not a difficult subject for her. 

she would like to ask a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her rice farm to be able to obtain abundant harvest. Receiving this loan is truly worthwhile since she doesn't have monet now to support her business. 

She is a new CEVI client and she started to like the program.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un regroupement de cinq femmes toutes  mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies, avec en moyenne  42 ans, 4 enfants et habitant dans le même village Noumouwèrè, relevant de la  préfecture de Ségou (4ème  Région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et d’appartenance à une même association traditionnelle des femmes forgerons de la contrée. 
Ce groupe de femmes s’est spécialisé dans la vente d’articles artisanaux.
Dans le souci d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles  sont à leur 7ème cycle après avoir correctement remboursé les six précédents prêts.
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 20 colis de calebasses (chaque colis contient 20 à 30 calebasses). Les calebasses achetées sont limées et gravées  de dessins avant d’être mises au marché. En plus de l’artisanat, certaines du groupe  vendent de la pâte d’arachide à domicile et au grand marché de Ségou.  
Elles se ravitaillent en calebasses dans les foires de Tonan, Cinzana, Konodimini et au grand marché de Ségou.  Les produits sont revendus au comptant au bord du goudron à proximité de la grande mosquée et en ambulant à travers la ville de Ségou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
 Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 21.500FCFA qui sera utilisé pour prendre en charge les condiments, les frais de santé et d’habillements des enfants. 
Elles ont pour ambition l’installation d’un moulin dans le village afin qu’elles aient plus de temps pour leurs activités génératrices de revenu et l’achat d’une charrette et un âne pour leur transport dans les foires.

loans.use: Achat de calebasses.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina E. sells fish at the local market and is requesting a loan to purchase onions and tomatoes to sell.  Regina is 29 years old and is married; her husband is a teacher. Regina has two school-aged children.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to pay the school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase onions and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Aybeniz

texts.en:
Aybeniz A. is a very hardworking and independent woman. She has three children, two of whom are in elementary school and high school, and still require her support. In search of a way to support her household, she started selling groceries 8 years ago. A true entrepreneur, she studies the market to determine client needs and preferences. Industrious and enterprising, Aybeniz is focused on expanding her business. 

Aybeniz is requesting a loan of 1606 AZN that she will use to purchase food, so she can offer a wider selection to her customers and increase her income. With the increased sales and profits, Aybeniz hopes to expand her grocery and improve the living standards of her family. The well being of Aybeniz’s family and her business are in your hands. Aybeniz and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Zamira's Group

texts.ru:
Тойгонбаева Замира – лидер данной группы. Замире сорок шесть лет. Она в разводе. Замира её дети живут в г. Кант. Всего их у неё пятеро. Старшему сыну двадцать шесть. Он работает строителем. Ещё одному сыну двадцать пять. Он зарабатывает себе на жизнь работая грузчиком. Двадцати – двух летняя дочка работает торговым агентом в агентстве недвижимости. Следующему сыну шестнадцать лет. Он работает в винном цехе «Кантвино». Самой младшей дочери всего восемь лет. Она учится в третьем классе.  Замира работает в кожном диспансере. Но помимо этого у неё имеется ещё кое-какая живность, которая осталась ей от мужа. Муж Замиры при разводе проявил великодушие и не стал оспаривать ничего из всего нажитого хозяйства. Более того, скот, который у них имелся, также принадлежал ему, но он и его тоже оставил Замире и детям. Замира обратилась за кредитом с целью купить дойную корову на увеличение поголовья скота. А также на оставшуюся часть кредита купить стройматериалы и достроить дом. Замира вместе с детьми строит большой дом из десяти комнат. 

У Замиры пять партнёров по группе:

Турапову Айбеку сорок пять лет. Жена Айбека - швея. Сам Айбек – строитель в «Кантвино». У Айбека пятеро детей. Чтобы прокормить семью Айбек, также держит скот. Жена и дети помогают. Айбек нуждается в кредите, чтобы купить корову. 

Разакуловой Жийдегул тридцать лет. Муж Жийдегул – строитель. Жийдегул продаёт картошку и другие виды овощей на дому. У Жийдегул четверо детей. Все ходят в школу. Старшему сын помогает Жийдегул торговать. Жийдегул нужен кредит, чтобы купить тёлку.

Кадыр кызы Айгул тридцать один год. У неё двое детей. Муж Айгул – строитель. Айгул работает продавцом – консультантом. Айгул обратилась за кредитом с целью купить стельную тёлку. Айгуль хочет увеличить живность и за счёт неё покрывать расходы семьи.

Жумабек кызы Аиде тридцать четыре. Аида – мать четверых детей. Муж Аиды работает механизатором на предприятии «Кыргыз Алтын». Аида растит детей, но также продаёт молоко, сметану и кислое молоко. Аиде нужен кредит, чтобы купить корову. 

Асановой Тамаре пятьдесят лет. Она разведена. Тамара разводит скот и сдаёт молоко. У Тамары трое детей. Дети уже работают и помогают матери ухаживать за скотом. Тамаре нужен кредит. Она хочет приобрести гравий, песок для стройки дома, пока цены не поднялись.

  --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Zamira T. is the leader of this group. Zamira is forty-six. She is divorced. Zamira and her children live in the city of Kant. She has five children. The eldest is twenty-six. He is a construction worker. Another son is twenty-five. He earns his living as a loader. Zamira's twenty-two year old daughter works as a sales agent in a real-estate agency. The next son is sixteen. He works at the "Kantvino" winery. The youngest daughter is only eight years old. She is in third grade. Zamira works at a dermatology dispensary, but she also has some livestock that her was left over from her husband. Zamira's husband was generous and did not dispute any of their household. Moreover, the livestock they had also belonged to him, but he left it to Zamira and the children. Zamira is asking for the loan in order to buy a milking cow and increase the number of her livestock. With the remainder of the credit she plans to buy building materials and finish building the house. Zamira and her children are building a big ten-room house.

Zamira has five partners in the group:

Aibek T. is forty-five. His wife is a seamstress. Aibek himself is a construction worker at the "Kantvino" winery. Aibek has five children. In order to feed his family Aibek keeps some livestock. His wife and children help him. Aibek needs a loan to buy a cow.

Jiidegul R. is thirty years old. Jiidegul's husband is a construction worker. Jiidegul sells potatoes and other vegetables from home. Jiidegul has four children, they all go to school. The oldest son helps her Jiidegul to sell potatoes. Jiidegul needs the loan to buy a heifer.

Aigul K. is thirty-one. She has two children. Aigul's husband is a construction worker. Aigul works as a sales consultant. Aigul is asking for the loan to buy a cow with a calf. Aigul wants to increase her livestock to give the family an extra income to cover their expenses.

Aida J. is thirty-four. Aida is the mother of four. Aida's husband works as a machine operator at the "Kyrgyz Altyn" factory. Aida raises the children but also sells milk, sour cream, and sour milk. Aida needs the loan to buy a cow.

Tamara A. is fifty. She is divorced. Tamara breeds livestock and sells milk. She has three children. The children are already working and helping their mother to take care of the livestock. Tamara needs a loan. She wants to purchase gravel and sand to build a house before the prices go up.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow and pay for building materials for home repairs

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz E. lives in the village of Prk Tan-ao, Brgy Lopez Jaena, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She is 60 years old. She works and earns for the day-to-day living costs of her family. She is married and blessed with four adult children aged from 30 to 37 years old. Luz wants to secure her future when she is older and still be able to help her grandchildren finish their studies.

Years ago, Luz wanted to earn extra money to help her husband and to send the children to school. Because she lived in a hacienda, a sugarcane plantation, she thought that a general store would be a very convenient business to put up in their area - different items sold at an affordable price and the fastest turnover of capital and income. She invested in a small store to reach her goal of helping her husband. The income from her business was allocated for education, family expenses and additional capital. Business ran smoothly and she was able to expand it. In 1995 she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to expand her business and to buy additional products to sell. With more capital, her loans had a big impact on her business because she was able to earn more compared to her previous earnings. Her general store supplies the needs of the hacienda employees which is payable at the end of each week. She earns a minimum of Php 4,000 a month. She saves most of her income for her future and for her grandchildren.

Luz's previous loan of Php 19,000 was used as additional capital for her general store. The said amount was paid every week and fully paid within her loan term without any delay. Her 18th cycle loan of the same amount of Php 19,000 will be used as additional working capital. Income from it will be used for her grandchildren's education.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project <i>Dungganon</i> (a Hiligaynon word that means <u>Honorable</u>). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them <i>Dungganon</i> - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo, de 38 años, es un padre muy amoroso y responsable, vive en la casa de uno de sus familiares junto a su hijo Brandon de 5 años, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.
Su taller de mecánica es uno de los más concurridos de la ciudad de Juliaca, ya que es un mecánico muy hábil y cumplido. Desde muy joven trabajó en otros talleres y ahora con mucha experiencia acumulada se ha animado a abrir su propio taller, el cual le está dando los ingresos que necesitaba para pagar los estudios de su único hijo.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es arreglar los carros y dejarlos como nuevos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es conseguir los repuestos que utiliza en sus reparaciones. 
Para más adelante, anhela juntar el dinero necesario para abrir un taller muy grande, donde pueda brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Hugo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro préstamo, en su banco comunal es un socio muy cumplido y activo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nueva maquinaria para utilizar en su taller y así hacer más rápido su trabajo.
texts.en:
Hugo, who is 38 years old, is a loving and responsible father. He lives in a relative's house with his five-year-old son Brandon, who is the inspiration for all of his hard work. His repair shop is one of the busiest in the city of Juliaca because he is a very skilled and experienced mechanic. From a young age he worked in other shops, and now with all of the experienced he gained he has taken the step of opening his own shop, which has provided him with the income necessary to pay for his only child's education. What Hugo likes most about his job is fixing cars and restoring them to like-new condition. He has 10 years' experience with this and his greatest challenge is obtaining the parts he uses for the repairs. In the future, he dreams of saving enough money to open a larger shop where he can offer better service to his clients. This Hugo's fourth loan with MFP. He is aware that he must pay all of the installments on time in order to receive another loan, and he is an active and experienced member of his communal bank. With the three thousand nuevos soles that he is requesting he will purchase new equipment to use in his shop, which will enable him to work faster.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of machinery

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma E. is from the village of Holy Friday. She is 51 years old, is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Norma owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Norma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Norma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand the products offered. This loan will be the ninth loan she has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand the products offered

loans.name: Mrs. Deth Hak Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people who are all living in Kbal Kaoh village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Deth H. is the village bank president who was selected by the members. They will each use the loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Deth H. is 38 years old and she is a grocer. Since her business is going well she wants expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products to re-sell. Her husband, Mr. Yuthy Voan You, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field to cultivate. Mrs. Deth H. is the mother of three children who all are students in the local school. 

All the members are shown in the photo, but some of their faces are blocked.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to re-sell.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia P.'s main source of income comes from making and selling food and drinks in her community. She is 38 years old, married and has three school-aged children. They are from the town of Naguilian. Amelia has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Amelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Amelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Amelia is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her fourth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Fatima R. is from the village of Bolinao. She is 29 years old. Fatima is the group leader of a 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Fatima R.'s Group'.

Fatima is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Fatima owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Fatima has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP whenever she sells one of her raised animals.

In 2008, Fatima joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fatima has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Fatima is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Fatima from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly made up of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Andriy

texts.en:
Andriy is married, has four children and lives with his family in the town of Kherson. For the last seven years, he has made a living working with sheet metal in his small workshop, which is equipped with advanced machinery. All of the tinsmiths who work for him are skilled and experienced. Presently, he has 40,000 Grivnyas invested in his venture, and his income is about 10,000 Grivnyas a month.      

Andriy is seeking a 10,000 Grivnya loan to buy galvanized sheet and stainless steel to use in metal processing. He works hard to keep his business running successfully and provide for his large family. He hopes to keep his business profitable and expanding in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as galvanized sheet steel and stainless steel

loans.name: Jesús Julián

texts.es: Jesús Julián es de 29 años de edad, cuenta con dos hijos varones, es maestro de educación primaria, en ASDIR es el primer crédito que solicita, sus referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable, el crédito lo invierte en la compra de una computadora que le es de mucha utilidad para desarrollar sus mejor su labor como maestro.
texts.en:
Jesús Julián is 29 years old. He has two sons and is an elementary school teacher. This is the first loan he's applied for with ASDIR. His personal references say he is a responsible person. He is using the loan to buy a computer, which will be very useful to him in his work as a teacher.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 23-year-old man who is married to a farmer. He has sold mobile phone accessories for three years and has one employee. He also helps his wife with the farming. He joined a group called Woni Asro  so as to access loans. With this group, he saves his money weekly. He has requested a loan of Kes.20,000 to buy cell phone batteries, cables and cell phone airtime cards. He hopes to start importing his stock in the future.

loans.use: To buy cell phone batteries, cables and cell phone air-time cards

loans.name: Margarita Sinaí

texts.es:
Margarita Sinaí C. M., tiene la edad de 47años, es viuda, y vive  con sus tres hijos de 15, 14 y 13 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de inventario para su negocio. Desea tener un inventario más amplio y variado de productos para ofrecer en local. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Tiene varios años de haber empezado con este negocio, y cuenta con muy buenos clientes, por eso ve la necesidad de ofrecer mayor variedad de productos en el negocio, además de aportar mayores ingresos para la economía de su hogar. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy agradecida con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como comerciante.
About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Margarita Sinaí C. M. is 47 years old. She is a widow and lives with her 3 children, 15, 14, and 13. Margarita is seeking a loan to purchase inventory for her cosmetics business as she wants to have a larger range of inventory and greater variety of products to offer in her area. Margarita has had the business for several years, and has very good customers, to whom she wants to offer a greater variety of products. She also wants better profits to help her household finances. This is the first time Margarita has applied for a loan from FUDECOSUR and she is very thankful for the facilities that they have always provided. In the future Margarita wants to give her family a better quality of life and better economic stability, and continue to grow as a person and businesswoman. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Olga Olalla

texts.es:
Olga de 42 años, vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, esta separada de su esposo pero ella tiene dos hijos de 19 y 6 años, Olga hace 13 años tiene una tienda, empezó con un estudio del mercado en todo su sector para invertir en un negocio, adecuo su casa y compro víveres para una tienda ya que era la mejor opción.  

En la actualidad ella tiene una tienda con víveres y ha implementado ubicar un papelería pequeña junto a la tienda, trabaja desde las 07h30 hasta las 23h00pm, vende enlatados a $ 0.95, detergente a $ 1.10, cuadernos a $ 1.10. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento y bloques para readecuar su negocio. 

En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa, y ampliar mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Olga is 42-years-old and lives in the suburbs of Guyaquil. She is separated from her husband, but she has two children ages 19 and 6 years. For 13 years she has had a store. She started with a study of the local market to figure out what she should invest in, and decided on opening a store selling basic household goods, which was the best option. Today, she has a store with staple goods, and she’s also put in a little office supply store together with her shop. She works from 7:30 a.m. until 11:00 p.m., selling canned goods at $0.95, detergent at $1.10, and notebooks at $1.10. With the loan, she wants to buy cement and cinder blocks to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement and cinder blocks

loans.name: Mean

texts.en: Mr. Mean M. is 62 years old and lives in Vihear village, Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns 1.30-hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living. Mr. Mean M. decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine to support his farm crop. Besides farming, he also has a store which he rents to someone having a party or wedding ceremony. His wife, Mrs. Ly Uy, stays at home and cooks for the family. This couple has six children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a farmer who supports his father's farming, two are students in the local school and the other two are married. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: to buy a water machine

loans.name: Tatiana Fernanda

texts.es:
La Señora. Tatiana L. es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive en la Ciudadela Uncovia en la Ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la capital de la provincia del Azuay, reconocida por sus escritores y artistas, su bella arquitectura, sus 4 ríos quienes bañan esta hermosa ciudad, las manos hábiles de sus artesanos y su deliciosa gastronomía.

Nuestra socia es muy joven con apenas 20 años, vive en unión libre, tiene una niña de 11 meses de nacida, su esposo se dedica a la profesión de futbolista en las divisiones menores del equipo de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora Tatiana se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, también en sus tiempos libre y fines de semana, se dedica a la venta de ropa, la cual vende recorriendo  la ciudad, actividad que la realiza hace 2 años, el mismo tiempo que se encuentra en la banca comunal,  ha ingresado a este hermoso grupo de mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras gracias a una amiga.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para continuar con su negocio y así poder crecer, su meta es de tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Sra. Tatiana L. is a member of the Communal Bank “Renacer Uncovia” (Uncovia Rebirth). She lives in the neighborhood of Uncovia in the city of Cuenca, the capital of Azuay Province. Cuenca is known for its writers and artists, its beautiful architecture, the four rivers that bathe this beautiful city, the skillful hands of its artisans, and its delicious cuisine.

Tatiana is very young, being only 20 years of age. She is in a common law marriage and has an 11 month old daughter. Her husband is a professional soccer player who plays for the city team in the minor leagues. She does not have her own house, so her family is living in a rental property.

Sra. Tatiana is devoted to her household activities, but she also sells clothing during her free time and on the weekends. She travels throughout the city selling her products and has been in this business for two years. Around the same time, a friend introduced her to the Communal Bank and she is now part of this lovely group of determined and enterprising women.

This new loan will be invested in the purchase of clothing so that she can continue her business and make it grow. Her goal is to have a much larger business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase trousers, shirts, T-shirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry M. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 25 years old. Jerry is married. Jerry owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish at the market. 

Jerry joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to do business. Jerry is requesting a new loan of 6000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to expand the business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand the business

loans.name: Faith In God Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Faith In God. He is 30 years old, married, and has two children between 5 and 7 years old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial constraints.   

For seven years, he has been selling men's footwear such as shoes, sneakers and sandals in Redlight Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

He plans to use his 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more men's footwear to sell, including shoes, sneakers and sandals. He describes himself as an earnest person.

His dream is to improve his business and build a store.

loans.use: To buy more men's footwear to sell

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor Ramírez G. es un señora de  50 años de edad, que vive con su esposo y su hijo en una comunidad de Costa Rica llamada General Viejo de Pérez Zeledón; está comunidad se destaca por estar ubicada en el Valle del General. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería, la agricultura y comercio este último ha crecido en gran manera brindando nuevas oportunidades de trabajo.

Desde niña Flor  se levantaba todos los días a las 4.30 am de la mañana para poder ordeñar las vacas de su familia.  Por lo que la lechería ha sido parte de su vida siempre. Asegura que en su comunidad hay bastante demanda la leche que producen sus vacas. Ahora ella quiere tener su propio negocio y sabe  que con más vacas podría aumentar la producción y así sacar más provecho de sus habilidades. 

Es por eso que Doña Flor  desea obtener un micro crédito de ¢615,000 (seiscientos quince mil  colones) para comprar 3 vacas más  y poder hacer crecer  su negocio.

Doña Flor  es socia  de la Asociación de Productores El General, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su Sexto préstamo y con él espera continuar aumentando la credibilidad y sostenibilidad de su negocio
texts.en:
Flor R. G. is 50 years old. She lives with her husband and their son in a community in Costa Rica named General viejo de Perez Seledon. This community is located in the Valle del General. Her primary business is raising cattle, and selling their harvest. This business has provided them with great work opportunities. Since she was a girl, Flor woke every day at 4:30 in the morning to milk the cows. Milking cows have always been part of her life. She says that in her community the demand for milk is very great. She would like to have her own business and she knows that with more cows she would be able to increase her production, putting her time to greater use. Flor requests a loan in the amount of 615 000 colones to purchase 3 more cows, to expand her business. Flor is a member of the Community Bank named "Association of Produces El General" and it is one of 100 member organisations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her sixth loan and with it she will invest in sustainability plans for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 3 milking cows.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia S. M. es una señora 41 años de edad quien vive en una pequeña comunidad llamada La Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  

Doña Sonia tiene 5 años de darle el servicio de comida a la escuela de la comunidad, su negocio es una pequeña soda (puesto de comidas típicas). Ella asegura que siempre le ha ido muy bien con el negocio, sin embargo en  este  momento  necesita un préstamo de  ¢300 000 (trescientos  mil colones) para la compra de una olla arrocera, y para la compra de materiales para construir un compartimiento  donde ubicar el cilindro de gas. Medida de seguridad que se está viendo obligada a tomar para continuar con su negocio. 

Sonia es socia  de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico.
texts.en:
Sonia S. M. is a 41 year-old woman who lives in a small community called La Trinchera de Pital, located in the province of Alajuela. Its primary economic activities are cattle raising and agriculture, above all cultivation of pineapples. These products are sold mostly in international markets. For five years, Ms. Sonia has provided food services to the school in her community. Her business is a small "soda" (a stand with typical foods). She assures that her business has always done very well, but nevertheless, she now needs a loan of ¢300,000 (three thousand colones) to purchase a rice cooker and materials to build a compartment to keep her gas cylinder (a safety measure that is becoming necessary to stay in business). Sonia is a member of Trinchera de Pital's "Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito" ("Community Venture of Successful Women"), one of EDESA's 100 solidarity groups in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and she hopes that with it, she will be able to continue growing on both a personal and economic level.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a rice cooker and construction materials

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La Señora Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Perlas II”, ubicado en la provincia D. Huancané y departamento D. Puno, tiene 48 años D. edad, D. estado civil  casada y tiene  05 hijo (01 independiente), la señora estudió  hasta 5to D. primaria.

La señora Sabina esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 8 meses como grupo mientras tanto y ahora como Banco Comunal,  nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital para su negocio D.  venta D. artefactos electrodomésticos.

Con este crédito D. S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, podrá hacer crecer más en su negocio D. venta D. artefactos.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener  casas y una tienda propia.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias y las charlas que se dan.
texts.en:
Sabina is a member of the community bank "The Pearls II". It is located in the province of Huancane, Puno. She is 48 years old, she is married, and she has 5 children (one is independent). She has a graD. 5 education. Sabina has been a member of the Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) movement for the past 8 months, previously as a group member and now as a member of the community bank. With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles she managed to increase her capital and supplement her hardware store business. With this new loan in the amount of 800 nuevos soles she will be able to make her business grow. Her dreams for the future incluD. having a home and her own store. She most enjoys the gatherings in her community bank and the talks are given at their meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase hardware products.

loans.name: Artesanas Beni Loma Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Carapeguá,  Compañia Beni Loma, distante a 15 km de la oficina de Carapeguá, unas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa, buscando un poco mas de apoyo para fomentar, a travez del crédito, una fuente de  ingresos y así mejorar su calidad de vida.  
 Ellas ya obtuvieron créditos y  gracias a este programa pueden invertir en compras de hilos y trapos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sistemático. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Felicia quien posee un taller de ropas, se encuentra bien ubicada para el negocio y sus clientes estan muy satisfechas con los productos que su taller provee.
con los años que se dedica en el negocio ha adquierido mucha experiencia y esta muy satisfecha con la actividad.
Fabríca prendas de vestir de temporada y sobre pedido, desea incrementar sus ingresos abaratando los costos de insumos mediante la compra al por mayor de hilos, telas, apliques para confección de ropas.
texts.en:
In the Beni Loma neighborhood of the city of Carapegua, 15 miles from the central offices of Carapegua, some low-income women found out about the Comité de Mujeres Emprendoras program, and decided to meet to receive information about this program. They were looking for a little support in the form of loans, to develop a source of income and in this way improve their quality of life. They have already obtained loans, and thanks to this program they are able to invest in the purchase of thread and cloth and thus ensure systematic growth. One of the members is Felicia, who has a clothing workshop. Her business is in a good location, and her customers are very satisfied with the products that are made in her workshop. Over the years that she has dedicated herself to this business she has acquired a lot of experience, and she is very satisfied with this activity. She makes garments according to the season and sells them through orders. She wants to increase her income by decreasing the cost of her supplies by buying at wholesale the thread, fabric and appliques she uses to make clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fabric, thread and appliques used in making clothing

loans.name: Rusayumbe Abamwe Group

texts.en: David is a 47-year-old father of ten children who has been doing crop farming for 32 years. He has been a farmer for most of his life. He dreams of becoming a model farmer and building a permanent house for his family. He wants a loan to pay labor for clearing his farm land for cultivating.

loans.use: Paying labor for clearing his farm land for cultivation

loans.name: Gulnara's Group

texts.en:
Gulnara A. is the leader of the group. She is 46, and married. Her husband makes money by doing construction works. The family has 6 children; the eldest son and the daughter work in Russia, another daughter is married, the second son makes his living by working as a builder, and the youngest daughter is a schoolgirl. The family enlarges their budget by farming. The loan purpose is in purchasing 1 ton of potatoes  and 500 kg of carrots. In the future Gulnara is planning to develop the business, and to redeem the rented land. 

Batma S., 48, is married. She has 5 children. The family raises money by selling potatoes. Batma’s spouse earns additionally by working as a builder. The loan purpose is to increase goods circulation in order to improve business profitability.

Samat A., 22, is married. With his parents, he is engaged in cattle breeding. With money received from the loan he wants to purchase farm animals for breeding.

Ainura A., 27, is married. Her husband currently works in Russia. She has a son. Ainura breeds livestock to make money. The loan purpose is to purchase 4 sheep for breeding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase carrots and potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 49-year-old married woman and has three children of whom one is still attending school. She is from Lebanon. She established a tailoring business out of her home in 1980. She produces different types of clothes, pants, shirts, robes etc. and she distributes them to some locA. traders. 

In addition, she makes clothes to suit the requests of the clients. Today, she is requesting to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase tailoring supplies and textiles and to perform maintenance on her sewing machine. These modifications will help her deliver her services faster. In the future, she is planning to open a small tailoring factory. Her services are valued by customers in some of Lebanon’s suburban towns.

loans.use: purchase tailoring supplies and textiles and perform maintenance on her sewing machine

loans.name: Sum's Group

texts.en:
Five members are forming a group loan. They are located in Chrolong village in Kandal province. This group selected Mr. Sum M., 30 years old, as the group leader. With the loan, the members of this group hope to increase income to improve each of their family’s condition. 

Mr. Sum M. is a farmer who owns a rice field plot and cultivates rice for a living. He would like to ask for a loan to support his farm crop. Aside from farming, Mr. Sum M. is also a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Tep Kunthea, is 29 years old and works as a seamstress in the garment factory. With their occupations they are able to earn some income to support their three children: two are attending the local school and the youngest one is 2 years old.

loans.use: To support his rice crop

loans.name: Batnairamdal

texts.en:
Batnairamdal J. is 39 years old. He lives with his wife and three children in Hovd Province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a yurt or traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His three children attend the local school where his wife is a teacher. 

Batnairamdal operates a painting and advertisement poster service in his town. He has been engaged this business since 1990 and has gained a lot of experience as a painter. He is a very talented craftsman who produces a variety of fine arts and picture frames. In the future, Batnairamdal plans to operate a picture-frame manufacturing business with help of his sibling in Ulaanbaatar. He is a skillful, communicative and clever artist. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase the materials, tools and supplieshe needs for his picture frame business.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials, tools and supplies to manufacture picture frames

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Esperance is 49 years old. She is married with six children between the ages of 13 and 30. She also takes care of two dependents. Esperance has a small retail store selling a wide variety of goods.  She has been in this business for about two years and the hours of her business are from early in the morning until late in the evening.

Esperance will use this loan to purchase more cosmetic goods to sell. Any profits she makes will allow her to continue taking care of her children as well as her two dependents. In addition, she will start to save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic goods like body lotion, toothpaste, and soap

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Pro Desarrollo” cooperative bank, which is located in the Pisac district of the province of Calca.

Her name is Alicia and she is 29 years old. Alicia is single and has one child. She is requesting the loan to invest in her convenience store in Pisac. She will sell a variety of different daily necessities in her convenience store, from milk to potatoes, cookies, chips, soda, and juices.

She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To invest in convenience store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Dilnaz's Group

texts.en:
Dilnaz T. K., 19, is the leader of this group. She is a student. She earns money by working as a cook in a cafeteria. A year ago Dilnaz invested 4000 soms to purchase two livestock animals for breeding. Through livestock breeding, she earns additional 1000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase additional cattle for breeding. In the future Dilnaz wants to graduate from the university.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Fritz Francisco

texts.es:
Fritz tiene 43 años de edad y tiene dos hijos, él nació en la ciudad de Urubamba y actualmente vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú.  Fritz trabaja en la Escuela de Bellas Artes “Diego Quispe Tito” de la ciudad del Cusco como administrador personal y también tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Ya son 10 años que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien,  él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y muchas cosas más. 

Fritz pertenece al banco comunal “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Fritz, 43, has two children.  He was born in the city of Urubamba and currently lives in the city of Cusco, Perú.  Fritz works in the “Diego Quispe Tito” Fine Arts School in Cusco as a Personnel Administrator; he also has a small grocery store.  He has had his store for 10 years now and does very well.

He needs a loan this time around to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles and many other things.

Fritz is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” (Unity, Strength & Friendship) communal bank and he’s grateful for the opportunity provided by this means.  At the same time, he pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles and many other things.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a widowed woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a charcoal and firewood selling business for the past six months, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she also operates a food stall business which contributes another source of income. Mwanaidi faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for sale.

loans.name: Ibolya

texts.en:
Ibolya K. is a single mother who is raising her daughter herself. She works hard to ensure a decent livelihood for her small family. Ibolya started her business 12 years ago, when the used-clothing business was only getting started in Ukraine. Even today, there is still little competition at the market where she sells her inventory. This business is her family's only income.

Ibolya has used business loans before and finds them very helpful. She has been able to expand her business location from one to three sites. Ibolya is requesting a loan of 20,000 UAH to increase the variety of her inventory. She would like to purchase a new assortment of spring clothing and increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase a new assortment of spring clothing

loans.name: Edwelyn

texts.en:
48-year-old Edwelyn is a married woman with 3 children. Her oldest child is 18 years old and the youngest is 14. 

Edwelyn is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for 5 years. Edwelyn earns income from this farming. She works hard to improve her harvest and earnings. She wants to be able to sustain her children's education.

Edwelyn's loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her rice farm

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen A. is from the village of Balila, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 51 years old. Helen is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Helen operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling steel wool, miraculous (insecticidal) chalk, mothballs, kids toys and hair products. Helen has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2011, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional kids toys and kitchen utensils. This will be the first loan taken out by Helen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional kids toys and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia B. is a married woman with three children. She is a farmer working in Bunawan Agusan Del Sur.  Cecelia has been growing rice for 15 years.  She earns PHP 20,000 per month from her farming. 

Cecilia plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies. She hopes to fund her children's education through the income this provides.  In the future, Cecelia hopes to buy a bigger farm to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm materials.

loans.name: Rwashamaire Twetungye Group

texts.en: Diligence has put Polly on the inside lane for continued success in her plastics-sales enterprise, which she has been running for a decade now in Ntungamo. Forty-eight-year-old Polly had to begin with a clean slate after she dispensed with her former business of agro produce sales. This high-spirited mother of four says her relentless and determined way of conducting her business has seen her make significant headway. Polly also ekes out side profits from a rental business. She says this business generates her 200,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) weekly as profit, and she says with this loan she is going to purchase more plastics to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics to resell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 53 years old and married. She has a retail shop where she sells different kinds of products like garlic, vinegar, soft drinks, oils, milk, diapers, shampoo and soap.

Rosalinda has had this business for three years. According to her, she would like to improve her store by buying additional groceries. But due to insufficient funds, she is requesting a loan of PHP 19,000 to buy additional groceries such as soft drinks, oils, sugar, canned goods and baked breads. Rosalinda usually earns PHP 4,200 a month in this business.

In the future, Rosalinda hopes to buy a larger stock of groceries to minimize her transportation expenses going to and from the market. She is praying that she can avail this loan amount.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell such as soft drinks, oils, sugar, canned goods and baked breads

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es:
Anabel de 18 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Se caracteriza por ser una zona de mucha actividad agrícola, ganadera, turístico y artesana.

Anabel se dedica  a la crianza de ganado porcino (cerdos) desde hace varios años, su corral donde se encuentran sus ovejas está en la parte posterior de su casa.  A sus animales los engorda con alimentos balanceados  y una  vez que tengan el peso y el tamaño óptimo las ofrece en el mercado de la zona donde vive, con el dinero que va adquirir por sus cerdos podrá atender sus necesidades personales.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales, con los ingresos que obtenga en ambas actividades podrá pagar el crédito otorgado y mejorará su calidad de vida.  Anabel es conocida en la zona por ser una persona trabajadora, responsable y desea más adelante poder realizar estudios superiores y poder ayudar a sus padres económicamente.
texts.en:
Anabel, 18, is single and lives with her parents in a house with electricity only in the district of Tambogrande which belongs to the department of Piura.  It is an area with a lot of agriculture, livestock farming, tourism and craft activity.

Anabel has been in the business of raising pigs for several years.  She gives them balanced feed and once they are fully developed takes them to the market in her area.  With the income she earns from the pig sales she covers her personal expenses.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced animal feed.  With the income from her business she can pay back the loan and improve her lifestyle.  Anabel is known in the area a being a hard-working, responsible person.  In the future she wants to continue her education and help her parents economically.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Ayisha

texts.en:
For the past 11 years, Ayisha has been selling wakye. Wakye (rice and beans cooked together) is served with tomato sauce, black pepper sauce, boiled eggs, macaroni, salad, wele, chicken and fish.  

Ayisha is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a driver. Ayisha uses her income to assist her husband in the education of their children. Ayisha will use this loan to purchase rice and beans and other ingredients to cook food to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, she plans to build a shop.

loans.use: buy ingredients to cook food for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients she needs in her business

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is a 64-year-old married woman who lives in Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed to have five grown children living with her. She engaged in a nipa-making business making palm thatch for construction to earn a living. Hard-working as she is, Josefa has been in the business for 15 years. She earns a total of PHP 1,500 a month from this work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 from GDMPC to purchase materials needed in her nipa-making business. Josefa has been a member of GDMPC for two years. She hopes to gain more income in the future and produce more of materials to distribute in the market.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed in her nipa-making business

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en:
Kadie is 46 years old and married with five children, ages between 15 and 32. She runs a Cement store in Waterloo in the western rural of Freetown. She also has one employee at her store. Four of her children are currently attending school. The child in secondary school is married. 

Kadie has owned this business for 20 years and sells cement at her store. Her business is the main source of income she has. She says that the main challenge to her business is price fluctuation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more cement and building material. Kadie says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to open a cement making business.

loans.use: To purchase more cement and building material.

loans.name: Ally

texts.en:
Ally is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 8 children. 

Ally has a food shop that sells lechon, or roasted pig, per kilograms. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy pigs for lechon, or roasted pig.

Ally  is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Ally hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs for lechon or roasted pig business.

loans.name: Khol

texts.en:
Khol is the head of a big family in Kompong Thom Province, Cambodia. To improve his financial status, he works everyday driving a motorbike in this province. He can earn about $3 per day to give to his wife. His wife isn't lazy; she sells traditional medicines at home also. They have given birth to five children. Three of them are married and live separate houses. To increase his income, his son is working as a construction worker where he earns enough money per month. 

Khol presently lives in an old house, so he would like to request some funds in order to replace his old house. He will use this loan to purchase a wooden house. He hopes that this funding will make his family reach happiness and a comfortable life. He is very thankful to all kinds of lenders that always see his difficulty.

loans.use: to purchase a wooden house.

loans.name: Aizada's Group

texts.en:
Aizada is the leader of this group. She is 32 and married to a construction worker, who went to work in Russia and earns about 15,000 soms per month. Aizada has four children.  The two older children are in school and the other children are preschool age (under seven).  In order to earn money to meet the family needs, Aizada breeds poultry.  She applied for the loan because she needs additional funds for purchasing chickens and turkeys for breeding. In the future she wants to provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and turkeys

loans.name: Spider Group

texts.en:
Roda, who is in her early 30's, is married and has two school aged children.  She has been a tailor, selling bed sheets and fabrics, since 2009.  She works from 8 a.m to 8 p.m daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be her 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy a roll of cotton material for bedsheets and dress making, opened a shop for the tailoring business, paid school fees, and paid for the shop rent.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to buy 6 rolls of cotton materials and sewing items. (Normally a good cotton roll contains about 120 meters.)  Her dream is to one day be able to buy a motor cycle and give it to her husband who will use it for the transport business.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Spider", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy 6 rolls of cotton material and sewing items.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en: Hiba is a 29-year-old, married woman from Gaza who lives with her husband and three children, two of whom are in school. Hiba decided that she would like to open her own salon. She hopes that with this loan she will be able to buy all the beauty products she needs for the salon. She believes that this loan will enable her to start her own business and that this will help her family financially.

loans.use: to buy all the beauty products she needs for her salon

loans.name: Sinak

texts.en:
Sinak, 33 years old, buys and sells recycled items, earning $8 per day. Her two sisters live with her; they work in the factory, each earning $3 per day. Each month, Sinak spends $60 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses.

Sinak would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy recycled items to resell. The loan will help her to have enough money to expand her new career. Sinak wants to have a stock that can keep all of the recycled items to sell.

loans.use: To buy recycled items to resell

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
This is Lorena, 44, a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Arnulfo, a baker, and mother to their four children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lorena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Lorena earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. Aside from the variety store, she also manages their bakery.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. Part of the loan will be used to buy flour, oil and sugar as well. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Lorena. hopes that her business will continue to be successful and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Karla Gabriela

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo). Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Karla, tiene 21 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, la mayor estudian en la escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella junto a su esposo se dedican al comercio, venden artesanías propias de la zona como son las hamacas, las perezosas de madera y mimbre, productos que son muy solicitados en otras ciudades a las que viajan para entregar estos productos,  ellos tres veces al mes se desplazan a Quito, Machala y Guayaquil e inclusive han llevado hasta el vecino país Perú lugar donde venden a muy buen precio estos productos. Ellos entregan en almacenes en estas ciudades,  su esposo lleva más de 10 años con el negocio y ella desde que se comprometió con él lo acompaña.
  
Este crédito es para comprar hamacas, perezosas y otras artesanías que venden. Lleva dos años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy unidas y responsables.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para llevar sus productos y vender con más comodidad.
texts.en:
The members of the María Del Carmen Community Bank meet twice a month in the canton of Montecristi (Portoviejo). This place is famous for straw hats, and the city has a cool climate and many natural tourist attractions in the area.

Here we meet Karla, who is 21 years old, married, and from this relationship they have two children who are 5 and 3 years old. The older child studies at school. Her husband is a businessman.

She and her husband work together selling local handicrafts such as hammocks, and deck chairs made from wood and rattan. These products are in demand in other cities and they travel to deliver the products three times a month to Quito, Machala and Guayaquil and they have even traveled to the neighboring country of Peru where they can sell these products at a good price. They deliver to warehouses in these cities. Her husband has more than 10 years experience in the business and she has been involved since she became engaged to become his partner.

This loan will be used to buy hammocks, deck chairs and other handicrafts they sell. She has been a member of the communal bank for two years and she likes it because the members are united and trustworthy. Her dream is to buy a car in order to make it easier and more comfortable to transport their products.

loans.use: to buy hammocks, deck chairs and other handicrafts

loans.name: Nachmuddin

texts.ru: Начмуддин житель города Куляб. Возраст, 33 года. Женат. У него двое детей. Он имеет средне – специальное образование. По специальности он шафер. Уже пять лет как он работает по специальности. Кроме этой работы он занимается торговлей на рынке. Начмуддин продает детскую одежду. Он берет кредит для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Nachmuddin is a resident of the city of Kulob.  He is 33 years old, married and has two children.  He has a secondary-specialized education.  His profession is a driver.  Nachmuddin has been working in his field for five years.  Besides this work, he is involved in sales at the market.  Nachmuddin sells children's clothing.  He is requesting this loan to increase merchandise selection.

loans.use: to purchase warm children's clothing

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”SAN ANTONIO DE SAN SALVADOR”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de San salvador en la provincia de Pisac y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Evangelina;  La socia tiene 28 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 2 hijos de 6, 3 años de edad; la socia compra y vende animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, la socia también tiene terrenos de cultivo de quiwicha y maíz, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de 100 cuyes, ella actualmente tiene 200 cuyes y los venderá en dos semanas.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Evangelia is a member of the ”SAN ANTONIO DE SAN SALVADOR” communal bank, located in the San Salvador district in the Pisac province and Cusco department.

She’s 28 years old, married, and has two children, ages 6 and 3.  She buys and sells small livestock, such as Guinea pigs, and chickens, and has farmland where she raises herbs and corn.  She will use the money from this loan to buy 100 Guinea pigs; she currently has 200 and she will sell them in two weeks.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy Guinea pigs.

loans.name: Heriberto Ulises

texts.es: Heriberto Ulises de 27 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su  esposa la cual se dedica a las tareas del hogar. Heriberto se dedica a los negocios, posee un ciber el cual es su principal fuente de ingresos. Este negocio es el que le permite mantener a su familia ya que él es el que mantiene la economía del hogar. Es un  hombre muy emprendedor el cual ha sabido manejar el negocio de ciber en el que  también presta otros servicios como de fotocopiadora y principalmente videojuegos. Este negocio es muy rentable y cada día son más las personas que solicitan sus servicios. Gracias a su profesionalismo en el trabajo ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchas personas en la zona,  los cuales cada día lo prefieren más.  Últimamente ha notado que los videojuegos atraen a muchas personas principalmente a jóvenes y niños que les encanta pasar tiempo entretenidos con los diversos juegos que él proporciona. Esto lo ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de una pantalla LCD y  un Play Station 3, con el fin de atraer a más jóvenes y niños que son los que más frecuentan el negocio. De esta forma espera lograr un aumento en sus ingresos que le permitan seguir viviendo en las condiciones adecuadas para él y para  su querida esposa.
texts.en: Heriberto Ulises is 27 years old and lives in his own house with his wife who takes care of the household chores. Heriberto is a businessman and has an internet cafe which is his main source of income. This business allows him to take care of his family as he is the sole breadwinner in the family. He is a very enterprising man who has known how to manage the internet business and combine it with other services such as photocopying and primarily video games. This business is very profitable and every day more people seek out his services. Thanks to his professional attitude to work he has managed to earn the trust of many people in the area, who with each passing day prefer his services more. Lately he has noticed that the video games attract a lot of people mainly young people and children who love spending time being entertained by the different games he offers. This has led him to take the decision of asking INTEGRAL for a loan to invest in the purchase of an LCD screen and a Play Station 3 in order to attract more young people and children who frequent his business most often. In this way he hopes to increase his revenue so that he and his dear wife can continue to live in acceptable living conditions.

loans.use: to buy an LCD screen and a Play Station 3.

loans.name: Naponi

texts.en: Naponi is a 35-year-old married woman with five children, one of whom is in school. She has been selling tea in Kator, South Sudan, for one year. Naponi is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread, sugar, and coffee. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bread, sugar, and coffee to sell.

loans.name: C8033 Twiterinkunga Group

texts.en:
Francais is 51 years old and is married with six children between the ages of 10 and 24 years old. His business is well organized. He sells rice, sugar, soap and salt. He works from 6am until 5pm every day. Francais is team leader of this group called "C8033 Twiterinkunga". He is the first person on the right side of this picture.
