Francais has requested a loan from the Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more rice, sugar, soap and salt to sell. With this profit, he will be able to buy more food for his family and reinvest it in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, sugar, soap and salt to sell.

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza 1 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Flor is one of the members of La Nueva Esperanza 1 & 4 (New Hope 1 & 4). This group is comprised of micro-entrepreneurs dedicated to selling clothing, natural goods, shoes, working as educators, and other professions. Members work in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for its athletes and sugar industry. At present, its economy depends on duty-free industrial zones, the cement industry, and other minor activities like tourism. 

Flor is the mother of two children. Together with her husband, she has been able to provide necessities for her family. She works selling clothing. Four years after receiving her first loan, she is receiving her eleventh loan. Flor has successfully invested and repaid her previous loans.

Flor is planning to use her new loan to purchase new clothes for men, women, and children. The most difficult part of her work is collecting money from people who have bought products on credit. Flor will save her earnings to continue providing necessities for her home and finish building her house. Flor's favorite activity is studying. Her dream is to graduate as a computer engineer while pursuing her business and to be able to pay for her college education.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is an old man of about 42 years living with his wife and five children, four of whom are attending school.  He is a business man with a retail shop in Kiluli, an activity he has done for twenty years and is proud to have reaped a lot from. Alongside the retail shop, Vincent runs a produce business which also supplements his daily income. In addition to that, Vincent is involved in agriculture and through agriculture he has been able to supplement his income and food at home.  With the above mentioned businesses he has been able to take care of his family and children.  

Vincent says he has acquired this loan facility to boost his retail shop and produce business especially to add more stock in his retail shop.  Vincent affirms that his biggest clientele base is at home, and the coffee trade from his business usually deposits money before the actual harvest of coffee is done.  

According to Vincent, his biggest challenge is lack of enough capital and weather changes such as droughts and floods.  He is described as a hardworking man who has been able to achieve everything from his own sweat.

loans.use: buy retail stock items to sell

loans.name: Union De Taxistas Cote Group

texts.es:
Viven en una comunidad tranquila llena de muchas personas trabajadoras responsables, es una comunidad mazahua, los integrantes del grupo están muy orgullosos de vivir en un lugar si lo que les agrada es la presa que tienen ahí es una presa enorme que sirve para el riego de sembradíos de maíz además también para pescar en tiempo de calores, Don Roberto es una de los mejores pescadores de la región.
 Melquiadaes es un hombre trabajador, siempre está dispuesto a emprender nuevas ideas para mejorar las condiciones de su comunidad, tiene tienen 31 años de edad está casado con María de La Luz ya desde hace cuatro años, juntos han formado una familia con dos hijos de los cuales aún no estudian.
Todos los integrantes del grupo son taxistas muy trabajadores, platican que iniciaron el negocio porque otras personas de otras comunidades empezaban a ofrecer el servicio y como veían como que les funcionaba muy bien, por eso mismo ellos también se decidieron iniciar con sus taxis, ahora llevan dos años con el negocio, platican que para comprar sus autos fue con dinero propio ya que les costó mucho porque tuvieron que ahorrar y sacrificar en no comprar artículos para el hogar.
Pero afortunadamente se unieron para poder lograr este proyecto, “Corrimos con mucha suerte porque ahora ya tenemos una base estable donde podamos trabajar sin ningún problema, ahora somos nueve taxistas en esa base” comento Melquiades, ellos trabajan todos los días de domingo a domingo sin ningún problema, sus ganancias son muy buenas realmente les beneficio mucho porque en la comunidad casi no hay transporte y ahora con una base estable las personas pueden viajar más seguido a los destinos que ellos gusten.
Ahora llevan dos ciclos con VFMexico y sus créditos los han invertido en sus taxis dicen que ha sido de gran ayuda porque asi ya no tienen que juntar o sacrificar en otros lados para poder hacer reparaciones en sus autos, con este nuevo crédito Melquiades comprara cuatro llantas.
El sueño de Melquiades es que su hijo pequeño se recupere porque tienen problemas para caminar, José Alfredo echara a funcionar su nuevo taxi que es el auto que parece en el foto.
 Los integrantes del Grupo son Tomas, José Alfredo, Roberto quienes invertirán en su taxi
*La fotografía fue tomada junto al taxi que estrenaran;  Melquiades es quien

loans.use: Comprara cuatro llantas

location.town: Guadalupe Cote, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette M. was born in 1970 in Davié-Tsévié, where she does business selling cooked rice. She is the fourth of nine children. Her parents did not have enough money to send her to school. In the beginning, she served as a domestic in the city of Lomé. There, she learned the art of cooking. After returning to the city of her birth to take care of her sick mother, she got married to a tailor and became the mother of two children. Her husband, given the current socio-economic situation, has no fixed income for covering household expenses. So, most of these expenses rest on Bernadette’s shoulders. A courageous woman despite all her problems, she has been able to promptly repay an initial $450 loan, which demonstrates her good conscience and honesty. She is brimming with confidence and deserves financial support.

Bernadette is requesting a new loan of $950 stocking up on grains to support her sales of rice thus guarding against repeated shortages. This will allow her to increase her income to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame M. Bernadette est née vers 1970 à Davié – Tsévié où elle mène son activité de vente de riz préparé. Quatrième enfant des neuf que compte sa famille, ses parents n’avaient pas assez de moyens pour la scolariser. Elle a d’abord servi comme domestique à Lomé. C’est de là qu’elle tient son art culinaire. Revenue dans sa ville natale pour s’occuper de sa maman malade, elle s’est mariée avec un tailleur et mère de deux (02) enfants. Son mari, compte tenu de sa situation socio économique, n’a pas de revenus fixes pour couvrir les dépenses du foyer. Ainsi, la plupart des charges du ménage reposent-elles sur Bernadette. Très courageuse et malgré tous ses problèmes, elle a su bien gérer et rembourser promptement son premier crédit de $ 450 obtenus, ce qui démontre sa bonne foi et honnêteté. Elle est pleine de confiance et mérite d’être soutenue financièrement

Bernadette sollicite un nouveau crédit de $950 qui va servir à faire d’une part le stockage de céréales et d’autre part à renforcer la vente de riz afin d’éviter des ruptures répétées de stock. Ce qui va lui permettre de d’augmenter ses revenus pour améliorer des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To stock grain and sell rice

loans.name: Junaeni

texts.en: J. is 30 years old and is married with two children, ages 7 and 4 years old. She has been running her business selling household goods such as milk, rice, kerosene, cooking oil, etc. for three years. She opens her shop from 7:30am to 7pm. Since she has joined as a member of MBK, her income has increased.  Her husband, Rusdi, is a fish seller, earning $50 per month. She is requesting a $50 loan to complete her shop. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Small Shop

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria was born on 25 October 1953 in the town of San Juan Comalapa in the Department of Chimaltenango, she’s now 53 years old. She considers herself as a spirited, fighting woman. She’s been a widow for almost 24 years: in the time of the armed conflict she found herself solely responsible for her three children. And from this time she has fought to continue her children’s advancement through the production of artisanal products. She says that for her and her family it has been a great help to receive the support of Friendship Bridge from the first cycle in the in June. In this time she has devoted herself to making only hupiles (traditional embroidered textile blouses) and now that the first cycle has already passed she has managed to begin her business selling dumplings in the market.

Maria’s dream is to one day export her artisanal products and with her new business she hopes one day to have orders not only for dumplings but also other snacks that she will prepare in bulk, so she will be known as a person who can prepare snacks for any activity.

Thanks to Friendship Bridge she has been given the opportunity and the knowledge to allow her to keep dreaming with her business.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Maria nace un 25 de octubre de 1953 en el municipio de san Juan Comalapa del Departamento de Chimaltenango, actualmente tiene 53 años de edad, se considera una mujer luchadora, es una mujer viuda desde casi 24 años, en tiempos del conflicto armado ella quedo bajo su responsabilidad tres hijos. Y desde ese tiempo hasta aquí pues ella lucha por sacar adelante a sus hijos ella se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía, comenta que para ella ha sido de gran ayuda y su familia ya que en el primer ciclo en el mes de junio, ella empezó con el apoyo de Puente de Amistad y ella en ese tiempo se dedicaba solamente a la elaboración de güipiles ahora ya transcurrido el primer ciclo ella logro empezar con su negocio de venta de chuchitos en todo el Mercado.

Doña Maria, sus grandes sueños quiere algún día exportar sus productos de artesanía y con su nuevo negocio piensa algún día tener pedidos no solamente de chuchitos sino también de mas refacciones y que ella prepara en cantidad y que sea reconocida como una persona que prepara refacciones para cualquier actividad.

Agradece a Puente de Amistad la oportunidad que se le ha dado y los conocimientos que ha podido adquirir para soñar con su negocio.

loans.use: Selling typical artisanal products

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en:
Moussa O. is a dynamic and ambitious 26-year-old man. He lives in Port-Bouët, a township in the southern area of Abidjan. Moussa opened a fashionware store in Port-Bouët open market 5 years ago when his parents asked him to emigrate to Europe. Moussa, who is a self-confident man, decided to built his own micro business in Cote d'Ivoire iinstead of leaving for an uncertain adventure in Europe.

He has performed very well and has developed his business. Moussa joined the AE&I microcredit program when he heard about our activities from his sister in 2005. He has always repaid his loans in good manner.

loans.use: Moussa Osseni will use the loan to purchase a stock of fashion clothes

loans.name: Julia Margarita

texts.es:
Julia works every day to provide for her young daughter and her aged mother. For her last 12 years she has had to provide for them alone, because her husband, from whom she is separated, has not lived up to his obligations. Julia has been endured periods of real poverty and strived in various ways to survive. She sold typical food on the street and worked seasonally in the fields and done other work until she was able to save enough to buy a cow six years ago. She is happier now that she has a certain level of security, enough to meet the basic needs of her family. She has a cow which she cares for and it has now given birth to a calf. She also keeps smaller animals which her family can occasionally draw on for food. Julia has learned enough about livestock that she has taken to buying and selling calves to support the household. Now that things are more stable, she is able to dream of seeing her daughter attend the university. She devotes all her energy towards seeing this dream come to fruition. She is asking for a loan of $425 to buy calves to raise and resell. With your help, Julia's dreams can become a reality.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Doña Julia es una mujer valiente que cada día se esfuerza por incrementar la calidad de vida de su familia, vive actualmente con su pequeña hija y su anciana madre, durante más de doce años ella tuvo que velar sola por el bienestar de estas dos personas debido a que cuando en común acuerdo y luego de haber dialogado con su esposo toman la decisión de separarse, él evadió e ignoró sus responsabilidades. Durante esta etapa existieron momentos de carencia económica que Doña Julia superó realizando una serie de actividades; como la venta de comidas típicas de su ciudad, trabajos eventuales en el campo y demás; hasta que pudo capitalizar sus ahorros y comprar una vaca hace seis años. Ahora está muy contenta porque ha podido lograr cierta estabilidad económica que le permite satisfacer las necesidades más urgentes de su hogar; tiene una vaca que gracias a los cuidados y al inmenso cariño que le otorga ahora tiene su becerrito; además cuenta también con otros animales más pequeños para su consumo ocasional. Gracias al conocimiento que ha ido adquiriendo compra y vende los becerros de otras vacas y de esa manera procura bienestar a su hogar, estas actividades la han llevado a concebir un gran anhelo y es el de observar y poder compartir con su pequeña hija su etapa universitaria.Doña Julia ha centrado todos y cada uno de sus esfuerzos en este deseo y sabe que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación podrá hacerlo realidad por ello solicita un préstamo de 425 dólares para invertirlos en la compra de más becerritos que cuidará con suma diligencia para luego poder venderlos. Con tu colaboración ella podrá cumplir en poco tiempo su anhelo.

loans.use: To buy calves.

loans.name: Ahmed Abdulah

texts.pt:
Abdallah Ahmede Razaque was born in Bangladesh in the city of Sylhet 37 years ago on the 9th of August 1970. He supports three people and still lives in the home of his wife's parents. He studied in Bangladesh and has a degree in economics. He was raised among his family and is the second child. He had a good childhood since his father was a doctor and made a reasonably good living. He worked for various companies as an economist, but when his country was invaded and at war he became a refugee in Mozambique in 2000. When he arrived to Mozambique life was difficult due to the cultural differences and because he had to leave his family behind. He became friends with others who had come from Asia and through them was able to use the savings brought from his home country to establish as small general store and to marry a young woman from Mozambique. Among his customers at the store he became friends with a general of the FADM who told him about HLUVUKU. He decided to apply for a loan to increase the stock of merchandise in his store. He successfully repaid his first loan. Now he wants to take out an additional loan to expand his business. He recently invested in another store and does not have sufficient capital to puchase enough merchandise to stock the store, especially with the increased demand of the holiday season. Through this business he has gained a lot of good experience and has a vision for the future of his business. He currently has 8 employees, with an average of 4 children each. With the earnings from the store he pays his employees' salaries, covers his taxes, reinvests in additional merchandise for the store, and has just enough to cover his daily expenses. With a loan for 160,000MT he intends to purchase additional basic household goods to stock his stores. His business has no problem to do this because he owns his own transportation and when he cannot travel to purchase goods for the store he can send one of his employees. His wife also contributes to the success of their business. His vision for the future is to expand the business to import/export products to the north, purchasing beans and peanuts to sell in Maputo and to take basic goods from Maputo to sell in the north. The business is currently doing well and he is motivated to invest his money to buy a truck for the business.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Abdallah Ahmede Razaque, nasceu em bangladesh na cidade de Sylhet a 37 anos aos 09 de Agosto de 1970, sustenta 3 pessoas e reside ainda na casa dos seus sogros, fez o ensino superior onde licenciou se em economia em Bangladesh. Viveu e cresceu num ambiente familiar com os pais e irmãos, sendo ele o segundo filho. A sua infância foi boa, uma vez que o pai é médico tinha uma vida razoável. Trabalhou em vária empresas como economista, mais porque o pais de origem foi envadido pela guerra acabou se refugiando para mocambique em 2000. Chegado em Moçambique, a vida foi dificil dado a diferença cultural e também porque deixou para atrás os familiares. Familiarizou se com algumas pessoas de origem asiática e foi assim que conseguiu adquirir a mercearia através das poupanças que efectuava na sua terra, casou-se com uma moçambicana. Dos clientes que tem aparecido na mercearia acabou fazendo amizades com um brigadeiro das FADM que lhe falou da existência da LHUVUKU decidiu fazer o empréstimo de para aumentar o vulume do seu negócio levantou e com sucessos conseguiu terminar o primeiro empréstimo. Agora pretende outro empréstimo para ampliar o seu negócio porque comprou mais uma mercearia e não dispoe de montantes suficiente para apetrechar a loja e também porque se aproxima a época festiva no mercado tem havido carência de produtos, é nessa óptica pretende comprar os produtos mais cedo possivel e apetrechar a mercearia. Durante a sua actividade tem adquirido mais experiência e também vai tendo novos horizontes para o seu negócio.Neste momento dispoe de 8 empregados dos quais cada um tem uma média de 4 filhos. Com o o rendimento da mercearia paga salários aos seus trabalhadores, os impostos, consegue comprar mais produtos e ainda cobre as suas despesas do seu dia a dia . Com o empréstimo de 160.000,00MTN ( cento e sessenta mil meticais),pretende comprar produtos de primeira necessidade para abastecer as duas mercearias. Quanto o seu negócio não existe nenhuma deficuldade porque dispõe de transporte próprio e quando não consegue ir por si fazer as compras manda os empregados. A esposa também tem contibuido muito para o sucesso do negócio do casal. A sua perspectiva futura passa necessariamente na expansão do seu negócio fazendo a exportacão e importação e ainda ir ao norte buscar feijão e amendiom para Maputo assim como levando de Maputo para o norte produtos de primeira necessidade. A fase actual do negócio é bom e está bastante motivado a angariar aos poucos dinheiro para comprar um camião.

loans.use: To increase stock to sell for Christmas

loans.name: Mulosharif

texts.en: Mulosharif R. lives in Mastchoh and he is married and has four children. Mulosharif R. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006 and he recommends himself as a serious and strongly-motivated client. His loan sums are permanently increased which shows his business's stability and his income increase. He has the wide-side business including livestock raising and selling, milk production and work out. He dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree bull and a milk cow for further meat and milk and sour-milk goods production (its supply to the bazaars and his family is secure by the milk and sour products). He plans to include in the assortment the following milk and sour products: pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd and etc. Now he requires a loan in 2500 STJ for a horn pedigree bull and a pedigree milk cow which will allow him to significantly increase his family's income and will also permits him to plan further business and a wider assortment of milk goods.

loans.use: Mulosharif would like to purchase a horn pedigree bull and a pedigree milk cow.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Mrs. Suon I., 42, works wI. her husband on a piece of land growing various kinds of vegetables like as tomatoes, cucumber, chili, radish, salads and so on. WI. this business activity, this couple can collectively earns around $3 each day in revenue from selling their outputs to a market. Additionally, this couple has six children. One of them is employed in a factory; three of which are construction workers and the rest of whom are too young to attend school. Mrs. Suon I. hopes to use this loan to purchase a piece of farmland to enable her expand a number of her crops because her current farmland is quite narrow so it’s so hard to grow more crops to meet her client demand.

loans.use: To purchase another piece of farmland to expand her crops.

loans.name: Igembe E Group

texts.en:
Nalma J., age 38, is married and has 5 children (ages, 18, 15, 10, 7, and 5). She earns income catching and selling fish which she does once a week. The business allows her to make a monthly profit of around US$3,414.

Nalma hopes to receive a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy fishing nets. She will share this loan with her sub-group members who have businesses in the sale of food products, pork, clothes, charcoal, pharmacy and grocery items, and fish.

In the picture, Nalma is the first one from the left.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing nets

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a married woman with 4 children, ages 8, 5 and 4. Safia is a cloth seller. She started her business in 2006. Every day Safia works from 10 A.M. to 3 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $40.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business

loans.name: Yaovi Hyacinthe

texts.fr:
Mr. Yaovi Hyacinthe E. was born April 5, 1984 in Tsévié, a town located about 35 kilometers outside of Lomé. A Bachelor, he works with his younger brother in a repair shop that they opened in Lomé in 2005. He purchases spare parts and then resells them to mechanics and motorcycle drivers. His first loan was for 300,000 FCFA which helped him to stock rims and Honda motorcycle tires. After paying back his first loan, Mr. E. is asking for a second loan of 400,000 FCFA in order to purchase 25 more tires, 10 Yamaha exhaust pipes, 2 containers of batteries, one container of rear-view mirrors and one container of helmets.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Monsieur E. Yaovi Hyacinthe est né le 05 avril 1984 à Tsévié, ville située à 35 km de Lomé. Célibataire, il travaille avec son petit frère dans sa boutique de pièces détachées qu’il a ouverte à Lomé depuis 2005. Son activité consiste à acheter les pièces détachées des engins à deux (2) roues et les revendre ,aux mécaniciens et conducteurs de motos. Le premier crédit qu’il a obtenu en 2007 d’un montant de 300.000 FCFA lui a permis de faire le stock de jantes et de pneus de moto de marque HONDA. Après avoir bien remboursé son premier crédit, Monsieur E. Yaovi Hyacinthe sollicite encore un crédit de 400.000 FCFA pour acquérir vingt cinq (25) pneus et dix (10) échappements de marque YAMAHA, deux (2) cartons de batteries, un (1) carton de rétroviseur et un (1) carton de casque.

loans.use: To purchase tires and exhaust pipes.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas O. is 40 years old, married with 5 children. She sells local gin and palm oil. She hails from Edo State, Nigeria and needs a loan of $350 to buy more palm oil for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more oil and local gin for sales

loans.name: Fei Autalavou's Group

texts.en:
The eight women from Fogapoa in this group work in five different businesses, growing and selling agricultural produce. They have had one loan from SPBD to get started, selling their produce in their village and in the market of the nearby town. These ladies are hard working and they are thankful to have this opportunity and the big change it has made in their familes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: fence, fry, oil, banana, purchase chemicals, wheel barrow, week killer, weed spray, bush knives, fertilizer

loans.name: Nohemi

texts.es:
Nohemi started her business to help her husband with family expenses. He has temporary work, and sometimes it does not go well, so she decided to help him with household expenses. She knew how to sew, and beginning with a small machine, she began approximately 8 years ago with simple garments. More recently she applied to make the uniforms for a primary/kindergarten school. The director has agreed to give her the work for summer, winter, and dress uniforms. Now she has an industrial machine and a serger, which help to make her work easier and faster.

She needs a loan of US$300, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy materials for blankets she is making and selling, as well as fabric to complete her uniform orders for the next school year. With your help, Nohemi will continue to increase her business.

Translated by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Nohemí inició el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia, ya que el tiene un trabajo eventual y en ocasiones no le va bien. Ella decidio ayudarle con los gastos de la casa por que tenia conocimientos de costura iniciando con una maquina pequeña comenzó hace aproximadamente 8 años con prendas sencillas posteriormente se ofrecio en una escuela primaria y un kinder a realizar los uniformes escolares donde la directora accedio a pasarle los trabajos de los uniformes de los niños tanto de verano, invierno y el de gala, ahora ya cuenta con una maquina industrial y una sobrehiladota las que le ayudan a hacer mas sencillo y rapido su trabajo.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar material de trabajo ya que esta confeccionando cobijas y las vende ademas de tela para adelantar pedidos de uniformes para el proximo año escolar. con tu ayuda Nohemi seguira haciendo crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To buy work materials

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr:
Mr. S. is a salesman at the Boucotte market located not far from the town centre. He only sells cosmetic products generally intended for women. Thanks to this business, he somehow manages to take care of his family. He requests this loan in order to strengthen his store.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

M. S., est un vendeur situe au marche boucotte non loin du centre ville. il ne vend que des produits cosmetiques adresses generalement aux femmes. Grace a cette activite, il parvient tant bien que mal a s'occupe de sa famille. Il sollicite ce pret pour renforcer son magasin.

loans.use: Sale of cosmetic products

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo inició el negocio para poder ayudar a su familia ya que falleció su papa y su hijo mayor nació con problemas de asma. Su principal necesidad era la de mantener a su mamá ya que se había quedado viuda y con hijos pequeños que mantener y pagarles su estudio; además que su hijo presentaba mayor al momento de su nacimiento presento problemas de bronquitis y asma los cuales se le complicaba muy seguido. El se dedica la compra y venta de llantas negocio que le ha redituado buena ganancias y le ha permitido salir adelante.

El necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar más llantas para el negocio y así hacer crecer las ventas y tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Gonzalo started his business to be able to help his family, given that he had lost his father, and because his oldest son was born with asthma problems. His primary concern was to support his widowed mother, who had young children to care for, and to pay for their school. Additionally, his son demonstrated breathing problems from birth in the form of bronchitis and asthma; the complications soon worsened. Gonzalo works in the purchase and sale of tires, a business that has brought him good earnings and has allowed him to get ahead.

Gonzalo needs a loan of $400 to be repaid within 6 months to purchase more tires for his business and thereby increase sales and have more income.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Holikul

texts.ru: Достов Холикул проживает в городе Яван. Работает учителем в средней школе. Кроме того занимается разведением и торговлей крупно рогатого скота. Занимается этим делом уже 13 лет. Обратился к нам за кредитом для того , чтобы купить пару молодых бычков. Откормив их он сможет их выгодно продать. Это даст возможность расширить свой бизнес. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 15 месяцев.Холикул женат и имеет шестерых детей.
texts.en:
Holikul D. lives in the town of Yavan. He works as a teacher in secondary school. Besides his job he also has a business of breeding and selling cattle. He has been in this business for the past thirteen years. He came to us for a loan so that he can buy a couple of young calves. By feeding them for a while he can later make a good profit. It will also let him expand his business. He plans to pay off the loan within 15 months. Holikul is also married and has six children.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime tiene 22 años, vive con su madre, hermanos y sus sobrinos, su padre falleció cuando era niño. Recuerda los viejos tiempos, cuando estaba vivo su padre sembraban en grandes cantidades, desde que falleció su madre había dejado de sembrar por falta de ayuda económica. Hace 10 años Jaime trabajaba para las chacras de los vecinos y le pagan a diario 15 soles, esto le permite mantener a su madre y sustentar la economía familiar. Le agrada la chacra y mejor si va sembrar su propio terreno, lo difícil, es la carencia de dinero, es por ello que sus terrenos están mucho tiempo sin  sembrar. Es el primer préstamo que solicita. Con este dinero comprará semilla de papa, porque  esta semilla produce en grandes cantidades y es comerciable, por arroba cuesta un aproximado de 14 soles.
texts.en:
Jaime is 22 years old and lives with his mother, siblings and nieces and nephews (his father died when Jaime was a boy). He remembers the old days, when his father was alive, they sowed in great quantities, but since the death of his father, his mother stopped sowing for lack of funds. Jaime works on his neighbors' small farms, going on 10 years now, where he is paid 15 soles daily in order to support his mother and contribute to the household finances. He enjoys the farm work and would prefer to be sowing his own land, which will be difficult as he lacks funds, and is why his own lands have lain unsown for so long. This is the first loan for which he has applied. With the money, he will buy potato seed which produces high yields and is a good seller; each 25-lb bag of seed costs approximately 14 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potato seed

loans.name: Maria Félix

texts.es:
La venta de ropa es el negocio al que se dedica la señora María Felix C. desde hace 11 largos años en el municipio de Chichigalpa de la ciudad de Chinandega. Su negocio lo ha venido desarrollando a través del tiempo y por este motivo ha logrado brindarle las condiciones necesarias a sus pequeños hijos.

La razón por la cual la señora María Felix solicita un crédito es para la compra de mercadería como ropa para caballeros, damas y niños de diferentes estilos para su respectiva comercialización. Es por esta razón que continúa esperando en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con dicho crédito para mejora de su negocio.
texts.en:
María Felix C. has been dedicated to the business of selling clothing for eleven long years in the district of Chichigalpa in the city of Chinandega. She has developed her business over time. For this reason, she has been able to offer the living conditions necessary to her young children. The reason for which María Felix is requesting a loan is to buy merchandise such as men's, women's and children's clothing of different styles to be sold. It is for this reason that she continues to have faith in Ceprodel, so that she will be the beneficiary of this loan to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Chadulu H Group

texts.en:
Beatrice M. has been selling drinks in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for one year. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more materials to grow her business.

Beatrice is 32 years old and single with two children, who are four and nine. She also takes care of other two additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members Elica, Hawa, Christina, and Maria. Each woman also has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To more drinks to sell in her business.

loans.name: Esperanza Y Progreso V Group

texts.en:
Maria B. is the group coordinator for the Esperanza y Progreso V Bank of Hope in San Pedro de Macoris. The requested loan will be distributed among the nine members of this group, who run various businesses. 

Maria has seven children. Her business is selling fried foods. She would use her portion of the loan to purchase supplies. Her dream is to open her own restaurant where she would server her fried chicken and other dishes and in this way become self-sufficient.  Thank you for supporting this group!

loans.use: To buy supplies for a catering business

loans.name: Muritala

texts.en: Muritala A. is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Ogbomosho, Oyo state, Nigeria. She sells palm oil in wholesale and retail. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more palm oil to sell. The demands for her palm oil are high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Seum

texts.en: Seum S., 34, is married and lives with one young child in the Siem Reap province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$5 each day. They also raise pigs and make rice wine. In light of today's economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$400 to purchase a cow. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Lois

texts.en:
Lois S. is 45 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She sells groceries from a store in her house. She sells items like cooked ingredients, sweets, and plastic products. Most of her clients are villagers who live near her house.

To help with the family's expenses, her husband works as a motorcycle taxi driver. The family has five children who are single and are studying in the secondary school.

S. is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle to support her business. She will use the remainder of the loan to increase her grocery inventory.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Mutaramhon

texts.ru: Мутарамхон, молодая швея и модельер женских национальных платьев.Она кредитуется уже четвёртый год. У неё сейчас две ученицы, которым она учит вышивке.Для увеличения весенних материалов она решила получить очередной кредит.Её кредитная история положительная и хороший моральный облик.Поэтому она без проблем может получить очередной займ для своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Mutaramhon is a young seamstress and designer of women's traditional dresses. This is the fourth year she has taken out a loan. At present she has two apprentices whom she is teaching to sew. Mutaramhon decided to take out her next loan to increase her stock of spring fabrics. Her credit history is excellent and she is of good moral character, making her a good candidate for another business loan.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sewing of women's clothing

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Mrs. Lita J. is a 61-year-old from Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married to a farmer and blessed with nine children: seven married; two single and studying.

She started her business with a minimal amount only. Being a member of Paglaum MPC, she is able to acquire additional capital for her sari-sari store (general store). She is coping well with the challenges of her business because it requires hard work and patience. Determination in life is what she has. Heart’s desire is to expand the business so that the children will be able to finished college and have a brighter future.

loans.use: To be used as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 24 years old and lives in Barangay Natappian, West Solana, Cagayan. She is married to Juan I., who is 28 years old and a simple farmer in their village. She has one child who is still young and does not yet attend school. Juanita runs a general store and has struggled to expand it because she lacks the capital to make improvements. She is requesting a loan to get working capital to make these improvements happen. With this loan, Juanita plans to buy more groceries in bulk and more of the items in highest demand among her customers, such soft drinks, cosmetics, canned goods, soaps and other items. 

She hopes to expand her business because she knows this can help improve her family's life. She says that the loan she is requesting will be paid back through hard work and perseverance so she may succeed. Juanita also hopes to provide the child she has now and any others she may have in the future with better education. She is praying that her loan request is granted soon.

loans.use: To improve her small grocery store

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Angélica García vive en casa propia, en la zona  de las Lomas, área periférica de la ciudad de La Paz, con sus dos hijas.
La señora Angélica es comerciante, vendiendo textos escolares en un puesto de venta ambulante.
Su vivienda, por la antigüedad de la construcción presenta fisuras en su patio, lo que ocasiona filtraciones de agua en los cimientos en época de lluvia.
El crédito solicitado es para el vaciado de carpeta de hormigón en el patio de su vivienda.
Esta es la novena vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Angélica García lives in her own house with her two daughters in the Llomas zone, an area adjacent to the city of La Paz. Angélica is a merchant; she sells schoolbooks as a street vendor. Her home, due to old construction, now has cracks in the patio, which causes water to filter to the foundation during the rainy season. The loan that she is requesting is to drain and excavate the layer of concrete that is damaged on the patio of her housing. This is her ninth loan request and because she has favorably met the financial analysis criteria she has been approved for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for the cost of purchasing cement and sand, plus the cost of labor to make the improvement to her house’s patio.

loans.name: Milton

texts.es: Milton tiene 23 años, es muy trabajador y responsable, hace 3 años vive con la madre de su hijo de un año en una casa de madera que él mismo construyó. Desde muy joven se dedica a la siembra de cacao, plátano y frutos cítricos, asimismo algunas veces trabaja como peón para sus vecinos, haciéndolo desde las 4 de la mañana hasta el medio día, porque luego de estas horas el calor intenso no le permite trabajar cómodamente, ya que su labor es abrir surcos, quitar las malezas y dejar limpias las chacras. De acuerdo al área trabajada cobra entre 150 y 300 soles, en ciertas oportunidades le pagan 17 soles diarios. Pero cuando sus propios productos están a punto de ser cosechados se dedica a preparar su carga para que cada fin de semana pueda comercializarlos a diversos mercados. En ciertas ocasiones llegan compradores hasta su chacra y aprovecha en vender por arrobas, que consiste en 12 kilos de plátanos y de ese modo acumula mayores ingresos. A Milton lo llena de regocijo ser agricultor, por eso se propone seguir trabajando duro hasta alcanzar una vida muy cómoda. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, en los ciclos concluidos ha demostrado responsabilidad y voluntad de pago, asimismo reitera ese mismo compromiso para este préstamo. El dinero que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de 10 sacos de fertilizante, considera que le costará un aproximado de 900 a 1000 soles, con el resto de dinero comprará machetes y herramientas agrícolas.
texts.en:
Milton, 23, is very hard working and responsible. For three years he has lived with his one year old son’s mother. They live in a wood house that he built himself. From a very young age he has planted cocoa, bananas, and citrus fruit. Sometimes he works as a field worker for his neighbors. He does this from four in the morning until midday because later than midday the sun is so intense you cannot work comfortably. His job is to plow, weed, and clean the farms. According to the area worked, he charges between 150 and 300 PEN. Sometimes he is paid 17 PEN a day. But when his own products are ready to be harvested, he works preparing them so that every week end he can sell them to various markets. Sometimes buyers come to his farm and he takes advantage of selling by “arrobas”, which consist of 12 kilos of bananas. This way he accumulates greater income. It fills Milton with joy to be a farmer. Therefore, he plans to continue working hard until he reaches a more comfortable life. This is his fifth loan with MFP. In previous loan cycles he has demonstrated responsibility and willingness to pay. He reiterates the same promise with this loan. With the loan he is asking for he plans to buy ten sacks of fertilizer, which will cost approximately 900-1,000 PEN. He will use the rest of the money to buy machetes and farming tools.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and tools

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is a 45-year-old woman; she is divorced with five children who are currently in school. As a single parent she works very hard to support her children.

Felicia is an achiever and a resourceful woman. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living. She has been selling bananas and groundnuts in the community market for more than three years now. She treks to surrounding villages to purchase bulk stocks of bananas from the farmers to retail to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to pick up enough stock to make enough profit to support her family. She wants to use part of the profit to buy other fruits that are frequently requested by her customers.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk supplies of bananas and peanuts to enable her to scale up her sales. She believes the loan would enable her to save more income to support her business growth and the children's education.

loans.use: To purchase  bananas and grocery products for resale

loans.name: Primera De Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo Primera de Dios está integrado por María Luisa M. R., Damaso Viva y Xiomara H. ellos viven en el propio Nindirí que es una zona urbana.

La coordinadora del grupo es la señora María Luisa M. R. quien al ver que su hijo necesitaba ayuda con su negocio de calzado  tuvo la iniciativa de vender los zapatos que su mismo hijo fabrica. Actualmente esta señora de 47 años por medio de este negocio ha logrado ser independiente y ayudarle a su primogénito.

El otro integrante del grupo es Damaso Viva de 53 años de edad quien es agricultor. El cultiva  granos básicos  como arroz, frijoles y maíz que son productos del consumo diario del nicaragüense y que luego vende. Mientras que su otra compañera de grupo la joven Xiomara H.  vende ropa económica que distribuye en su localidad.
texts.en:
The members of the group “Primera de Dios” are María Luisa M. R., Damaso Viva, and Xiomara H.. They live in the city of Nindirí, which is an urban area.

The coordinator for the group is Sra. María Luisa M. R., who saw that her son needed help with his shoe business so she took the initiative to sell the shoes that he made. This 47 year old woman has managed to achieve independence and help her firstborn child with this business.

Another member of the group is Damaso Viva. He is a 53 year old farmer. He cultivates and sells grains such as rice, beans and maize. These are products that are consumed on a daily basis in Nicaragua.

The final member of the group is a young woman named Xiomara H.. She sells affordable clothing throughout the area.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital
